z:row.description: AGOO 3, 1982 Station is in the island of Luzon, province of La Union, town of ìAgoo, about 2.3 km. SE of Agoo on the summit of Mt. Agoo which is ìabout 276 m high. The peak is reachable from a point at about 2 ìkm. SE of the town of Agoo where a good trail can be followed ìleading to the ridge and then N to the station. Station mark is a ìcross cut on a 5/8" dia. brass rod set flush on top of a standard ìconcrete monument which protrudes about 10.2 cm. above the ground ìwith inscription "AGOO 1982" and a triangle surrounding the mark. ìNo reference mark was established.
AGOO CHURCH BELFTY 2, 1967 The apex of the belfry of the church in the town of Agoo.

AGOO NORTH BASE, 1952 Is located approx. 1 km. S of Agoo, 0.91 m. W of the pavement of ìthe national highway No.3 and is a bronze disk stamp "Corps of ìEngrs., US Army" and set in concrete 7.6 cm. below the surface of ìthe ground. RM No.1 is the corner of the bridge, azimuth 155°, ìdistant 91.2 m. RM No.2 is the centerline of the road, azimuth ì60°, distant 3.6 m.

AGOO SOUTH BASE, 1952 Is located approx. 2.5 km. S of Agoo, 0.91 m. W of the pavement ìof the national highway No.3. Station is a bronze disc set in ìconcrete, 4 in. below the surface of the ground and is stamp ì"Corps of Engrs., US Army". RM No.1 is the intersection of the ìcenterline of the roads, azimuth 350°, distant 13.9 m. RM No.2 is ìthe centerline of the fence, azimuth 179°, distant 11.1 m. RM ìNo.3 is a frame dwelling, azimuth 102°, distant 23.5 m.
AGOO WATER TANK, 1967 The apex of the elevated water tank inside the Philippine Virgina ìTobacco Administration compound of Agoo.
AGUILAR CHURCH BELL TOWER, 1905-67 Is the center of the bell tower of the church in the town of ìAguilar.

AHA, 1958 On the west coast of Luzon, in the province of Pangasinan, on ìCabarruyan Island on a bluff about 0.83 kilometer northwest of ìPorobaboy Island, three meters in shore or east of the edge and ìabout 6 meters above MHW line. Mark is the center of a cross-cut ìon top of a 1/2-inch diameter brass roe embedded in a drilled ìhole on top of a rock with cement putty around and inscription ì"AHA 1958 PC&GS".

AILA, 1977 Is on the W coast of Luzon, Bolinao Harbor (Bolinao Mainland) at ìBo. Luciente I. The station is at the edge of a prominent bare ìhill about 60 ft. high, ENE of Port Bolinao Lighthouse and 40 m. ìaway from the highwater line. It is distinct with patches of ìcoral boulders. Station mark is a cross cut on top of a 1/2 in. ìdia. brass rod drilled and cemented on a coral rock and marked ì"AILA, 1977, PCGS". RM Nos.1 and 2 are similar. It is the head of ì3 in. C.W. nail nailed and cemented on a coral rock with an arrow ìpointing towards the station and marked "RM 1" and "RM 2", ìrespectively. RM No.1 is 8.81 m. from the station with azimuth ì313° 14.1'. RM No.2 is 8.89 m. from the station with azimuth 29° ì46.2'.
ALAMINOS CBT, 1902-04-51 Is the center of the tower of the church in the town of Alaminos.

AL-III, 1951 Is a CE bronze disk set in concrete 1 ft. below the road surface ìin the municipality of Alaminos. Station is NE of Alaminos ìChurch. RM No.1 is a 13 ft. power pole. RM No.2 is the S end of a ì26.6 ft. culvert. RM No.3 is the N end of a 30.6 ft. culvert.

ALO, 1958 Is on the W coast of Luzon, in Pangasinan province, on the W most ìedge of Alo Island. Mark is the center of a crosscut on top of a ì1/2 in. dia. brass rod embedded on top center of a 10 in. square ìconcrete monument with its surface flushed to the ground with a ìcircle circumscribed on the mark and with the inscription "ALO ì1958 PC&GS".

ALOG, 1904 Is on Mt. Simenbaan which is about 1 km. W of Bo. Simenbaan. The ìbest route is from Bo. Alos, but it may be approached from Burgos ìover a difficult trail. The station is near the S edge of the ìsummit. Subsurface mark is a bottle buried vertically with neck ìup 45 cm. beneath the surface. It was witnessed by 3 bottles ìburied in a horizontal position necks pointing towards the ìstation. The four bottles were surrounded by a circular ditch, ì1.2 m. in radius and 15 cm. deep.

ALOS II, 1951 To reach the station from Mabini, proceed N along highway no.7 to ìthe first jeep trail leading E. Follow this trail toward a lone ìconical hill with a small peak. Trail passes the peak on SW edge. ìStation is located on the high point of the peak, 18 in. below ìthe crest on the E side. Station mark is a bronze disc marked ì"ALOS", set in concrete, 10 in. below the ground surface.

ALPHA, 1901 Is on the first rocky point N of the town of Sual. The station is ìon the rocks about 1.3 m. above mean sea level. Station mark is a ìcopper bolt set in the rock. Directly back of the station was a ìdwarfed tree, on the near side of which was cut a triangle, ìdistant 5.85 m. from the station. The tree, the station, and ìMangas Pt. are on range.

AME, 1958 Is on the W coast of Luzon, in Pangasinan province, in Tambac Bay ìin the vicinity of Namooran Pt. Station is on a point along the ìdike about 30 m. E of the N corner of the offshore fish pond ìdike. Mark is the center of crosscut on top of a 1/2 in. dia. ìbrass rod embedded on top center of a 10 in. square monument and ìwith a circle circumscribed in it and with inscription "AME 1958 ìPC&GS".

AND, 1958 Is on the W coast of Luzon, in Pangasinan province, in Cabarruyan ìIsland on a small island 1 mile S of the stone landing leading ìtowards the town of Anda. Station is at the center of the island ìand about 2 m. from the SE edge of the island. Mark is the center ìof a crosscut on top of a 1/2 in. dia. brass rod embedded in a ìdrill hole on a rock about 1 m. dia. with cement putty around and ìwith a circle circumscribed in it and with inscription "AND 1958 ìPC&GS".

ANDA, 1979 Is on the N coast of Tombac Bay, in Anda, Pangasinan, Cabaruyan ìIsland. It is on top of a bare and a rocky hill overlooking ìTombac Bay about 1 km. W of Anda town proper. To reach the ìstation from the Anda town proper, take the road leading to the ìAnda Municipal Cemetery near the SW coast of Cabaruyan Island. ìFrom the cemetery, the bare hill is about 300 m. SW with patches ìof coral rocks. Mark is a 1 cm. dia. steel bolt set on top of a ì30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument with inscriptions on top ì"ANDA".

ANGGIE, 1977 Is on the W coast of Luzon, Bolinao Harbor, province of ìPangasinan, municipality of Bolinao, at the W most side of the ìend of Binabalian Pt., Santiago Island, SE of Bolinao landing ìplace. The shore near the station is rocky with large detached ìcoral boulders rising from the water for 5 m. on either side of ìthe station. The station is on a flat circular coral rock with ìrough and irregular top 1.3 m. above the water. Station mark is a ìcrosscut at the center of a 1/2 in. dia. brass rod drilled and ìcemented at the center of this circular rock and marked "ANGGIE, ì1977, PCGS". RM No.1 is 6.65 m. from the station with azimuth ì220° 4.3'. RM No.2 is 8.53 m. from the station with azimuth 229° ì25.1'. RM No.3 is 12.67 m. from the station with azimuth 168° ì5.3'.

ARBOLEDAN, 1954 On the W coast of Luzon, in the province of Ilocos Norte, in the ìmunicipality of Currimao, at the S edge of a plateau at the top ìof Arboledan Pt. about 30 m. N of the S edge which is steep-to. ìStation can be reached from the town by a footrail on the E slope ìof the point. Station mark is the cross cut on top of a 3/8" ìbrass rod set in a cement patty on top of a coral rock outcrop ìabout 0.5 m. in dia. RM No.1 is a porcelain plug set in a cement ìputty on top of a coral rock outcrop, 7.28 m. distant, in azimuth ì272° 22' 51" from the station. "RM 1" and an arrow pointing ìtowards the station are inscribed. RM No.2 is a similar mark ì7.242 m. distant, in azimuth 28° 39' 9" from the station. "RM 2" ìand an arrow pointing towards the station are inscribed.
ARINGAY, 1982 Not recoverable.

ASO, 1903-15 On top of a grassy knoll, with rocky outcroppings, on the S part ìof the same range of hills on which are located stations "Sungo" ìand "Ugsa". It is 4 km. S of Cape Bojeador Lighthouse. The knoll ìis the highest in that vicinity, showing from all directions as a ìrounded dome. The station "Bojeador South Base" shows just clear ìof the N end of a clump of trees on a distant, wooded ridge near ìBo. Dirique. Station mark is a drill hole in the top of the ìledge, covered by a cairn of rocks.

AWILI, 1979 Is on the SW coast of Cabarruyan Island in Anda, Pangasinan. On a ìpoint at Tombac Bay in Brgy. Awile, it is about 400 m. N of the ìpoint and W of fish ponds situated on a cove. To reach the staion ìfrom Anda town proper, take the road to Tori-Tori Pt. and stop at ìBrgy. Awile right after the elementary school. Then follow the ìcart road SW up to the end of the road. There's a trail leading ìto the point. Mark is a 1.27 cm. dia. brass rod and cemented in a ìdrilled hole on top of a coral rock boulder with inscriptions on ìtop, "AWILI, BCGS, 1979".

BAC, 1958 Is on the W coast of Luzon, in Pangasinan province, on the ìhighest part of Tambac Island. Station is on top of a big stone, ìthe biggest in the vicinity. Mark is the center of a crosscut on ìtop of a 1/2 in. dia. brass rod embedded in a drill hole in the ìrock with cement putty around and with a circle circumscribed on ìit and with inscription "BAC 1958 PC&GS".

BACAO, 1903 On the highest part of a mountain known locally by the same name. ìIt is 1.3 km. W of the town of Santiago and 0.6 km. N of the ìinner portion of the shore line of Santiago Cove. It is the ìhighest part and the S end of a range running to San Esteban ìHarbor. The mountain is 159 m. high, covered with bush, and very ìrocky on top. Station mark is a shallow drill hole in the N end ìof the solid rock at the summit. On a higher part of the same ìrock, at the distance of 2 m., a rough cross was cut.
BACARRA CBT, 1903-52 The center of the bell tower of the church at Bacarra. This tower ìis a round-topped one standing about 40 m. N of the NW corner of ìthe church.

BACK, 1901 Is on a point on the mainland directly W of Panaen Island. The ìshore at this point consists of fragments of coral rock and is ìoverhang by trees. The station is upon a rock 4 m. outside high ìwatermark. The rock slopes towards the W, the W edge being awash ìat high tide. The station is 98 cm. from the NE point of the rock ìand 60 cm. from the opposite edge. It is also 98 cm. from the SE ìpoint and 91 cm. from the NW. A large rock rising 1 m. out of ìwater is 5.8 m. distant, in azimuth 319°. A large boulder 4 m. ìhigh rests against the bank at high waterrmark, 5 m. S of the ìstation. Station mark is a copper bolt in the flat coral rock. ìWitness mark is a triangle cut on the trunk of a tree standing at ìhigh watermark due W of the station, distant 11.2 m.
BACNOTAN CHURCH N SPIRE, 1974 Is the center of the spire on top of the N bell tower of the ìcatholic church in the town of Bacnotan.
BACNOTAN CHURCH SPIRE, 1974 Is the center of the spire on the S bell tower of the catholic ìchurch in the town of Bacnotan.
BACNOTAN CHURCH CROSS, 1974 Is the top of the cross on the central tower of the catholic ìchurch in the town of Bacnotan.
BACNOTAN CHURCH TOWER, 1903 The center of the top of the tower of the church in the town of ìBacnotan.

BADOC 2, 1954 On the NW coast of Luzon, N of the center of Badoc Island, Ilocos ìNorte, on the highest point of the island. Station is easily ìreached from the E side of the island from a point about 0.7 mile ìW of Solot Pt. Station mark is 3/8" brass rod set almost flush ìwith the surface of a concrete monument 1.1 ft. square at the ìtop, with the inscription "BADOC 2, 1954". Subsurface mark is a ìcoca-cola bottle buried in an upright position 30 cm. below the ìground. Reference mark (RM) No.1 is a porcelain plug set flush ìwith the surface of a conrete monument 0.9 ft. square at the top ìwith the inscription RM 1 and and an arrow pointing to the ìstation. The distance from the station is 13.35 m., 334° 17' 35" ìin azimuth. RM No.2 is a porcelain plug set flush with the ìsurface of a concrete monument 1 ft. square at the top with the ìinscription "RM No.2" and an arrow pointing to the station. The ìdistance from the station is 12.144 m., 192° 26' 28 in azimuth. ìWitness mark is a large cross with a drill hole at the ìintersection on the top of a large coral head lying close to the ìtop of the cliff W of the station. This is the highest rock in ìthis vicinity although considerably lower than the station. The ìdistance to the station is 59.605 m.

BADOC CHURCH BELL TOWER, 1903-54 The station is the center of the bell tower on the church in the ìtown of Badoc. It is on the W side of the S front of the church. ìThe town is prominent. The position of the bell tower as ìdetermined by the party plots about 30 m. S of its published ìposition. The new position is checked by a sextant 3-point fix ìtaken atop the bell tower itself. It is believed that in the ìprevious triangulation the sacristy N of the church bell tower ìwas sighted. This sacristy is now destroyed but was rather ìprominent and higher than the church then. It is recommended that ìthe new position of the bell tower be accepted and that the name ìof the station be changed into "BADOC CHURCH BELL TOWER, 1954".

BAG, 1958 Is on the W coast of Luzon, in the province of Pangasinan, in ìCabarruyan Island on the shore about 0.7 km. E of Porobaboy ìIsland and 0.46 km. SW of Bo. San Isidro, about 10 ft. offshore ìof the MHW line. Mark is center of a crosscut on top of a 1/2 in. ìdia. brass rod drilled hole on top of a rock with cement putty ìaround and inscription "BAG 1958 PC&GS".
BALAOAN CHURCH TOWER, 1903 The center of the tower of the church in the town of Balaoan.

BALD, 1903-72 In N Luzon, province of Ilocos Sur, municipality of Santa Cruz, ì3.2 km. SE of Bo. Sevilla, on a 402 m. prominent held peak, on ìthe summit of the first ridge. The station is on a rounded knoll ìcovered with grass. To reach the station from Tagudin, proceed N ìalong the national highway. Upon reaching Bo. Tampogo, follow a ìcreek which leads to the foot of the mountain and from thence a ìtrail goes over to the summit of the ridge. A certain Mr. Corpus ìfrom the FILMAG Compd. knows the station very well. Station mark ìis a drilled hole on top of an irregularly shaped rock projecting ìabout 7.5 cm. above the ground. Subsurface mark is the center of ìa bottle buried at a depth of 75 cm. directly below the station ìmark.

BALI, 1977 Is on the W coast of Luzon, Bolinao Harbor, province of ìPangasinan, municipality of Bolinao, on the W extremity of ìBalingasay Pt., 200 m. NNE of Bolinao School of Fisheries main ìbuilding. The point is of rough coral rock and about 15 m. W of a ìsmall island. The station is reach by taking a road leading to ìBolinao School of Fisheries or by motorized banca direct to the ìpoint. The station is the cross cut on top of a 1/2 in. dia. ìbrass rod embedded and set flushed on a cement patty 1 in. above ìthe rock surface. The rock is elevated about 1/2 m. from the ìwater. The station is marked "BALI, 1977 BCGS". RM Nos.2 and 3 ìare similar and is the center of a 3 in. c.w. nail embedded and ìset flush on a cement putty on top of a rock and with an arrow ìpointing to the station mark. They are marked "RM 1", "RM 2" and ì"RM 3", respectively. RM No.1 is 9.451 m. from the station, with ìazimuth 330° 55.93'. RM No.2 is 9.299 m. from the station, with ìazimuth 359° 47.35'. RM No.3 is 7.927 m. from the station, with ìazimuth 44° 39.33'.

BALINGAOAN, 1903 In the barrio of the same name on the highest of the group of ìhill which lies about 4.5 km. N of Candon, on the W side of the ìroad to Santa Maria. It is about 1 km. W of the road and 2 km. E ìof the beach. The station is on a sharp prominent peak and ìcommands a fine view of the whole valley about Candon. The peak ìis covered with bushes and small trees. A good trail leads from ìthe main road near a small barrio to the top of the peak. Station ìmark is a drill hole in top of a rock set flush with the surface ìof the gorund. Subsurface mark is a bottle buried 60 cm. below ìthe ground.

LUN-1 = BALL 1902 Is on top of a small hill 1.5 km. SE of San Fernando Airport 1.3 km. S of Canaoay Elem. School, and 200 m. E of Mr. Antonio Jucutan's house. Travel time from San Fernando, La Union town proper is 10 min. up to the foot of the hill and from the foot of the hill to the station is approx. 5 min. walk. Station mark; old station was recovered and refurbished. A 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod was set in standard concrete block protruding 15 cm. above natural ground and inscribed with station name. 4 Reference marks (RM) are brass rods set in concrete blocks and inscribed RM-1, 2, 3 & 4.

BALL NORTH BASE, 1952 Is a bronze disk set in a cement below the ground on the E side ìof California Ave. in Bo. San Vicente. RM No.1 is a small bushy ìtree, distant 66 ft., in azimuth 330°. RM No.2 is a junction of ìsmall path and edge of the avenue, distant 36 ft., in azimuth ì135°. RM No.3 is station "Ball", distant 1,500 ft., in azimuth ì220°.

BALL SOUTH BASE, 1952 Is a bronze disk set in the cement inside of a 6 in. steel tube, ì4.5 in. below the ground, 15 ft. E of the centerline of ìCalifornia Ave. in Bo. San Vicente. RM No.1 is a large bamboo ìclump, distant 50 ft., in azimuth 2°. RM No.2 is a large ìirregular rock with drill hole, 1.5 in. deep and 0.5 in. in dia., ìdistant 10 ft., in azimuth 120°. RM No.3 is the centerline of the ìold road and edge of the avenue, distant 255 ft., in azimuth ì300°.

BALUNGAO, 1905=71 Is in Central Luzon, province of Pangasinan, municipality of ìBalungao on the sharp, cone-shaped, isolated peak called Mt. ìBalungao, 7.5 km. in azimuth 194° from the hill on which station ì"Cuyapo" is situated. The trail from the town of Cuyapo leads ìthrough the Bos. Sabit and San Vicente, and thence up to the ìstation. San Vicente is at the foot of the peak on the SW side. ìStation mark is a drill hole in a large rock at the summit. ìSubsurface mark is the center of the mouth of a bottle buried 0.9 ìm. deep. RM No.1 is a cross chiseled on a boulder, 3.45 m., in ìazimuth 171° 38'. RM No.2 is a 1 in. circle chiseled on a firmly ìset rock about 1 m. lower than the station mark, 5.105 m. ìdistant, in azimuth 221° 45'. RM No.3 is a 5 in. nail driven into ìa tree trunk, about 5 ft. above the ground, 11.11 m. distant, in ìazimuth 202° 22'. RM No.4 is a 5 in. nail driven into a tree ìtrunk, about 5 ft. above the ground, 4.907 m. distant, in azimuth ì313° 33'. RM No.5 is a 5 in. nail in the center of a cross ìchiseled on a firmly embedded rock, 4.051 m. distant, in azimuth ì26° 37'.

BAN, 1952 Is located on top of a grass hill about 7 km. W of Banna. It is a ìbrass plate marked "Corps of Engrs., US Army". RM-1 is an "X" ìmarked on a rock, 29.4 ft. NE of the station. RM-2 is an "X" ìmarked on a rock with an arrow pointing toward the station and ì109.5 ft. SE from the station.

BANA, 1967-68 Is on the W coast of Luzon, province of Pangasinan, town of San ìFabian on the highest and E most of the three peaks at Bo. ìBanaba. To reach the station from San Jacinto, Pangasinan, ìproceed NW along the gravel road to Lubang Elem. School. Then ìturn NW and ford a river to Bo. Binday. Thence follow another ìgravel road NE to Bo. Calasiao where a foot trail leads up to the ìstation on the highest peak. Station mark is a cross cut on top ìof a 1/2" dia. brass rod embedded on top of a concrete monument ì10 in. square by 1-1/2 ft. protruding 3 in. above the ground. ì"BANA, 1967, PC&GS" is inscribed on top of the monument. ìUnderground mark is a copper nail at the center of the mouth of a ìbottle neck set in a concrete mass 4" thick. RM No.1 is a copper ìnail embedded on a concrete mass flush with the ground. "RM-1" ìand an arrow pointing to the station are inscribed on top of the ìmass distant 11.35 m., in azimuth 248° 36' 25" from RM No.2 ì(lost). RM No.3 is similar to RM No.1 and is correspondingly ìmarked. Distant 12.5 m., in azimuth 122° 41' 55" from the ìstation. RM No.4 is an iron spike embedded on top center of a 15 ìcm. dia. PLS concrete monument and located 11.65 m. from the ìstation.

BANGAR, 1903 On the first range of hills back of the beach, on a bald peak 271 ìm. high which line 4.5 km. SE of Bangar and the same distance S ìof the gap where the Amburayan River flows through the mountains. ìThere is another somewhat higher bald peak about 0.8 km. to the ìN. These hills are smooth and grass-covered with very little ìrock. A road from Bangar toward the E passes around the N foot of ìthese hills and a good trail branches off and leads up over the ìhill passing close to the station. Subsurface mark is a drill ìhole in a small rock buried 75 cm. Station mark is a drill hole ìin a rock set into the ground with its top projecting about 5 ìcm.
BANGAR CHURCH TOWER, 1903 The center of the tower of the church in the town of Bangar.

BANTAY, 1903-45 It is about 6 km. NE of of the town of Bangui and 7.5 km. SSE of ìDialao Pt., on a rather prominent bare hill 153 m. high. The ìstation is on the highest part of the hill. Station mark is a ìdrill hole in a large stone buried flush with the ground surface. ìA small cairn of rocks was built over the station.

BANTAY CBT, 1952 Station is the cross in the center of the dome on top of the bell ìtower of the old ruin church in the town of Bantay, on the ìopposite side of the river from Vigan. The tower is brick and ìstone, about 15 m. high on the slight rise, 60 m. N of the ìchurch.

BAR, 1958 Is on the W coast of Luzon, in Pangasinan Province, on Cabarruyan ìIsland, in Caquiputan Strait, on top of the point about 205 m. E ìof the N tip of Rao Island and about 23 m. inshore of the MHW ìline. Station can be easily reached from a landing on the N part ìof the point. Mark is the center of a crosscut on top of a 1/2 ìin. dia. brass rod embedded on the top center of an 8 in. square ìconcrete monument with a circle circumscribed in it and with ìinscription "BAR 1958 PC&GS".

BARBARA, 1982 Is in the island of Luzon, province of La Union, town of Agoo, ìBrgy. Sta. Barbara about 3 km. W of Agoo town proper, 75 m. S of ì"Annak Ti Mangalap Cooperative Store" and 1.5 m. from the sea ìwall. Station is located on the W boulder of the concrete road ìleading to Brgy. Narvacan. Station mark is a cross cut on a 5/8 ìdia. brass rod set flush on top of a standard concrete monument ìwhich protrudes about 7.5 cm. above the ground. Inscribed on the ìsurface of the concrete monument is a triangle surrounding the ìmark and "BARBARA 1982". No reference mark was established.

BAROTO, 1902 Is on Cabarruyan Island on the first point N of the ferry ìlanding. This point is also due E of the N end of the first ìisland from the S entrance to Caquiputan Strait. The point is ìcovered with brush and trees to the E and NE are wooded hills. ìStation mark is a 2 cm. hole drilled 8 cm. deep in an irregular ìcoral rock. Two coral rocks are situated 0.9 m. NE and 0.8 m. S ìof the station, respectively. Witness marks are two triangles cut ìon the trunks of trees 0.9 m. above the ground, one 5.55 m. SE of ìthe station, the other 4 m. E of the station.

BARREQUERA, 1903-05 On one of the knolls at the W end of a range of low hills which ìlie between Candon and Santa Lucia. It is 0.6 km. E of the main ìroad and 3 cm. N of Santa Lucia. A road branching off the main ìroad at the foot of the hill leads up on the ridge beyond the ìstation, passing about 60 m. to the E of the latter. The station ìis on a sharp, little peak on the NW side of the hill and just ìabove a native house in the valley. A clump of bamboo is the only ìtimber on the hill. Subsurface mark is a bottle buried 0.9 m. ìbelow the surface. Station mark is an irregualarly shaped rock ìwith a drill hole in its top, set flush with the surface of the ìground.

BATAC, 1903-54 It is about 2.5 km. S of the town of Batac, on the 77.42 m. high ìridge about 400 m. E of the National Highway No.3. To reach the ìstation proceed along this highway up to the group of houses ìabout 50 m. N of km. Post No.467. From this group of houses ìfollow a well-marked trail leading up to the ridge where the ìstation is located. Station mark is the cross cut on the top of a ì3/8" dia. brass rod set in a hole drill on top of a 15 cm. in ìdia. stone. The stone is surrounded with a cement putty shaped ìinto a 27.9 cm. square concrete monument projecting 5.1 cm. above ìthe ground, with the words "BATAC 1903". Reference mark (RM) No.1 ìis a cross cut inside a circle etched on top of a concrete ìmonument and with an arrow pointing towards the station, distant ì7.246 m. 254° 56' in azimuth. RM No.2 is a similar mark 12.2 m. ì15° 37' in azimuth. RM No.3 is a porcelain plug set in a concrete ìmonument "RM 3" and an arrow pointing to the station distant with ìinscription 9.562 m., 94° 55' in azimuth.

BATO, 1903-15 Close to the beach 3 km. W of Bo. Pasaleng, and close to the W ìbank of the only stream of any size flowing from the cliffs to ìthe W of Pasaleng. The stream is some 600 m. NW of a point of ìrocks extending about 150 m. into the sea. The station is about ì25 m. from the stream and about 20 m. from high watermark. It is ìon top of a large, dark purple boulder about 4 m. long x 2.5 m. ìwide, lying with its topo nearly level. Station mark is a drill ìhole almost in the center of the top of the boulder. There are ìsome natural holes in the rock, but none likely to be mistaken ìfor the station.
BAUANG CHURCH, NORTHEAST GABLE, 1902-03 The NE gable of the church in the town of Bauang.

BAYAMBANG, 1904 Is on top of Mt. Bayambang about 4 km. SE of Bo. Eguia, 1.6 km. S ìof the Tanglao River and about 3 km. W of Bo. Bayambang. It is ìbetween the Tanglao and Bayambang Rivers, at an elevation of 177 ìm. Station mark is a drill hole in a solid rock. Witness marks in ìthe shape of triangles were cut in three trees distant 1.35 m., ì3.5 m., and 6.26 m., respectively, from the center of the hole ìwhich marks the station.

BAYBAY, 1982 Is in the island of Luzon, province of La Union, town of Sto. ìTomas, Brgy. Baybay, on the W side of the dirt road leading to ìBrgy. Narvacan about 8 km., drive from Agoo town proper. Station ìis located on top of a sandy knoll 15 WSW of Cabaruan waiting ìshed about 1.6 km. SE of Brgy. San Manuel Sur Elem. School. ìStation mark is a cross cut on a 5/8" dia. brass rod set flush on ìtop of standard concrete monument which protrudes about 10.2 cm. ìabove the ground. Inscribed on the surface of the monument is a ìtriangle surrounding the mark and "BAYBAY 1982". No reference ìmark was established.

BBM-1=LUN-3221 At Bauang Municipal Plaza travel along the national road going to CABA for 15-25 minutes to reach the junction to Brgy. Urayong. At the junction turn right and continue traveling to reach the point. The station is located within the agricultural area W of the houses and S of the barangay road. Intervisible with P-42 to BLLM-10-A. Station is mark by the head of a 4"copper nail on 0.40 m x 0.40 m concrete monument with inscription BBM-1 CAD 474-D.

BBM-2=LUN-3222 A 10-20 minutes travel going southward taking Bauang-Caba road to reach the crossing going to Brgy. Bagbag, upon reaching the said intersection turn left and just keep on traveling to reach Brgy. Casilagan. The station is located W of Casilagan Elementary School and S of the waiting shed and road. Station is mark by the head of a 4" copper nail on 0.40 m x 0.40 m concrete monument with inscription BBM-2 CAD 474-D.

BBM-4=LUN-3223 Drive southward for about 5-10 minutes starting at Bauang Municipal Plaza along the national road, turn left at the intersection then just follow the road going to Bucayab, before the bridge turn right and follow the road to reach the station. The station is located 30 m SE of Napoleon Realina's house and 15 m SW of the other house. It is intervisible with P-27. Station is mark by the head of a 4"copper nail on 0.40 m x 0.40 m concrete monument with inscription BBM-4 CAD 474-D.

BENCH, 1901 Is on the W side of Santiago Island, NE of the Bolinao landing ìplace. It is 50 m. S of a prominent cliff 6 m. x 15 m. long which ìcan be seen from the landing place as its base is of white clay. ìThe station is on a flat coral rock running out into the seas and ìhaving the appearance of a small rocky pier. It is the only large ìrock in this neighborhood and projects 15 m. into the sea from ìthe high water mark. The end of the rock is above high water mark ìso that at extreme high tide it forms an island. The station is ì5.79 m. from the end of the rock and 2.32 m. from the end of the ìnearest tongue projecting from the S side. The station was marked ìby a 12 cm. wire nail driven into the rock.

BENCH, 1901-77 It was recovered and found in good condition. Revised description ìfollows: On the W coast of Luzon, Bolinao harbor on the W side of ìSantiago Island NE of Bolinao landing place. It is 50 m. S of a ìprominent cliff 6 m. high with white clay on its base. The ìstation is on a flat coral rock running well out into the sea and ìhaving appearance of a small rocky pier. It is only the large ìrock in this neighborhood and projects 15 m. into the sea from ìhigh water mark. Station is 5.79 m. from the offshore end of ìrock. The station was remarked with a 4 in. C.W. nail into the ìrock. No reference marks were established.

BEND, 1901 Is on Santiago Island opposite Riripayan Pt., about 100 m. SE of ìa small but pronounced notch in the shore line where there is a ìshort stretch of sandy beach. It is on a large coral rock, 1.3 m. ìin height and caved in at the bottom. Station mark is a pistol ìcartridge cemented in a hole in the rock. The mark is 1.71 m. ìfrom the E edge, 84 cm. from the S edge and 1.95 m. from the N ìedge of the rock. Witness mark is a triangle cut on the trunk of ìa tree at high watermark, 4.6 m. behind the station.

BIA-O, 1903-15-52 On the extreme N end of a range of hills which lies near the ìcoast about 3 km. W of Santa Maria. There are three hills about ìthe same distance apart. The station is on the lowest and most N ìone, facing the Mainganay River. It is 0.6 km. SE of Bo. Bia-o, ìwhich is on the S bank of the mouth of the river. Station "Nalvo" ìis 1.4 km. to the SW. There are two small summits on the hill, ìthe station being on the highest point of the E one. Station mark ìis a drill hole in the solid ledge of rock.

BIGBIGA, 1903 On the highest part of a bush covered hill 89 m. high, 300 m. ìfrom the beach, 2 km. N of Santiago Cove and 4 km. S of San ìEsteban Harbor. The hill is directly inshore from a large ìprominent rock about 6 m. high on the shore line and shows very ìplainly from the beach to the N. Station mark is a 2 cm. drill ìhole, 2 cm. deep, in the top of the N half of a double rock which ìprojects about 30 cm. above the ground. There is a large white ìrock, about 1.3 m. high, 4 m. E of the station.

BIN, 1951 Is located on the W part of Binabalian Pt. on the S side of ìSantiago Island. Station mark is a triangulation of nails set in ìa concrete putty in the center of a rock projecting 1.3 m. above ìthe water. RM No.1 is an arrow in a concrete putty distant 4.75 ìm., azimuth 10°. RM No.2 is an arrow in a concrete putty, distant ì3.7 m., azimuth 60°. RM No.3 is an arrow in a concrete putty, ìdistant 2.8 m., azimuth 290°.

BINA, 1977 Is on the W coast of Luzon, Bolinao Harbor, province of ìPangasinan, municipality of Bolinao, Bo. Lucero, on the W coast ìof Santiago Island. The station is on a point elevated at about 5 ìm. above the ground, 80 m. NNE of an isolated rock which is 20 m. ìfrom the shore and 30 m. N of a trail leading from the beach to ìthe hill. The station is the cross cut on top of a 1/2 in. dia. ìbrass rod embedded and set flushed on a cement putty and is 2 m. ìfrom the edge of the point. The station marked "BINA, 1977, ìBCGS". RM Nos.1, 2 and 3 are similar, and is the center of a 4 ìin. c.w. nail embedded and set flushed on a cement putty on top ìof a rock and with an arrow pointing to the station. They are ìmarked "RM 1", "RM 2" and "RM 3", respectively. RM No.1 is 4.853 ìm. N of the station. RM No.2 is 3.481 m. E of the station. RM ìNo.3 is 3.658 m. S of the station.
BINMALEY CHURCH BELL TOWER, 1902-67 Is the center of the bell tower of the church in the town of ìBinmaley. Mark is the apex of the church bell tower of Binmaley ìParish Church.

BLACK, 1948 Is in Lingayen Gulf, the E shore immediately S of San Fernando ìPt., the most W point of the Peninsula. It is about 100 m. back ìfrom the edge of the bluff at the S side of the small projection. ìA large elevated water tank, the highest structure in the ìvicinity of San Fernando Pt. painted black and white. The ìaircraft warning light fixed atop the center of the tank. The ìpoint observed upon was the center of the light. Station was not ìoccupied or marked.

BLOCK, 1903-15-52 On the top of the first brick fort 9 km. N of Mt. Cuit and 5 km. ìNW of the town of Bacarra in Bo. Santa Catalina. It is about 200 ìm. from the beach. The station is close to a wooden post standing ìnear the E side of the top of the fort and is on the diameter of ìthe fort passing through the center of two holes on the E and W ìside. It is 1.34 m. from the outer E edge of the top of the wall. ìThe center of the fort was distant 1.71 m., in azimuth 120° 17'.

BLUFF, 1902-58 Is on Cabarruyan Island at the NW corner of the broad point ìimmediately S of Siapar Island. It is on a large triangular coral ìrock with one vertex pointing towards the N. The rock is ìseparated from the main island by 1 m. of water at high tide. The ìtop of the rock is irregular and is 1.8 m. above high water. The ìhighest point is at the SW corner from which the surface slopes ìto the E. Station mark is a 2 cm. hole drilled 8 cm. deep in the ìtop of the rock. The station is 3.66 m. from the N end, 2.16 m. ìfrom the E end and 2.16 m. from the NW end of the rock. 5 m. S of ìthe rock upon which the station is located is another rock of ìnearly the same shape and size by 1.3 m. higher. This rock comes ìto a sharp peak at the NW corner, distant 3.41 m. from the ìstation.

BM 6 A, 1963-67 Is in the island of Luzon, province of La Union, town of San ìFernando, Bo. Poro, at the E end of the concrete causeway leading ìto Pier 2, about 67.5 m. NE of the high water line about 36 m. NE ìof the bend of the causeway, about 1 m. NW of the SE edge of the ìcauseway and about 1 m. SW of the NE edge of the causeway. To get ìto the station from San Fernando, a road leads W from the town. ìMark is a cross cut on top of a 1/2" dia. brass rod embedded on ìtop of a concrete floor of the causeway set 2 cm. above the floor ìof the causeway. "BM 6 A" is inscribed in the cement putty ìsurrounding the mark. RM-1 is the top center of a cast iron ìspike, on a small bollard. RM-2 is actually "BM 7", a 1/2" dia. ìbrass rod embedded on top of the concrete floor of causeway. "BM ì7" is inscribed on top of cement putty surrounding the mark. ìRM-3 is the top center of a cast iron bolt on a bollard plate.

BOJEADOR NORTH BASE, 1903-15 On the coral reef 350 m. S of the S side of Nagabungan Bay. N of ìthe station is a depression in the reef forming a pond, with an ìarm extending to within 1 m. of the station and crossing the ìprolonged line of the base. Another arm extends across the line ìfrom the station to Cape Bojeador Lighthouse, about 15 m. from ìthe station. Station mark is a hole cut in the coral, 8 cm. in ìdia. and 12 cm. deep. Reference mark is a large cross cut on the ìrock at a distance of 12.1 m. from the station on a line to the ìlighthouse.

CAPE BOJEADOR SOUTH BASE, 1903-33 On the coral reef about 600 m. N of Port Dirique. It is below ìhigh watermark. The upper half of the tower of Cape Bojeador ìLighthouse shows over a clump of trees. Station mark is a hole in ìthe coral rock, 5 cm. in dia. x 12 cm. deep. Reference mark is a ìcross, with arms 30 cm. long, 5 cm. deep and 4 cm. wide, out in ìthe rock at a distance of 14.69 m. from the station on a line to ìCape Bojeador Lighthouse.

BOL, 1951 Is located W of Binabalian Pt., on the S side of Bolinao Harbor. ìStation mark is a trinagle of nails, set in a concrete paddy in a ìrock projecting 1.22 m. above the water. RM No.1 is an arrow in a ìconcrete paddy, 4.63 m., azimuth 95°. RM No.2 is an arrow in a ìconcrete paddy, 1.64 m., azimuth 120°. RM No.3 is an arrow in a ìconcrete paddy, 2.51 m., azimuth 355°. All azimuths are taken ìfrom the N.

BOLINAO NORTH BASE, 1901-51 Is on the W side of Bolinao Harbor about 450 m. N of the landing ìplace. It is on a flat, circular, coral rock standing in the ìcenter of a group of larger coral boulders. The rock is awash at ìhigh tide. A coral boulder rests against the S edge and rises 0.5 ìm. above it. There are two large boulders in a line of trifle E ìof N, the first distant 1.32 m. and the second distant 5.01 m., 7 ìm. W of the station. There is a bank of 1.5 m. high. 30 m. W of ìthe station is a large coral boulder over 3 m. high rests against ìthe bank. Station mark is a nail in a concrete patty set in the ìrock.

BOLINAO SOUTH BASE, 1901 Is on the W side of Bolinao Harbor about 75 m. N of the landing ìplace. The station is on a flat coral rock 2.5 m. outside the ìbank, which is about 5 m. from the middle of the road leading ìfrom the landing place to Bolinao. Along the E side of the road ìwere several large trees and the line from the station ìperpendicular to the road passed between the second and third ìtrees from the landing place. The second tree is 5.6 m. distant ìand the third one 7.47 m. Station mark is a 1.6 cm. copper bolt ìsunk 2.5 cm. in the rock. It was 1.04 m. from the outer end of ìthe rock 43 cm. from the N edge and 55 cm. from the S edge.
BOTOL, 1903 On the range extending N from Bo. Botol, on the first high peak S ìof the highest peak. Station mark is a drill hole in a rock set ìwith its top flush with the surface of the ground.

BOY, 1958 Is on the W coast of Luzon, in the province of Pangasinan, on ìPorobaboy Island, on Caquiputan Strait. The station is on the S ìone of two large coral rocks about 3.35 m. in dia. on the W side ìof the island and about 10 m. offshore from the high waterline of ìthe island. Mark is the center of a crosscut on top of a 1/2 in. ìdia. brass rod embedded in a drilled hole on top of the rock, ìwith cement putty around and inscription "BOY, 1958".
BUED, 1979 No description.
CAA AERO LT., 1974 Is the center of the light support on top of circular steel base ìof the aeronautical light located 0.7 km. NE of the town of ìBacnotan, about 50 m. E of the national highway No.3.

CAB 2, 1972 In N Luzon, province of Ilocos Sur, municipality of Tagudin, on ìthe N end of the first range of hill which lies 4.5 km. in ìazimuth 257° from Tagudin. The station is on a little rounding, ìcleared knoll on the N end of the ridge about 30 m. before ìreaching the highest point. To reach the station from Tagudin, ìproceed N along the national highway until its junction with ìhighway No.4 at Bo. Libtong is reached. Then travel E for about ì1.2 km. where a dirt road branches off leading to Bo. Cabugbugan ìat the W foot of the hill. From there a good trail goes up the ìmountain passing 1.5 m. S of the station. Station mark is a drill ìhole near the top of a large buried boulder with the exposed ìportion about 0.6 m. in dia. and protruding about 25 cm. above ìthe ground.
CABA CHURCH CROSS, 1967 The center of the cross of the church in the town of Caba.

CABEZA 2, 1963-67 Is in the island of Luzon, province La Union, town of Bauang, ìalong national highway No.9, on top of a 226 m. hill, about 1.5 ìmiles E of the church of Bauang, on the highest part of the hill ìand at the N part of the ridge, on a lot owned by Mr. Damiano ìRonquillo. To reach the station from San Fernando, La Union, go S ìon Highway No.3 then turn E at Bauang along Highway No.9 near Km. ìPost No.262, just W of a schoolhouse, a trail leads uphill. Mark ìis a 50 cal. cartridge embedded on top of a concrete monument ìwith the top formed into a cylinder 6-1/2 in. in dia. and set 3 ìin. above the ground. A triangle is inscribed on top of the ìmonument surrounding the mark. RM-1 is a copper nail embedded on ìtop of a boulder and surrounded by cement putty. "RM 1" and an ìarrow pointing to the station are inscribed on top of the putty ìsurrounding the mark. RM-2 and RM-3 are similar marks as RM-1 and ìare correspondingly marked. RM-1 is a cast iron spike embedded on ìthe side of a maulawin tree trunk which is about 1-1/2 ft. dia. ìMark is about 3 ft. above the ground.
CABUGAO CHURCH TOWER, 1903 The center of the tower on the main structure of Cabugao Church.

CAD, 1979 Is in Sual town, province of Pangasinan. It is situated on top of ìa bare mountain, the highest in the vicinity which is about 7.5 ìkm. NW of Sual town proper. To reach the station from the ìnational highway, follow the earth road going to Brgy. ìPangascasam passing along foot hills and rice paddies. About 3.5 ìkm. from the highway and NW of the road is the bare mountain and ìthe station is visible from the road. There's no trail leading to ìthe station but the mountain is bare from the foot up to the top ìwith crashed rocks and stones. Mark is a 1.27 cm. dia. brass rod ìcemented on top of the rock with inscription around the mark "CAD ì588-D, 1978". It is a Bureau of Lands Cadastral Survey station ìmark.

CALOAAN, 1903-05 On the highest point (83 m.) of a low range foothills 2 km. SE of ìSanta Cruz. There is a trail which starts at the cemetery in ìSanta Cruz and crosses the rice fields to the small Bo. Calaoaan ìat the foot of the hill. From here the trail climbs the hill ìpassing about 7 m. to the E of the station. Station mark is a ìdrill hole in top of a small rock which projects 5 cm. from the ìsurface of the ground.

CALASIAO CBT, 1905-68 Is the apex of the dome shaped Calasiao Church bell tower, ìlocated in the central part of the municipality of Calasiao. The ìstructure is built of bricks and is about 16.768 m. high.

CANDON ASTRONOMICAL STATION, 1901-03 On the S side of the road from Candon to the beach, immediately ìoutside and W of the town. There is a double arched brick bridge ìover the small creek just W of the station. The belfry of Candon ìChurch is in azimuth 258°. Station mark is a drill hole on top of ìa stone projecting 10 cm. above the ground. Subsurface mark is a ìflat stone with a hole drilled nearly through it, buried 1.13 m. ìbelow the surface of the soil, which is black loam with a heavy ìgrass turf. Reference marks were established on the central ìbridge pier, on a small brick pillar E of the bridge on the S ìside of the road and on the brick wall connecting this pillar and ìthe bridge abutments. The azimuth and distances are as follows: ìcenter of middle support of bridge, 162° 35', distance 18.55 m.; ìmark on the wall, 180° 0', distant 16.38 m.; center of the brick ìpillar, 244° 46', distant 27.61 m.

CANDON AZIMUTH MARK, 1901 It is S of the Astronomical Station on a small ridge between the ìrice fields, 15.5 m. S of the S edge of the ditch which runs ìunder the main road from Candon to the S, just outside of the ìtown, where it is spanned by a single arch of brick. Station mark ìis a stone set almost flush with top of the ridge. Subsurface ìmark is a small flat stone with a hole drilled nearly through it. ìThe folloing azimuth and distances were measured: Astronomical ìStation, 180° 0', 700.05 m.; SW pier (brick) of old reservoir, ì184° 7'; center of the W face of the bridge, 282° 54', 160.05 m.; ìlone tree, 293° 31'.
CANDON CHURCH TOWER NORTHWEST BASE, 1952 Station is an "X" mark on the head of a bolt embedded in a cement ìpost, 2 ft. E of the Santiago-Sta. Lucia Rd.

CANDON CHURCH TOWER, SW BASE, 1950-51 Station is an "X" mark on the head of a bolt embedded in the ìcement post E of Santiago-Santa Lucia Rd., 7 m. SE of the center ìof the intersection, NW of the Candon Municipal Bldg.

CANDON CHURCH TOWER WEST BASE, 1952 Station is an "X" mark on the head of a bolt embedded in a cement ìpost, 2 ft. E of the Santiago-Santa Lucia Rd., 7 m. NE of the ìintersection of the main road and the road to Candon Church.
CANDON CHURCH TOWER, 1901-1903 The center of the bell tower on the N side of Candon Church.

CAPE BOJEADOR ASTRONOMICAL STATION, 1903 On a small projecting shoulder of ground at the E base of the ìlighthouse tower, 7.74 m., in azimuth 259° 52', from the center ìof the tower. Subsurface mark is a flat red tile, 2 cm. thick and ì30 cm. square, with two corners cut off and a hole 2 cm. in dia. ìdrilled in its center to mark the point. It was set 75 cm. below ìthe surface. Station mark is a 2 cm. hole drilled to a depth of 5 ìcm. in the center of a very irregular grey stone projecting 8 cm. ìfrom the ground. The lighthouse is surrounded by a fence ìconsisting of brick piers connected by iron rails. The nearest ìpost is to the NW. Its center is 2.55 m. fom the station and the ìarc to the SW is 4.19 m. distant. The following measurements to ìthe corner of the octagonal tower will also serve as references ìto the E end of the S face of the octagon, 7.72 m., in azimuth ì54° 39'; to the N end of the E face, 4.52 m. in azimuth 89° 36'; ìand to the E end of the N face, 6.61 m., in azimuth 105° 33'.

CAPE BOJEADOR L. H., 1903-52 Is located in Bo. Bayog, approx. 2 m. NE of Highway No.3 center ìline, 80 m. S of the road leading to Cape Bojeador Lighthouse and ì380 m. NE Km. Post No.328. Station mark is a 3 in. nail head ìdriven into a 2 in. x 2 in. x 6 in. wood stake flush with the ìroad surface.

CAT, 1958 Is on the W coast of Luzon, province of Pangasinan, in the N ìapproach to Caquiputan Strait at Catipan Island, at the highest ìpoint of the W knoll. Mark is a nail within a triangle form by 3 ìnails embedded on top of a 4" x 10" concrete monument set flush ìto the ground. RM No.1 is a nail within a triangle form by a ìseries of nails driven to a coconut tree, distant 6.142 m., ìazimuth 318° 7' 41". RM No.3 is a nail on the center of a coral ìrock with cement putty around and an arrow pointing towards the ìstation, distant 6.185 m., azimuth 103° 41' 1". RM No.4 is a ìsimilar mark to RM No.3, distant 5.103 m., azimuth 201° 43' 31". ìStation "CAT (29E)" and RM No.1 were established by the 29E ìUnited States Army.

CHAS, 1948-63-67 On the W coast of Luzon, in the province of La Union, in San ìFernando Harbor on the W shore, on the point about halfway ìbetween San Fernando Pt. and Pier No.2. Station is a rocky shelf ìabout 30 m. from its S edge, about 2 m. offshore from the high ìwater line, and about 30 m. from the wire fence of the V.O.A. ìRadio Station property. Station mark is a 50 cal. cartridge set ìin a depression in the rocky shelf.

CLAY, 1902 Is on the highest hill on the W side of Sual Harbor, N of the ìroad to Alaminos. The hill, which may be readily identified, is ìdistant 2.7 km. from the pier at Sual, in azimuth 139° 27'. Its ìtop is rounding and barren; trees growing close to the top on the ìS side. The station is at an elevation of 210 m., on the summit ìwhich trends E and W and has two mounds of almost equal height ìalthough the E one is the larger. The station is on the highest ìpoint and at the center of the E mound. Subsurface mark is a ìbottle buried vertically at a depth of 30 cm. and witnessed by ìthree similar bottles lying horizontally and syummetrically ìplaced about the center, their necks pointing toward the station ìbottle at a distance of 30 cm. from the latter.

CLEAR, 1901 Is on the mainland S of Santiago Island, on the NW corner of ìRiripayan Pt., 25 m. NW of a trail leading from the beach. It is ìon a small hard rock awash at high tide and situated 2 m. outside ìthe bank. The bank is of red clay 3 m. high, while the beach ìconsists of small coral fragments. The rock measured 60 cm. N and ìS by 37 cm. E and W, each dimension being through the station ìmark. It is situated just S of the largest rock in this vicinity, ìa perforated coral rock, 1.22 m. long by 60 cm. wide, standing 60 ìcm. above the water. Station mark is a copper bolt set in the ìrock.

CLEAR 2, 1977 Is on the W coast of Luzon, Bolinao Harbor, province of ìPangasinan, on the NW corner of Riripayan Pt., 0.9 km. NE of Port ìBolinao Lighthouse, and about 20 m. NW of a trail leading to the ìbeach. Approach is directly from the bank which is 6 m. high and ìof prominent red clay as viewed from seaward. The station is the ìcenter of the crosscut on top of a 1/2 in. dia. brass rod ìembedded and set flush on a cement putty which is 1 in. above the ìsurface of the rock and a distant 5 m. from the edge of the bank. ìThe rock is elevated 1 m. above the surface of the ground. The ìstation is marked "CLEAR 2, 1977, BCGS". RM Nos.1, 2 and 3 are ìsimilar and is the center of a 3 in. c.w. nail embedded and set ìflushed on a cement putty on top of a rock and with arrow ìpointing to the station. They are marked "RM 1", "RM 2" and "RM ì3", respectively. RM No.1 is 3.353 m. from the station, with ìazimuth 183° 3.902'. RM No.2 is 5.436 m. from the station, with ìazimuth 287° 11.73'. RM No.3 is 5.08 m. from the station, with ìazimuth 38° 46.40'.

CLIFF, 1903-33 On the summit of a hill 3.1 km. SE of Negra Pt. Between this ìpoint and Bangui are two considerable elevations close to the ìcoast. The station is on the one nearest Negra Pt., which one is ìdistinguished by a conspicuous pyramidal rock standing in front ìof the hill, between it and the sea. On the summit of the hill is ìan outcrop, about 2 m. x 3 m. in area of soft rock which crumbles ìeasily. The station is on the summit of this rock. Station mark ìis a 2 cm. drill hole, 5 cm. deep.

COR, 1958 Is on the W coast of Luzon, province of Pangasinan, on a hill ìwhich is about due W of Garingan Rock and about 400 m. WSW of the ìSW edge of Boboruan Island. Station is not on the highest part of ìthe hill. Mark is the center of a crosscut on top of a 1/2 in. ìdia. brass rod embedded on top of a concrete monument about 25 ìcm. in dia., flush to the ground and with inscriptions "COR ì1958".

CORAL, 1901 Is on the NW corner of Poro Silaqui, an island 2 km. N of ìSantiago Island. A small coral island 25 m. long lies 20 m. ìoffshore NW of the station which is on the end of a point of ìrough coral rock rising from 1.5 m. from the water. Station mark ìis a copper bolt set in the rock, 4.05 m. from its N end, 4.33 m. ìfrom its W edge and 6.1 m. from its NW corner.

CORAL, 1903 On a sand hill about 26 m. high, 400 m. from the beach and 200 m. ìN of the road from Santo Domingo to the old fort on the shore ìopposite the S end of Pinget Island. On the top of this hill is ìan outcrop of coral rock which was the only formation of its kind ìseen on any hill in this vicinity. The W of the hill was covered ìwith low bushes. Station mark is a 2 cm. drill hole, 10 m. deep, ìin the coral ledge. The rock is soft and crumbles readily so that ìthere may be dificulty in recovering the mark. Witness marks are ìtwo vertical grooves cut in the vertical face of this ledge; the ìfirst bearing S 48° 13' E, distant 2.27 m.; the second bearing S ì20° 16' E, distant 3.47 m. The station was close to the E side of ìthe outcrop, but the edge of the rock in a re-entrant angle ìtoward the NW, distant 1.98 m., in azimuth 130° 40'.

CORNER, 1901 Is on Santiago Island on the W side of the end of Binabalian Pt., ìSE of the Bolinao landing place. It is directly beneath the ìcenter of a large grassy mound on the hillside and is 75 m. S of ìa stretch of sandy beach. The shore near the station is rocky ìwith a large coral boulders rising from the water for 10 m. on ìeither side of the station. The station is on a flat coral rock ìwith a rough and irregular top 1.3 m. above the water. The ìstation is 2.74 m. from the earth edge, 2.44 m. from the E edge, ì1.52 m. from the S edge, and 0.98 m. from the W edge of the rock. ìStation mark is a copper bolt, 4 cm. long, set in the rock. ìWitness mark, directly back of the station at a distance of 7.71 ìm., is a triangle facing the station cut in the trunk of a tree ìstanding at high water line.

CURRIMAO ASTRONOMICAL STATION, 1901-54 In the town of Currimao, Ilocos Norte, inside the compound of the ìCompania General de Tabacos, about 20 m. from the high water ìline, 71 m. NW from the foot of a concrete causeway, and 0.6 m. S ìof a coconut tree. Station is near the E side of the building, W ìof the large warehouse of the Compania General de Tabacos. The ìlower story of this building is made of brick and concrete. The ìSE and NE corners of the building were distant 9.83 m. and 9.96 ìm. in azimuth 60° 09' and 127° 26', respectively. The SW corner ìof the warehouse is 51.19 m., distant in zaimuth 261° 50'. The ìsoil in the immediate vicinity of the station is composed largely ìof highly disintegrated and dry coral. Station mark is a standard ìUSC & GS triangulation disk stamped "1952" set in a concrete ìmonument 20 cm. square and protruding 10 cm. from the ground. ìFrom the old description, subsurface mark consists of a ìtrapezoidal piece of gray granite about 32 cm. on a side and 8 ìcm. thick, with a 2 cm. hole drilled completely through its ìcenter. Reference mark (RM) No.1 is a procelain plug set in a ìconcrete monument about 1 ft. in dia. 28.383 m. distant from the ìstation and 53° 57' in azimuth. It is 0.75 m. SE of a coconut ìtree. "RM 1" and an arrow pointing towards the station are ìinscribed. RM No.2 is the cross cut on top of a brass rod set in ìa concrete block 0.16 m. S of an old dry well, 28.991 m. distant ìfrom the station and 131° 23' in azimuth. "RM 2" and an arrow ìpointing towards the station are inscribed. RM No.3 is a similar ìmark set in a concrete monument 20 cm. square on top, 10.185 m. ìdistant from the station and 254° 39' in azimuth. It is 0.95 m. N ìof a coconut tree. "RM 3" and an arrow pointing towards the ìstation are inscribed on top of the monument.

CURRIMAO WAREHOUSE SOUTH GABLE, 1903-15-52 The S gable of a brick building at Currimao used as a warehouse ìby the Compaña General de Tobacos. The SW corner of this building ìwas used as one of the reference marks for the "Currimao ìAstronomical" station.
DAGUPAN CHURCH BELL TOWER, 1902-68 Is the apex of Saint John Cathedral bell tower, located in the ìcentral part of Dagupan City. The structure is built of bricks ìand is approx. 18.293 m.

DAGUPAN CHURCH CROSS, 1967-90 Is the center of the cross at the front gable of the church in ìthe town of Dagupan. Station mark is the prominently protruding ìconcrete church bell tower of St. John Parish Church. Mark is the ìcenter of the crross on top of the church bell tower.

DANAR, 1903 It is about 3 km. S of the anchorage for the town of Santiago, ì1.5 km. NW of Bo. Danar and 1.3 km. E of Tamurung Pt. The station ìis on a sharp, little peak about 400 m. N of the highest part of ìthe ridge which is flat and heavily wooded. The peak is 200 m. ìhigh and is higher than any point between it and Santiago Cove. A ìtrail leads from the main road directly to the station. Station ìmark is a drill hole in the solid rock on the top of peak which ìis entirely cleared of timber.
DARIGAYOS BRICK TOWER, 1903 A large circular tower with a conical bamboo roof, on the beach ìat the S side of the mouth of the Darigayos River. This was ìformerly used as a fort.

DASOL, 1951 Is located at the centerline of Highway No.7, in concrete 14 in. ìbelow the road surface and 409.742 m. from station "53" in Bo. ìEguia. Station mark is a standard 29th Engr. bronze marker and is ìstamped "DASOL". RM No.1 is an iron telephone pole, azimuth 30°, ìdistant 44.5 ft. RM No.2 is a tree, azimuth 155°, distant 37.5 ìft.

DAY, 1958 Is on the W coast of Luzon, in Pangasinan province, on Cabarruyan ìIsland, on the first point SW of the S approach to Caquiputan ìStrait, on a detached rock about 1.2 m. x 1.8 m. and about 0.8 m. ìabove the MHW. A similar but bigger rock exist about 100 m. E of ìthe station. Mark is the center of a crosscut on top of a 1/2 in. ìdia. brass rod embedded in a drill hole on top center of a rock ìwith cement putty around and with a circle circumscribed in it ìand with inscription "DAY 1958 PC&GS".

DEN, 1958 Is on the W coast of Luzon, in Pangasinan province, on Cabarruyan ìIsland at the S approach to Caquiputan Strait, on top of and ìabout 5 m. N of a bluff at the SW most point of Cabarruyan ìIsland. Station can be easily reached from a beach N of the ìpoint. Mark is the center of a crosscut on top of a 1/2 in. dia. ìbrass rod embedded in a drill hole on a large coral rock with ìcement putty around and with a circle circumscribed in it and ìwith inscription "DEN 1958 PC&GS".

DENTRO, 1902 Is on the point of Cabarruyan Island at the S entrance to ìCaquiputan Strait, about 2.5 km. W of the town of Anda. The point ìupon which the station is situated is covered with thick brush ìand trees which overhang the shore. The shore is covered with ìcoral rocks. The station is a little E of the end of the point, ì15 m. from the edge of the water and 5 m. above high water. ìStation mark is a drill hole in a flat coral rock which slopes ìtowards the end of the point. Witness mark is a triangle cut on ìthe trunk of a tree 1.2 m. from the ground, 2.4 m. W of and ìfacing the station. A short distance S of the station is a rocky ìbank.

DIALAO, 1903-15-52 On the summit of the knob at the E end of the high hills back of ìDialao Pt. It is on the highest point of these hills, which is ìalso the highest point anywhere in this vicinity. Station mark is ìa drill hole in the soft, crumbling rock forming the summit. ìWitness marks, each consisting of a triagle blazed on a pine tree ìand a nail driven into each angle, were established at 24.78 m., ìin azimuth 60° 18', and at 22.04 m., in azimuth 309° 22'.
DILI 2, 1903-72 Station is not recoverable.

DIRIQUE, 1903-15 On the coral flat 2 km. N of Port Dirique and 1 km. S of ìNagabungan Bay. It is outside the extreme high water line. There ìis a small depression in the coral E of the station forming a ìpond 10 m. wide x 30 m. long, running parallel with the beach. ìFurther inshore is a larger pond. These are the only large ponds ìin the coral flats between Port Dirique and Nagabungan Bay. The ìstation is about 10 paces from the edge of the pond first ìmentioned. Station mark is a hole in the coral rock, 12 cm. deep ìand 5 cm. in dia. Reference mark is a cross with arms 30 cm. ìlong, 5 cm. deep and 4 cm. wide, cut in the coral 27.92 m. from ìthe station on the line to Cape Bojeador Lighthouse.

DUNE, 1901-03 On the sand spit on the W side of Santo Tomas Harbor, about 1.7 ìkm. N of its extremity. The station was on a small sand dune ìabout 0.8 m. high, situated 80 m. from the W side of the spit and ì150 m. from the E side. The inner point of a small inlet running ìback into the E side of the spit was 140 m. SE of the station and ìa small nipa hut stood 230 m. NE of the station. Subsurface mark ìis a bottle buried 0.3 m. below the surface of the sand.

FER, 1958 Is on the W coast of Luzon, in Pangasinan province, on Cabarruyan ìIsland, in Caquiputan Strait about 50 m. NW of the ferry landing. ìMark is the center of a crosscut on top of a 1/2 in. dia. brass ìrod embedded on the top center of an 8 in. square concrete ìmonument with a circle circumscribed in it and with inscription ì"FER 1958 PC&GS".

FERN, 1952 Is located at San Fernando Harbor on the beach at the foot of ìRizal St. at the town of San Fernando. It is the center of a mass ìof masonry about 10 ft. x 20 ft. x 15 ft., the ruins of an old ìSpanish pier or fort, which looks like a large rock when viewed ìfrom the bay. Station is the center of a 50 cal. cartridge driven ìinto a drill hole in the masonry with the top about 1 in. below ìthe surface. RM No.1 is a 50 cal. cartridge driven into a drill ìhole and portruding.

FERRY, 1902 Is on Cabarruyan island, 18 m. N of the ferry landing, 1 km. from ìthe S end of Caquiputan Strait. It is on a large coral rock on ìthe side of the bank and 3 m. above sea level. The rock is of ìslightly decomposed coral and is 2.4 m. in its longest dimension. ìStation mark is a 3.8 cm. hole drilled 5 cm. deep in the rock at ìits center. Witness mark is a triangle facing the station cut on ìthe trunk of a tree 0.9 m. from the ground, 1.98 m. NE of the ìstation. E of the station, distant 1.93 m. is a large coral rock.

FILMAG, 1972 On the W coast of Luzon, province of Ilocos Sur, municipality of ìTagudin, Bo. Pat-tiguie, about 4.5 km. N of the town proper and ì50 m. E of the high water line, on the concrete service ramp of ìthe FILMAG Field Ofc. The station is 0.35 m. from the N edge and ì2.87 m. from the E edge of the ramp. Mark is a cross cut on top ìof a 5/8 in. dia. brass rod set flush on top of the ramp. RM-1 is ìthe W iron post strap of the NW post of the building beside the ìramp. RM-2 is the W iron post strap of the NW post of the ìbuilding. RM-3 is the SW corner of the ramp.

FISH, 1904-06 Is at the N side of the entrance in Dasol Bay on Lagtaros Island, ìS of Caiman Pt. It is on the E side of the island near the S end ìand is about 6 m. above high watermark, 2 m. from the edge of the ìbluff and about 10 m. N of a cove that runs through the island in ìdirection SW to NW. Station mark is a drill hole in the middle of ìa depression in the solid rock. Recovered in 1906 but station was ìhard to find owing to many similar holes eaten in rock.

FLAG, 1902 Is on a rocky point on the mainland NW of the second island from ìthe S entrance to Caquiputan Strait. The bluff upon which the ìstation is located is 5 m. above sea level and is covered with ìbrush and small sharp coral rocks, some of which are 60 cm. high ìand very sharp. The station is 1.6 m. from the edge of the bank. ìW of the station is a wooded hill. Station mark is a 2 cm. hole ìdrilled 2.5 cm. deep in a nearly square coral stone, 10 cm. x 15 ìcm. in size. Witness mark is a triangle cut on the trunk of a ìsmall tree 0.9 m. above the ground, 2.69 m. NW of the station. 25 ìcm. E of the station is a stump 35 cm. high.
FORT 2, 1952 The center of a large and very prominent brick tower on the beach ìjust of the S end of Pinget Island.

FORT 2, 1963-67 Is in Luzon, province of La Union, town of San Fernando, Bo. ìCarlatan along the national highway No.3 high water line, 9.4 m. ìSW of an old fort. To reach the station from San Fernando, take ìthe highway No.3 through Carlatan, turn left at the old Tabacco ìshed owned by Tabacalera. Mark is a 1/2 in. brass rod embedded in ìa drilled hole on coral rock and surrounded with cement putty. ì"FORT 2, 1963" is inscribed on top of the putty, surrounding the ìmark. RM No.1 is a cast iron spike embedded on a drilled hole on ìthe W face of the old stone fort and surrounded with cement ìputty. Station name and an arrow pointing to the station are ìinscribed on the putty. RM No.2 is a copper nail embedded on a ìdrilled hole on coral rock. "RM 2" and an arrow pointing to the ìstation were established on top of the putty surrounding the ìmark. RM No.3 is a cast iron spike embedded on drilled hole on ìtop of a coral rock and surrounded by cement putty. "RM 3" and an ìarrow pointing to the station were inscribed on top of the putty ìsurrounding the mark. RM No.4 is a copper nail embedded on a ìdrill hole on top of a coral rock and surrrounded by cement ìputty. RM No.4 and and an arrow pointing to the station were ìinscribed on top of the putty surrounding the mark.

FRONT, 1948-63 Is at San Fernando Harbor, the SE shore at the town of San ìFernando about 20 m. S from the extension of Gov. Luna St. and ì95.419 m. from the center of the ruins of the old fort or pier at ìthe foot of Rizal St. Station is at the center of a 15 ft. ìtriangular structure which forms the front range marker for the ìentrance range into the harbor. Station is the ceneter of a 50 ìcal. cartridge cemented in the center of a cylinder of concrete ì3-1/2 ft. long and 5 in. in dia. buried in sand and protruding ìabout 6 in. No reference marks were established and the station ìwas not occupied. The apex of the triangular structure was the ìpoint observed upon.

FUEGO 3, 1966-67 Is in the island of Luzon, province of La Union, town of Caba. ìIt is on the peak of Mt. Mangabang, about 2.7 km. NNE of Aringay ìand at about the same distance SE of Caba. The mountain is 305 m. ìhigh and the highest in the vicinity. Its top is cultivated and ìthe sides are covered with trees and bush. Station is 14.947 m. N ìby E of a concrete boundary monument marked "Caba-Aringay". To ìreach the station from San Fernando, proceed S along Highway No.3 ìup to San Benito Community School which is about 150 m. S of the ìCaba-Aringay boundary. The opposite of the school building is a ìtrail going E leading to the station. Mark is a copper nail ìembedded on top of a concrete monument whose top formed into a 6 ìin. dia. cylinder set flush with the ground. A triangle is ìinscribed on the monument surrounding the mark. RM-2 is a copper ìnail embedded on top of a concrete boundary monument about 3 ft. ìhigh. "RM 2" and an arrow pointing to station is inscribed on ìcement putty surrounding the mark. RM-4 is a copper nail embedded ìon top of a concrete monument whose top formed into a 6 in. dia. ìcylinder set flush with the ground. "RM 4" and an arrow pointing ìto station are inscribed on top of the monument. RM-5 is a copper ìnail embedded on top of a boulder 8 in. x 9 in. flush with the ìground. "RM 5" and an arrow pointing to station are inscribed on ìtop of boulder.

GAANG, 1954 On the SE shore of Gaang Bay on the government pier which juts to ìseaward from Bo. Maglaoi. Station is on the NE side of the floor ìof the pier, 1.27 m. from the inner face of the NE curb and 9 m. ìSE of the end of the concrete causeway. Station mark is the hole ìin the center of a cross out on top of a brass rod set in a drill ìhole on the floor of the pier. A triangle was etched on the ìconcrete around the brass rod. RM No.1 is a porcelain plug set in ìa drill hole on the NE curb of the pier with an arrow pointing ìtowards the station, distant 9.285 m. in azimuth 315° 22' 9". RM ìNo.2 is a similar mark on the floor of the pier on the SW side ìwith an arrow pointing towards the station, distant 9.4474 m. in ìazimuth 35° 51' 33".

GAANG WAREHOUSE WEST CABLE, 1954 In the W coast of Luzon, in the province of Ilocos Norte, in the ìtown of Currimao, in Bo. Maglaoi. Station is the W gable of the ì10 m. x 18 m. BPW galvanizeed iron warehouse with red roof and ìgreen walls on the S side of the foot of the concrete causeway to ìthe Gaang Pier, about 1 m. back of the high water line.

GABOT, 1954 On Gabot Island about 5 m. E of the W most edge of the island. ìAround the station are several maguey plants. Station mark is the ìcross cut on top of a 3/8" brass rod set almost flush with the ìsurface of a concrete monument 0.9 ft. square at the top. RM No.1 ìis a porcelain plug set flush with the surface of a concrete ìmonument 6" in dia. with an arrow pointing to the station, ìdistant 8.018 m. from station, in azimuth 163° 45' 14". RM No.2 ìis another porcelain plug set flush with the surface of a ìconcrete monument 8" in dia., distant 10.716 m. from the station, ìin azimuth 242° 44' 32".

GAY, 1951 Is located on a rock on the E side of the peninsula, 1 km. from ìthe tip of the peninsula. Station mark is a nail in the rock. RM ìNo.1 is a concrete paddy in a coral rock, 5.378 m., N. RM No.2 is ìa concrete paddy in a coral rock, 2.49 m., N 30° W. RM No 3 is a ìconcrete paddy in a coral rock, 6.256 meters, S. Distance ìbearings are from the station to the reference marks.

HALF 2, 1967 Is in the island of Luzon, province of Pangasinan, W side of ìLingayen Gulf, 6.3 km. N of the town of Sual, about 1.5 km. ìinland from Pao and Cabalitian Islands, on top of a 175 m. hill ìat Bo. Pangascasan. As seen from the E, the hill is steep and ìheavily wooded and runs N and S. Viewed from the N or S of the W ìside is grassy and free of trees while the E side is heavily ìwooded up to the edge of the ridge. To reach the station, take a ìmotorized banca from Sual town proper to Bo. Pangascasan. The ìstation is due W of the barrio and a trail leads to it. Mark is a ìcross cut on top of a 1/2 in. dia. brass rod set in a big rock ìabout 3 ft. dia. It is situated at the center of a 6 in. x 10 in. ìcement putty inscribed "HALF 2, 1967 PC&GS". This rock was ìformerly a reference mark of station "HALF, 1902-05". RM No.1 is ìa drill hole on top of a small boulder, distant 16.3 m., in ìazimuth 275° 37' 40.4". "RM-1" and an arrow pointing to the ìstation are inscribed on the boulder. RM No.2 is similar to RM ìNo.1, distant 11.22 m., in azimuth 38° 0' 40.4". RM No.3 is also ìsimilar to RM No.1, distant 9.8 m., in azimuth 117° 22' 10.4".

HIGH, 1901-02 Is on the S end of Poro Catipan, a small island 350 m. from the W ìside of Narra Island. There are two high knolls on this island, a ìwooded one at the NW end and a comparatively bare one at the S ìend. The station is on the highest point of the latter. ìSubsurface mark is a bottle buried in the ground. Witness mark is ìa triangle cut on a tree trunk, distant 6.7 m., in azimuth 283° ì30'.

HILL, 1904 Is on Mt. Calomboyan, 3.1 km., in azimuth 147°, from the church ìat Agno and 1.1 km., in azimuth 220°, from the summit of the hill ìon Sabangan Pt. at the N side of the mouth of the Balincaguin ìRiver. Station mark is a wooden hub set in a soft volcanic rock ìwith 15 cm. projecting above the surface. Witness marks ìconsisting of triangles cut on three trees located as follows: ì5.9 m. N, 9.12 m. E, and 12.25 m. S of the station.

HUMAN, 1990 Is in the island of Luzon, Province of Pangasinan, City of ìDagupan, Barangay Pob. Oeste. Station can be reached by foot or ìby vehicle by going west from city hall along the street of A.B. ìFernandez Street. Then turn right toward Human Settlement ìbuilding just near the mouth of Pantal river. Mark is at the ìthird cleat from the west end of the south bank of the river ìfronting DSWD building. It is set on the west side of the ìSW-steel bolt, 41 cm. SW of the center of the cleat, 46 cm. south ìof the south side of the wharf. Mark is a concrete nail embedded ìon the concrete surrounded by cement putty without any ìinscription

ILN-1 Is on an open ground NE of Pasuquin town. Travel time from Pasuquin town proper is approx. 5 min. It is approx. 200 m. N 45° W of Caraun concrete bridge; 75 m. W of the national highway and NW of the 2 aroma trees; about 8.2 km. N of Pasuquin Municipal Hall. Station mark is 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod set in standard concrete block, 0.7 m. deep, flushed with the ground surface and inscribed with the station name. Sub-surface mark is a bottle set in concrete block, 0.806 m. below station mark. Reference marks is 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod set in concrete blocks, 0.6 m. deep, flushed with the ground surface and inscribed with the station name.
ITRF Coordinates:
Latitude: 18° 23' 41.34915"N Longitude: 120° 35' 49.02325"E Ellipsoidal Height: 40.574 m

ILN-10 From Banna Municipal Hall Bldg., proceed to Banna Sports Complex, located about 200 m. W. It is situated near the middle of the quadrangle of the sports complex. It is about 15.5 m. E of the W runway, 30 m. N of the edge of the cemented front of the stage, and about 50 m. WSW of a slaughter house. Mark is the head of a 3" copper nail centered and embedded on top of a 25 cm. x 25 cm. concrete monument set flushed with the ground surface, with inscriptions "ILN-10, 2004, NAMRIA".

ILN-11 Is situated on the rooftop of Batac Municipal Bldg. It is located near the E end corner of the upper rooftop, about 15 m. E of a small antenna tower. It is about 1.9 m. and 2.8 m. perpendicular distance from the N and E edge of the rooftop, respectively. Mark is the head of a 3" copper nail centered and embedded on top of a 22 cm. x 22 cm. cement putty set flushed on the cemented rooftop, with inscriptions "ILN-11, 2004, NAMRIA".

ILN-12 From Dingras Municipal Hall, travel S along the national highway for about 10 min. until reaching the road going W leading to Brgy. Parado. Follow this for about 200 m. until reaching the boundary of Brgys. Cali and Parado. Station is situated at the N side of the rough road near the NW end of the irrigation canal. Mark is the head of a CW nail centered and embedded on a standard BBM monument, 17 cm. x 17 cm. top base, 30 cm. x 30 cm. bottom base, set 30 cm. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "BBM No. 13".

ILN-13 Is situated on the rooftop of the Capitol Hill Bldg. of the municipality of Piddig. It is located on the E central part, about 0.8 m. perpendicular distance from the E edge of the rooftop. E of the Capitol Hill is the municipal park, where the station is in imaginary line with the flagpole and the monument positioned at the middle of the park. Mark is the head of a 3" copper nail centered and embedded on top of a 25 cm. x 25 cm. cement putty set flushed on the rooftop, with inscriptions "ILN-13, 2004, NAMRIA".

ILN-14 From Piddig town proper, travel NE along the general direction of the national highway leading to the municipality of Carasi. Follow this rough dirt road for about an hour until reaching the municipal hall located adjacent to the PNP Office-Carasi. Station is situated on top of the watertank about 700 m. NE of a Globe antenna tower and about 1.3 km. N of the municipal hall. The watertank is visible at the front of the municipal hall. Mark is the head of a 3" copper nail cemented and embedded on top of a 25 cm. x 25 cm. cement putty set flushed on top of a watertank, with inscriptions "ILN-14, 2004, NAMRIA".

ILN-15 From Laoag City, travel N for about 6 km. and turn right just before reaching the bridge (Km. Post 493) and travel for about 5 km. to reach the station. Station is located along the road, with rice field on both sides, going to Sarat. It is about 200 m. S of the Globe tower, SE of the Smart tower, 4.7 m. SSW of a Camachile tree, about 3.8 m. SE of the centerline of the provincial road and 2.3 m. NNE of the N end of the culvert on the SE side of the road. Mark is the head of an iron spike, centered on a concrete block 19 cm. x 19 cm. and 42 cm. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "BBM No. 8".

ILN-16 From the Bacarra Municipal Hall Bldg., proceed to Bacarra Central Elem. School about 50 m. SW. Station is situated near the SW corner of the boundary lot of the school. It is 4 m. and 4.75 m. perpendicular distance from its W and S wall fence, respectively. Mark is the head of a 3" copper nail ceneterd and embedded on top of a 25 cm. x 25 cm. concrete monument set 5 cm. protruding above the ground surface, with inscriptions "ILN-16, 2004, NAMRIA".

ILN-17 From Laoag City, travel N for about 17 km. up to Pasuquin Mun. Hall. Station is located about 70 m. S of the mun. hall, about 40 Km. W of the church main entrance, about 30 m. SW of Rizal monument, about 14 m. SW of a kiosk and about 9 m. E of the SE corner of Pasuquin Elem. School. It is on the SW corner of the concrete fence of the kiosk area located between the Rizal monument and the playground and 1.7 m. S of the 7th lightpost from the N. Mark is a 3 in. copper nail centered on a 27 cm. x 27 cm. concrete block and flushed with the ground surface, with inscriptions "ILN-17 2004 NAMRIA".

ILN-18 From Vintar proper, travel N for about 18 km. or 1 hr. up to Brgy. Tamdagan. Station is located on the NE corner of the basketball court (known as the sports complex) E of the barangay community. It is about 10 m. N of the NW corner of the stage and the flagpole. Mark is a 3 in. copper nail centered on a 10 cm. x 10 cm. cement putty and flushed with the ground surface, with inscriptions "ILN-18, 2004, NAMRIA".

ILN-19 From Laoag City, travel for about 48 km. or 1 hr. up to the catholic cemetery of Burgos near Km. Post 535 and about a kilometer before reaching the town proper. A municipal road on the NE side, few meters after Km. Post 535, leads to the station. It is located infront of the catholic cemetery altar, about 120 m. NE of the national highway, about 150 m. N of Iglesia ni Cristo (INC). Station is located on the intersection of the dike of a rice paddy owned by Astrophel I. Caliva. It is about 30 m. E of the second concrete electric post from the national highway, about 22 m. SE of the altar and about 16 m. SE of the municipal road centerline. Mark is the head of a 3 in. copper nail centered on a 25 cm. x 25 cm. concrete block and 4 cm. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "ILN-19, 2004, NAMRIA".

ILN-2 (PASEAR-2) Travel N along the highway from Manila going to Currimao town. Before reaching the town proper, at the right side of the highway is the United Church of Christ of the Philippines (UCCP), NE of Km Post No. 459. Few meters after UCCP is a dirt road leading to Brgy. Cumcumloong. Travel SE along this dirt road for about 3 km., passing by the Brgy. Cumcumloong boundary marker and turning left upon reaching the basketball court until reaching the end of the dirt road. Then travel along the foot trail (right side of the dirt road) in SSE direction for about 400 m. or 5 mins. up to the station. Station is located on the W edge on top of the bare hill called Lablabaga, the highest hill in the vicinity. It is 3.9 m. N of a Duhat tree on the SW of a bare hill and 11.2 m. S of a Duhat tree on the NW of a bare hill. It is 15.5 m. SE of ILN-2. Mark is a 4 in. copper nail centered on a concrete block, 25 cm. x 25 cm., and 5 cm. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "PASEAR 2, 1978, PCGS, MND".

ILN-20 From Laoag City, travel for about 65 km. or 1-1/3 hrs. up to the municipal town hall of Bangui then turn left on the NE side of the municipal town hall and travel for about 300 m. Station is located on the N corner of Bangui Elem. School compound. It is about 100 m. SE of the shoreline, about 8.5 m. SW of the road centerline, 3.7 m. SW of the NE concrete fence, 4.2 m. SE of the NW barbed wire fence and 4.9 m. S of the N corner fence. Mark is a 3 in. copper nail centered on a 25 cm. x 25 cm. concrete block and 4 cm. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "ILN-20, 2004, NAMRIA".

ILN-21 From Laoag City, travel for about 65 km. to the town of Bangui, then travel for about 3 km. to Brgy. Lanao and then travel again for about 3 km. up to Dumalneg proper. Station is located in So. Cristalina Sanjera Sta. Maria, on the SW corner of a lot owned by Ms. Erlinda Aguinaldo. It is about 150 m. N of the provincial road and the welcome marker of Cristalina, about 20 m. E of the house of Mr. Rafael Aguinaldo and 2 m. E of the dirt road. Mark is a 3 in. copper nail centered on a 25 cm. x 25 cm. concrete block and 4 cm. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "ILN-21, 2004, NAMRIA".

ILN-2A Travel N along the highway from Manila going to Currimao town. Before reaching the town proper, at the right side of the highway is the United Church of Christ of the Philippines (UCCP), NE of Km Post No. 459. Few meters after UCCP is a dirt road leading to Brgy. Cumcumloong. Travel SE along this dirt road for about 3 km., passing by the Brgy. Cumcumloong boundary marker and turning left upon reaching the basketball court until reaching the end of the dirt road. Then travel along the foot trail (right side of the dirt road) in SSE direction for about 400 m. or 5 mins. up to the station. Station is located on the top center of the bare hill called Lablabaga, the highest hill in the vicinity. Reference marks (RM) 1, 2 and 3 are 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod set in concrete blocks and inscribed with their respective RM numbers, eg. "ILN-2, ->, RM-1". Mark is a 4 in. copper nail, centered on a concrete block, 25 cm. x 25 cm. and 5 cm. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "ILN-2, 1989, NAMRIA".
