ILN-3 From Laoag City, travel S along the national highway for about 2 km. towards San Nicolas. Turn left on a concrete road and head towards Solsona town passing through the Municipality of Dingras and travel for about 37 km. From Solsona town, travel farther E for about 5 km. and turn right towards Brgy. Manalpac, then to Solsona Diversion Dam. Station is on top of the NE end of the bridge concrete railings. It is 15 m. S of National Irrigation Administration Office. Station mark is a cross cut on top of a 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod set in a drilled hole centered on a cement putty on top of the concrete railings of the bridge and inscribed with station name. RM Nos. 1, 2 and 3 are cross cuts on top of a 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod set in drilled holes centered on a cement putty, 0.05 m. above the surface of the concrete retaining wall. Inscribed on top with the station name and RM nos.

ILN-3014 From Pasuquin town proper, travel N along the Nat'l highway for about 10 km. After km post 506, turn right leading to Sapat Radar Station and travel for about 12 km. Station is located N of the welcome marker. Mark is the head with a copper nail centered and embedded on a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete monument with inscriptions ILNG-3014, 2007, NAMRIA.

ILN-3017
From Bangui town proper, along the national road, travel NW for about NW for about 8km to reach Brgy. Baruyen. Station is located inside the Baruyen Brgy. Hall compound, at the SE center side of the basketball court, about 17m E of the Brgy. Hall, 16m NE of the stage and about 20m S of the national road. Mark is the head of a copper nail embedded at the center of a 25cm x 25cm concrete monument with inscriptions "ILN 3017, 2007, NAMRIA."

ILN-3018
From Pagudpud town proper, travel along the national road for about 4.5km to reach Brgy. Subec. After KM Post 562, turn left going to Purok Namnama and travel for about 60m. Station is located inside Brgy. Subec compound, about 4m SE of the SE corner of the barangay hall, 6m W of the fence and 11m S of the comfort room.

ILN-3019
From Pagudpud town proper, travel along the national road to reach Brgy. Balaoi, which is in between KM Post 569 and KM Post 570. ILN-4 Is located in the Municipality of Currimao, Province of Ilocos Norte. It is about 50 m. SE of the concrete deck bridge and the old hospital. The road that separates Poblacion II and Brgy. Loies and heading to the seawall is just the location of the station. Station mark is a head of 4" copper nail cemented flushed and set on the lower top of the seawall about 13 cms. from the edge with inscription "ILN-4, 1995, NAMRIA". No reference marks was established.
*Note: Station upgraded to 2nd Order (by: LTSG. Custodio G. Armengol, May 2005).

ILN-5 Is located in the coastal barangay at Brgy. Gabot Norte, Badoc, Ilocos Norte. To reach the station take the road going W from the national road. In the national road, the landmarks are concrete waiting shed fronting each other, a concrete monument inscribing "To Gabot Elementary School", and a concrete arch. Just follow the road and pass the said elementary school and upon reaching the road going right then stop and walk to the shoreline and head going N about 200 m. to the station. Station is set on top of a solid concrete wall, the wall with a width of 25 cms. is perpendicular to the shoreline, and mark is the head of a 4" copper nail cemented flushed. Station is about 0.35 m. above the sand ground and 19.3 m. NW from the offshore end of the wall with inscriptions "ILN-5, 1995, NAMRIA". No reference marks.

ILN-6 Is in Laoag City, Brgy. Nangalisan. It is located at the SW end of the NW side of Gilbert Bridge, at about 1 km. from Laoag City Hall. Mark is the head of a 3" copper nail cemented in a drilled hole on top of the bridge abutment with inscriptions on the cement putty around the mark thus "ILN-6, 1996, NAMRIA".

ILN-66 (FNSP-DENR) Is in So. Bucana, Brgy. Parparoroc, Vintar, Ilocos Norte. From Laoag City proper, take the national road leading to the municipality of Bacarra. Then take the road on the right after passing Tamucalao-1 Bridge. This road is near the building of the Cooperative Development Authority Regional Training Center, before reaching Tamucalao-1 and Bacarra Bridges. Continue traveling this road until reaching the end, near Vintar Central School. Turn right to Gen. Luna St., then turn left to Mariano Marcos Ave. Follow this road until reaching the rough road, a crossing with a waiting shed facing the avenue. Take the road on the left of this crossing passing through a concrete bridge and Brgy. Parparoroc welcome sign. Continue traveling this rough road until reaching Bucana welcome sign. It is located along the SE end of the concrete dike connected to the old Vintar Dam. It is near a series of nipa huts, on the left side of the rough road going to sitio proper and about 150 m. SW of So. Bucana welcome sign. Mark is the head of a 3 in. concrete nail embedded and centered on a 25 cm. x 25 cm. cement putty protruding by about 5 cm., with inscriptions "ILN-66, 2004, PRS-92, FNSP-DENR".

ILN-67 (FNSP-DENR) Is in So. Bucana, Brgy. Parparoroc, Vintar, Ilocos Norte. From Laoag City proper, take the national road leading to the municipality of Bacarra. Then take the road on the right after passing Tamucalao-1 Bridge. This road is near the building of the Cooperative Development Authority Regional Training Center, before reaching Tamucalao-1 and Bacarra Bridges. Continue traveling this road until reaching the end, near Vintar Central School. Turn right to Gen. Luna St., then turn left to Mariano Marcos Ave. Follow this road until reaching the rough road, a crossing with a waiting shed facing the avenue. Take the road on the left of this crossing passing through a concrete bridge and Brgy. Parparoroc welcome sign. Continue traveling this rough road until reaching the Bucana welcome sign. It is located inside the old Vintar Dam, on top of the highest remaining structure. It is located on the SE side near the edge, behind the steel portions, about 20 m. SW of an old headquarters bldg. The dam is located on a hill, near the welcome sign of So. Bucana. Mark is the head of a 3 in. concrete nail embedded and centered on a 25 cm. x 25 cm. cement putty protruding by about 5 cm., with inscriptions "ILN-67, 2004, PRS-92, FNSP-DENR".

ILN-7 Is in Laoag City, Brgy. San Jose. It is located at the NE end of the NW side of Gilbert Bridge, at about 100 m. from Laoag City Hall. Mark is the head of 3" copper nail set and cemented on a drilled hole on top of the bridge abutment, with inscriptions on the cement putty around the mark thus "ILN-7, 1996, NAMRIA".

ILN-8 Is in Ilocos Norte, Mun. of Pasuquin, at Brgy. Caruan, which is about 5 min. travel from the town proper. It is located at the W side of the road going to Burgos town. Mark is the head of a 3 in. copper nail set and cemented in a drilled hole on top of the W retaining wall of the bridge and 15 m. S of the S end of the concrete bridge railing. Inscription on the cement putty around the mark are: "ILN-8 1996 NAMRIA".

ILN-9 From Banna town proper, travel SSE along the general direction of the national highway for about 7 km. Before reaching Bongo Bridge, there is a road going SW leading to Pinili. Turn right and follow this road until reaching the Y-intersection road. Turn left and follow the dirt rough road passing the breeding station at the left side of the road. At the left side of the road is a small hill where the station is situated on its central top. On top of each of these two hills is an electric pole, where the SW pole is the termination of the electrical lines. Duration of travel from the national highway to the station is approx. 8 min. Mark is the head of a 3" copper nail centered and embedded on top of a 25 cm. x 25 cm. concrete monument, set 5 cm. above the ground surface, with inscription "ILN-9, 2004, NAMRIA".

ILS-1 Is on an open ground along the national highway, about 250 m. from the road curve going to Balaleng approx. 120 m. NW from the small hill, about 10 min. travel from Vigan. Accessible by 2-wheel drive vehicle; about 101 m. NW of Km. Post no. 408. Station mark is 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod set in a standard concrete block, 0.7 m. deep, flushed with the ground surface and inscribed with the station name. Sub-surface mark is a bottle set in concrete block, top of bottle is 0.821 m. below station mark. Reference marks is 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rods set in concrete blocks, 0.6 m. deep, flushed with the ground surface and inscribed with the station name and RM number.

ILS-10 (DESTROYED) Is in Brgy. Fuerte, Caoayan, Ilocos Sur. It is located on the NW corner of an artesian well about 5 m. N of Brgy. Fuerte's Lighthouse, and about 25 m. W of the concrete stage. Station mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail embedded and centered on a 6" x 6" cement putty with inscription "ILS-10 2000 NAMRIA".
*Note: Reported DESTROYED by LTSG. Custodio G. Armengol - 13 Feb 2006

ILS-11 (DESTROYED) Is located inside the school compound of Vigan Central Elem. School, on the flower box or path encircling Dr. Jose Rizal's monument. The station is situated on the W pathway of the said monument about 3 m. WNW of Rizal monument, and about 100 m. N of the main gate. Station mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail embedded and centered on a 6" x 6" cement putty with inscription "ILS-11 2000 NAMRIA".
*Note: Reported DESTROYED by LTSG. Custodio G. Armengol - 13 Feb 2006

ILS-12 Is in the town proper of Sinait, inside the compound of Sinait Municipal Park, Brgy. Poblacion, Sinait, Ilocos Sur. It is located at about 6 m. infront of Jose Rizal monument and about 15 m. S of the barangay hall. The municipal park is located on the right side of the national highway going to Laoag City, infront of Sinait Elem. School. Mark is the head of a 3 in. copper nail set flushed in a drilled hole and centered on a 8" x 8" cement putty, with inscriptions "ILS-12, 2005, NAMRIA".

ILS-13 Is located inside the compound of Cabugao South Central School, Brgy. Bonifacio, Cabugao, Ilocos Sur. It is situated on a dike of an uncultivated farm owned by the municipality. It is located about 30 m. SE of the school oval and about 20 m. SE of a concrete shed. It is reached by traveling N coming from Vigan City. The school is on the left side of the highway, opposite Cabugao National High School. Mark is the head of a 3 in. copper nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument, about 60 cm. deep, protruding by 5 cm., with inscriptions "ILS-13, 2005, NAMRIA".

ILS-14 From Vigan City, travel N along the national highway for about 22 km. until reaching the Brgy. Lapting welcome marker on the E side of Km. Post 427 + 166 infront of the vulcanizing shop. Turn W and travel S along the municipal road for about 150 m. to reach the San Juan North Central School. It is located inside the compound on the NW corner fence of the school. It is 2.9 m. SE of the NW corner fence, 2.3 m. S of the N fence and 1.9 m. E of the W fence. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, centered on a concrete block 30 cm. x 30 cm. and 10 cm. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "ILS-14, 2005, NAMRIA".

ILS-15 From Vigan City, travel N for about 14 km. until reaching the Magsingal Bridge at Km. Post 419 + 575. Right after the bridge on the NW side is the Magsingal Health Office and Hospital. It is located inside the hospital compound. It is about 13 m. NE of the NE corner of the front hospital bldg. and about 13 m. NW of the NE concrete fence. It is about 22 m. NW from the centerline of the national highway. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, centered on a concrete block 30 cm. x 30 cm. and 30 cm. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "ILS-15, 2005, NAMRIA".

ILS-16 From Vigan City, travel N along the national highway for about 8 km. until reaching the Santo Domingo Park on the SE side of the national highway. The park is located infront of the municipal hall. It is located inside the park. It is about 8 m. NE (right hand side) of the Benito Soliven monument, about 30 m. SE of the national highway, about 3.3 m. NE of the first step of the NE stair and 0.4 m. NE of the NE portion of the circular concrete base. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, centered on a concrete block 30 cm. x 30 cm. and flush with the ground surface, with inscriptions "ILS-16, 2005, NAMRIA".

ILS-17 Is located inside the compound of the Municipal Fish Market, Brgy. Pandan, Caoayan, Ilocos Sur. It is situated along the concrete pavement of the fish market, near the NE edge. The fish market is located along Quirino Blvd. and NW side of Mestizo River. It is situated about 15 m. NE of the fish market building. Mark is the head of a 3 in. copper nail set flushed in a drilled hole and centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. cement putty, with inscriptions "ILS-17, 2005, NAMRIA".
ITRF Coordinates:
Latitude: 17° 32' 9.70651"N Longitude: 120° 22' 18.42649"E Ellipsoidal Height: 38.238 m

ILS-18 From Vigan City, travel S along the national highway for about 19 km. until reaching the Santa Municipal Hall. It is located about 150 m. W (back side) of the municipal hall along the center of the municipal road. It is about 11 m. SW of the SW corner of the basketball court and on the E end of the second plant box from the municipal hall. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, centered in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. cement putty about 1 cm. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "ILS-18, 2005, NAMRIA".

ILS-19 Is located in Brgy. Quinarayan, Narvacan, Ilocos Sur. It is situated in the W side of the highway junction going to Vigan City, Bangued and Manila. It is near the concrete step, about 6 m. SW of the monument of Andres Bonifacio. Mark is the head of a 3 in. copper nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument protruding by about 5 cm., with inscriptions "ILS-19, 2005, NAMRIA".

ILS-2 Is on an open ground, right side of the road dike leading to the cemetery. Travel time from Sta. Lucia proper is 3 min. Accessible by 2-wheel drive vehicle. Mark is a 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod set in standard concrete block, 1 m. deep, flush with the ground surface and inscribed with the station name. Reference mark (RM) is a 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod set in concrete blocks, 0.6 m. deep, flush with the ground surface and inscribed with the station name. RM No. 2 is a brass rod in a drilled hole.

ILS-20 Is in Brgy. Poblacion Sur, Sta. Maria, Ilocos Sur. From Vigan City, travel S to reach the town of Sta. Maria, passing through the municipal market. Before reaching Sta. Maria Elem. School, turn left to a road with a police outpost on the corner until reaching the municipal nursery on the right side of the road, after the compound of Digitel. Another access is by taking the road on the left after passing through Sta. Maria Elem. School until reaching an intersection where the station is about 150 m. NE. It is located inside the cornfield owned by the municipality, at the back of the compound of the municipal nursery. It is situated 3 m. S of a deep well, about 30 m. S of the municipal nursery, about 100 m. NE of the NFA warehouse. Mark is the head of a 3 in. copper nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument, protruding by about 5 cm., with inscriptions "ILS-20, 2005, NAMRIA".

ILS-21 Is in Brgy. Poblacion, Santiago, Ilocos Sur. From Vigan City, travel S to the town of Santiago. On the town proper, turn left on the street before reaching the Santiago Municipal Hall. This road leads to Santiago South Central School and the municipal concrete water tank. It is located on top of the concrete water tank. The water tank is located beside a mini-park, 20 m. E of Santiago South Central School, about 40 m. NNW of the gymnasium and Santiago Municipal Hall. Mark is the head of a 3 in. copper nail set flushed and centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. cement putty, with inscriptions "ILS-21, 2005, NAMRIA".

ILS-22 From Candon City, travel N along the national highway for about 6 km. then turn E at the junction and travel for about 8 km. until reaching the Lidlidda Public Market. Turn NW and travel for about 4 km. to reach the North Central School. It is located inside the school compound on the science park near the NE corner of the concrete stage. It is 1.5 m. NNW of the E corner of the concrete stage and 0.8 m. NNE of the NE side of the stage. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, centered on a concrete block 30 cm. x 30 cm. and 10 cm. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "ILS-22, 2005, NAMRIA".

ILS-23 From Candon City, travel N along the national highway for about 6 km. then turn E at the junction and travel for about 17 km. until reaching the San Emilio West Central School. It is located inside the school compound on the Math Park. It is on the E corner of the park, about 17 m. WNW of the N corner of the school office and about 23 m. W of Acacia tree no. 8. It is SSE of the municipal hall. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, centered on a concrete block 30 cm. x 30 cm. and 30 cm. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "ILS-23, 2005, NAMRIA".

ILS-24 From the national highway of Candon City proper going to Vigan City, turn left on the road fronted by Jollibee. Continue traveling this road passing through the City Wet Market and University of Northern Philippines (UNP) Annex on the left side until reaching its end, which is a "T" intersection. Take the road to the left passing through Darapidap Beach Resort until reaching the E gate of Ilocos Sur Polytechnic State College (ISPSC). It is located on the right side of the concrete road, approx. 10 m. SSE of the campus' E gate, about 75 m. S of the main entrance. It is also about 15 m. ESE of the campus' concrete water tank. Mark is the head of an umbrella type G.I. roofing nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument protruding by about 5 cm., with inscriptions "CANDON-1, 2004, PRS-92, FNSP-LMS-DENR".

ILS-25 From Candon City, travel E along the road leading to the towns of Galimuyod and Salcedo for about 13 km. or about 30 mins. until reaching the Salcedo Municipal Hall. It is located inside the park infront of the municipal hall. It is about 40 cm. NE from the N end of the E plant box running from the S side of the park. It is about 11 m. N of the kiosk (Senior Citizen Affairs) about 17.5 m. E of the S goal post of the basketball court, about 50 m. E of the municipal hall and about 20 m. WNW of Gregorio del Pilar monument. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, centered on a 22 cm. x 22 cm. cement putty and flush with the ground surface, with inscriptions "ILS-25, 2005, NAMRIA".

ILS-26 From Candon City, travel S until reaching Sta. Lucia town proper, then turn right on the town plaza passing through a basketball court. Then turn left on the intersection, passing through Sta. Lucia Church, Sta. Lucia South Central School and two concrete culverts. Before reaching the next concrete culvert with steel railings and Brgy. Nagrebcan welcome sign, turn right. Travel this road passing through Brgy. Quinabalangayan welcome sign, a chapel, a basketball court and a day care center until reaching the last electrical lightpost in the area, left side. It is inside the compound of Mr. Damaso Cachuela's residence, 10 m. NW of the last lightpost and about 15 m. SW of the nearest house. Mark is one end of a steel rod embedded and centered on a 25 cm. x 25 cm. concrete monument, about 75 cm. high, with inscription "No. 33" (BBM of Brgys. Nagrebcan, Paratong and Poblacion).

ILS-27 Is in So. Cobcobuan, Brgy. Poblacion Norte, Gregorio del Pilar, Ilocos Sur. The town of Gregorio del Pilar can be reached by taking the provincial road passing through the towns of Galimuyod and Salcedo. Continue traveling this road, series of rough/dirt, crossing a river by about ten times until reaching the town proper. Public transportation is difficult and scheduled only once a day. Upon reaching the town proper, take the road to the left, leading to So. Cobcobuan and Tangaoan. Then turn left upon reaching an intersection, an uphill climb with an outpost opposite the road to the left. Continue traveling passing through Gregorio del Pilar High School on the right side. Then stop upon reaching a vacant lot on the left side of the road. Follow the trail going to the hill and ask for the house of Municipal Coun. Domingo Burgos in the area. It is located on the top central part of the hill, between the cultivated areas, where the old municipal hall once stood. The hill is about 15 mins. walk from the town proper. It is located at about 100 m. SE of Coun. Burgos' house, whom is familiar to the station. Mark is the head of a 3 in. copper nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument, about 60 cm. deep, protruding by about 5 cm., with inscriptions "ILS-27, 2005, NAMRIA".

ILS-28 From Candon City, travel S for about 26 km. until reaching a group of restaurants along the national highway in Brgy. Dardarat, Tagudin. A few meters S of Amie's Restaurant is a waiting shed on the NW corner of the street going to Seaside Park. Travel NW along the street for about 400 m. passing by a small bridge to reach the station. It is located inside the resthouse compound of Mayor Roque Verzosa. It is about 19 m. SW of the stairs on the SW side of the house, about 12 m. NW of the river, 3.6 m. N of the S corner fence, 3.1 m. NE of the SW fence and 0.95 m. NW of the SE fence. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail, centered on a concrete block 30 cm. x 30 cm. and 30 cm. above the ground surface, with inscriptions "ILS-28, 2005, NAMRIA".

ILS-29 (BLLM 2) From Candon City, travel S for about 26 km. then turn SW at Bitalag Junction and travel for about 12 km. or about 30 mins. to reach the station at Poblacion, Suyo. It is located about 200 m. W of the municipal hall, about 100 m. WNW of Kimpusa Br. 1 (331 + 805), about 9 m. S from the road centerline, about 3 m. W of the concrete irrigation canal and about 6 m. S of DPWH Km. Post 331 + 700. It is elevated about a meter from the ricefield. Mark is the head of a 4 in. common nail, centered on a concrete block 40 cm. x 40 cm. and flush with the ground surface, with inscription "BLLM No. 2".

ILS-3 (DISTURBED) From Tagudin town, in Ilocos Sur, travel N for 8 km. up to Bitalag road junction. Turn right and travel E on the dirt road for 60 km. up to Cervantes town, passing through Besang Pass. Upon reaching Cervantes town, travel SE; 1 km. up to Cervantes Agro Industrial School. Then 100 m. ahead, turn right to a road that gradually ascending a low hill. Station is located on top of the first hill, 150 m. S of the road going to Baguio City; SE of Cervantes Agro Industrial School; and NE of the water tank located on the second hill. Accessible by 2 wheel drive vehicle up to the station site. Station cut on top of 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod, set on a drill hole, centered on a cement patty on top of 0.40 m. dia. boulder, 0.35 m. above the ground surface. Reference mark; RM-1, RM-2, RM-3, RM-4 are cross cuts on top of 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. diameter brass rods set on drill holes, centered on cement patty on top of irregular shaped rock.
*Note: Reported DISTURBED by SN3 Heintjie T. Balido (August 2005)

ILS-30 (BLLM 2A) From Candon City, travel S for about 26 km. then turn SW at Bitalag Junction and travel along the mostly rough road for about 25 km. or about 1 hr. and 30 mins. to reach the station. A four wheel drive vehicle or vehicle with high profile tires is recommended. It is located about 100 m. SE of Butac Elem. School. It is on the S top of the rock on the S side of the road. Mark is the head of a 3 in. concrete nail, centered on a 28 cm. x 30 cm. cement putty, protruding 6 cm. on top of the rock about 9 m. x 15 m. with a height of about 5 m. from the ground, with inscriptions "BLLM-2A, 2002, PRS 92, FNSP-DENR".

ILS-31 (BLLM 2) From Bitalag, Tagudin, travel for at least 4 hrs. going to Cervantes proper. Station is located about 300 m. S of the municipal hall along the road going to Baguio City. It is also situated on the W side of the road. Mark is a reinforced bar centered on a 40 cm. x 40 cm. concrete monument, with inscription "BLLM No. 2".

ILS-32 (BLLM 1) From Bangar, La Union, on the corner of the rural bank and E of the town plaza, travel SE along the road going to Sugpon for about 40 mins. then cross the Amburayan River via banca for about 2 mins. to reach Sugpon town proper. From the police station, walk along the concrete road for about 15 mins. going uphill to the cemetery and Sugpon Nat'l. High School. It is located in the N side of the cemetery about 15 m. E of a Narra tree, about 12 m. SW of a Duhat tree, about 8 m. W of a rock outcrop (90 cm. x 140 cm. protruding about 30 cm.), 1.3 m. NNE of the NE corner of the niche of Mr. Ronald T. Latong and 1.1 m. N of the N side of the same niche. Mark is the head of a 3 in. concrete nail, centered on a concrete monument 40 cm. x 40 cm. and flush with the ground surface, with inscription "BLLM No. 1".

ILS-3200 From Sinait Town Proper, travel N for about 2 km. then turn right just before the checkpoint leading to Sapriana Elem. School. Continue traveling for 3 km. until reaching Brgy. Cabarambanan. Station is located on the E midside of the basketball court about 8 m. SW of Cabarambanan Brgy. Hall and about 3 m. from the brgy. road centerline. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded on a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. x 1 m. concrete monument, with inscriptions "ILS-3200 2007 NAMRIA".

ILS-3201 From Sinait Town Proper, travel N for about 2 km. then turn right just before the checkpoint leading to Sapriana Elem. School. Continue traveling for 3 km. until reaching Brgy. Cabarambanan. Station is located at the Cabarambanan Elem. School, 8 m. W of the Grade III-IV classroom, 15 m. E of the W side of the concrete fence and about 20 m. W from the flagpole. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded on a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. x 1 m. concrete monument, with inscriptions "ILS-3201 2007 NAMRIA".

ILS-3202 Is located at Pob. Sinait, on top of the concrete boulder of the riprap, 20 m. N of Jr. Carinderia fronting Sinait Nat'l. High School, about 400 m. S of station ILS-12 and about 8 m. away from the centerline of the Nat'l. Highway. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail set on a drilled hole and cemented flushed on top of a 30 cm. x 30 cm. cement putty, with inscriptions "ILS-3202 2007 NAMRIA".

ILS-3203 From Sinait Town Proper, travel E along the street N of the church for about 5 km. until reaching Brgy. Masadag. Station is located E of the concrete brgy. welcome marker of Masadag, about 4 m. away from the brgy. road centerline. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded on a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. x 1 m. concrete monument, with inscriptions "ILS-3203 2007 NAMRIA".

ILS-3204 From Sinait Town Proper, travel E along the street N of the church for about 5 km. until reaching Brgy. Masadag. Station is located 0.4 m. N of the concrete foundation of the Masadag Brgy. Welcome Arch, 150 m. W of station ILS-3203 and about 5 m. away from the brgy. road centerline. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded on a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. x 1 m. concrete monument, with inscriptions "ILS-3204 2007 NAMRIA".

ILS-3205 From Sinait Town Proper, travel N along the Nat'l. Highway for about 2 km. until reaching Brgy. Tapao. Station is located 5 m. N of the brgy. water system. ILS-37 (SSC-1) Is located along the RC Pier, about 2.164 m. SW and 2.996 m. NW end of the pier, at the corner of PAGASA Monitoring (NAMRIA Tidal Observation), about 6.116 m. and 6.195 m. NE. Mark is the head of a 3 in. concrete nail centered on top of a 20 cm. x 20 cm. concrete pavement (poured with cement) near the end of the pier, with inscription "SSC-1".

ILS-38 (SSC-2) Is located in Brgy. Sulvec, Narvacan, near the coast line of RC Pier, about 500 m. along the national road. It is about 71 m. NE of Km. Post 380+ and 3.5 m. N of the brgy. road going to the said pier, about 37.5 m. SE of a Kamantilis tree. Mark is the head of a 3 in. concrete nail centered on a 20 cm. x 20 cm. concrete monument protruding by about 5 cm., with inscription "SSC-2"

ILS-4 Is located in Brgy. Salomague, Cabugao, Ilocos Sur and it is set on the offshore end of the Salomague Pier. Station is about 5.6 m. NE from the N corner and 1 m. S from the N edge and mark is the head of a 4" copper nail cemented flash with inscription "ILS-4, 1995, NAMRIA". No reference marks.
*Note: Station upgraded to 2nd Order (by: LTSG. Custodio G. Armengol, May 2005).

ILS-5 (DESTROYED) Is located in Salomague Island, Brgy. Salomague, Cabugao, Ilocos Sur. Station is on the SSW coast of Salomague Island on the SE top of big rock made of coral. The rock is the biggest in the locality of about 7 m. dia., 6 m. high, and has a cave from ting the sea with rectangular opening of 2 m. high and 5 m. wide. Mark is the head of a 4" copper nail on a concrete monument 25 cm. x 25 cm. placed on top of a protruding 0.6 m. dia. coral rock with inscription "ILS-5, 1995, NAMRIA", and about 0.2 m. above the rock ground. Reference marks, RM-1 is 3.1 m. WNW and RM-2 is SSE from the station. RM's is cemented flash on top of a coral rock is ahead of 4" copper nail with an arrow pointing to the station.
*Note: Reported DESTROYED by LTSG. Custodio G. Armengol - 13 Feb 2006

ILS-6 Is located on the coastal barangay at Brgy. Surngit, San Juan. Station is placed on locally known as "Raois Point" whose locality is a fishpond area and set on top corner edge of a fishpond dike, being 5 m. from the high water line. Mark is head of a 4" copper nail on a 25 cm. x 25 cm. concrete monument with inscription "ILS-6, 1995, NAMRIA", and about 0.5 m. from the dike edge. Fishpond owner is Mr. Criscencio Vite. No reference marks. To reach the station from the national road of poblacion of San Juan take the road going W. There is a concrete monument marker that points to the said Brgy. Surngit along the national road, distance is about 5.1 km. Just follow the road and upon reaching a wooden small bridge then the steel arch of Brgy. Surngit straight then and take the road going left and follow again the road until reach the NW extremity of the coast.
*Note: Station upgraded to 2nd Order (by: LTSG. Custodio G. Armengol, May 2005).

ILS-7 (DESTROYED) Is in Ilocos Sur, Municipality of Bantay at Brgy. Baleleng, along the national highway between Km. Post 408 and Km. Post 409. It is located on an open ground at the W side of the road and about 50 m. S of the highway intersection with the road going to Brgy. Sagpat. Mark is the head of 3" copper nail set in a standard concrete block 0.7 m. deep flush with the ground surface and inscribed, "ILS-7, 1996, NAMRIA".
*Note: Reported DESTROYED by LTSG. Custodio G. Armengol - 13 Feb 2006

ILS-8 Is located in Bo. Sulvec, Narvacan, Ilocos Sur and is set at the concrete flooring of basketball court, E side of the first step of stair of the concrete stage structure. Station mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail embedded and centered on a 8 in. x 8 in. cement putty with inscribe station name "ILS-8, NAMRIA 2000". Mr. Mario Albayaldo is familiar to the station.
*Note: Station upgraded to 2nd Order (by: LTSG. Custodio G. Armengol, May 2005).

ILS-9 Is located in Bo. Bacsil, San Juan, Ilocos Sur at the hilly portion of Bacsil National High School compound, 10 m. W from the school building. Station mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail embedded and centered on a 8 in. x 8 in. cement putty set at the edge of a concrete road with inscribe station name "ILS-9, NAMRIA, 2000".
*Note: Station upgraded to 2nd Order (by: LTSG. Custodio G. Armengol, May 2005).

INFANTA, 1951 Is located at the centerline of the right angle turn of Highway ìNo.7 NE of Infanta town square. Station mark is a 29E bronze disk ìset in concrete 1 ft. below the surface of the road, and is ìstamped "INFANTA". RM No. 1 is a tree, azimuth 25°, distant 28 ìft. RM No.2 is a tree, azimuth 210°, distant 39.7 ft. RM No.3 is ìa tree, azimuth 300°, distant 36.3 ft.

ISLE, 1977 Is on the W coast of Luzon, Bolinao Harbor, province of ìPangasinan, municipality of Bolinao, on a small rock island 5 m. ìin dia., about 50 m. N of Triachera Pt. The breakwater at Bo. ìLuciente I is visible on the SE of the station. To reach the ìstation, follow the trail from the landing place leading to ìTriachera Pt. for the best approach. Station mark is the center ìof the cross cut on a 1/2 in. dia. brass rod drilled and cemented ìon the rock inscribed by a 10 cm. equilateral triangle marked ì"ISLE, 1977, PC&GS".

JOCKO, 1948-63-67 Is in San Fernando Harbor, near the E shore, immediately N from ìthe town of San Fernando. Station is in the center of the ìconcrete domed roof of the reservoir atop the hill at the N end ìof Zandueta St. Station is the center of a 50 cal. cartridge ìcemented in a drill hole in the center of the concrete dome. RM 1 ìis a 30 cal. cartridge set in the footing of the structure on the ìN side. RM 2 is the NW corner of the chlorination tank, distant ì8.856 m., in azimuth 42° 3' 49.6" of the station. RM 3 is a ìcopper nail set in a drilled hole on the concrete footing at the ìE edge of the structure and surrounded by cement putty, distant ì8.138 m., in azimuth 144° 59' 39.6" of the station. An arrow ìpointing to the station and "RM 3" are inscribed on the putty ìsurrounding the mark. RM 4 is a copper nail set in a drilled hole ìon the concrete footing at the NW edge of the structure and ìsurrounded by cement putty, distant 8.48 m., in azimuth 259° 55' ì49.6" of the station. An arrow pointing to the station and "RM 4" ìare inscribed on top of the putty surrounding the mark.

JOIN, 1901 Is on Santiago Island NNE of the landing place at Bolinao. The ìshoreline is comparatively straight at this point. The station is ì30 m. NW of a fenced road 5 m. wide, running inland from the ìbeach normal to the shoreline. It was on a flat, irregular coral ìrock 7 m. long, embedded in the sand on the beach 4.6 m. from the ìhigh watermark. This rock does not stand more than a foot above ìthe sand at any point and is submerged at high tide. There was a ìgrove of coconut trees on the beach N of the station. Station ìmark is a 12 cm. wire nail driven into the rock 1.34 m. from its ìS end. Witness mark is a triangle facing the station cut on the ìtrunk of the nearest tree, 60 cm. from the ground and 130 m. from ìthe station.

KIN, 1952 To reach the station, proceed E from Highway No.3 junction ìleading to Caniaw Forest, following the low trail leading E to ìthe water reservoir, passing through a bridge for water pipe. ìUpon reaching a building on the other side of the bridge turn ìleft crossing a stream and follow a trail in a general E ìdirection for about 2 hrs. Hike until reaching the highest peak ìwhere the old station (Loro) is located. A group of trees and ìbushes are 50 m. SE of the station and the bamboo groves are 50 ìm. N of the station. Station mark is a 3-1/2 in. round brass cap ìmarked Corps of Engr. US Army and as set in a concrete block a ìfoot deep.

LANDING, 1977 Is on the W coast of Luzon, Bolinao Harbor, province of ìPangasinan, municipality of Bolinao. Station is on the break ìwater at Bo. Luciente I, about 1.2 km. E of the town proper. ìStation mark is the center of the cross cut on a 1/2 in. dia. ìbrass rod embedded and cemented on the center of the concrete ìbreakwater, 4.5 m. from the offshore end, inscribed by a 10 cm. ìequilateral triangle marked "LANDING, 1977, PCGS".

LANTAG, 1903 On one of the first foothills of the low range about 2 km. ENE of ìthe town of Santa Cruz and 1 km. SE of the Dabao River. A trail ìleading up the ridge from the rice fields on the S side passes ìover this hill and about 7 m. to the N of the station. The latter ìis not on the top of the ridge but on the first small level place ìwhich the trail crosses after leaving the foot of the spur. It is ìat an elevation of 50 m., and near the W end of spur projecting W ìfrom the main mass. Subsurface mark is a bottle buried 75 m. ìbeneath the ground. Station mark is a large rock with a drill ìhole on its top.

LAOAG CBT, 1903-52 The center of the tower in the town of Laoag. It is about 100 m. ìE of the center of the plaza on the N side of a street leading E ìtherefrom. It is about 100 m. north of a group of church ìbuildings, and about 250 m. W of another.
LAPUG CHURCH TOWER, 1903 The center of the tower on the front of Tayog Church.

LAS, 1958 Is on the W coast of Luzon, in Pangasinan Province, in Caquiputan ìStrait, on the E slope of the N top of a two crested hill just N ìof the ferry landing on the W side of Caquiputan Strait. Station ìis about 2 m. below and about 15 m. E of the N crest of the hill. ìMark is a crosscut on top of the center of a 1/2 in. dia. brass ìrod embedded on a drilled hole in a coral rock with cement putty ìaround and with a circle circumscribed in it and with inscription ì"LAS 1958 PC&GS".

LIGHT, 1972 On the W coast of Luzon, province of Ilocos Sur, municipality of ìTagudin, Bo. Farola about 2 km. NW of the town proper. Station ìmark is the center of the detachable lantern on the white ìcylindrical tower 27 ft. high.
LIGHTHOUSE, 1977 Description not available.

LIGHTHOUSE 2, 1963-67 Is in the island of Luzon, province of La Union, town of San ìFernando, Bo. Poro, 2.2 miles W of San Fernando, 1.05 km. S of ìSan Fernando Pt., on top of the San Fernando Pt. Lighthouse. Mark ìis the top center of the iron finial of the Lighthouse. To reach ìthe station from San Fernando, take the road leading to the Voice ìof America Radio Compound through Poro. A road inside the ìcompound leads W to the station.

LIME, 1948-63 Is in Luzon, province of La Union, town of San Fernando, at San ìFernando Harbor, at Bo. Poro, 1.32 miles W of the capitol bldg. ìat San Fernando, 250 m. NW of the outboard end of Pier 2, 490 m. ìNE of the high water line. Station is the top center of the mast ìof the only wreck lying off the piers with a mast showing above ìthe water. The center of the mast just above the yard arm was the ìpoint observed upon.

LIN, 1951-73 Is located W of the N tip of Panaen Island. Form of nail with ìwasher on top of coral rock where station is supposed to be was ìfound. RM No.1 is a cross on a coral rock, 7.635 m., S 5° W. RM ìNo.2 is a nail in a small tree, 6.394 m., S 80° W. RM No.3 is an ìarrow on a coral rock, 4.992 m., N 5° W.

LIN 2, 1977 Is on the W coast of Luzon, province of Pangasinan, municipality ìof Bolinao. Station is located on the point W of the N tip of ìPanaen Island. It is on a 2 m. x 2.5 m. rectangular coral rock 6 ìm. E of the shoreline. Station is awash during high tide. Station ìmark is the center of a cross cut 1/2 in. dia. brass rod embedded ìin a concrete putty. RM No.1 is the head of a 4 in. c.w. nail ìembedded on a concrete putty, 2.59 m. azimuth 22° 52.8". RM No.2 ìis the head of a 4 in. c.w. nail embedded on a concrete putty ì5.13 m, azimuth 75° 7.7". RM No.3 is the head of a 4 in. c.w. ìnail embedded on a concrete putty 4.83 m., azimuth 142° 20.7".

LING, 1948-63-67 San Fernando Harbor, the E shore about 2-1/2 km. N of the town of ìSan Fernando. It is about at the boundary between Bos. Carlatan ìand Lingsat. Station is atop the highest sand dune about 17 m. in ìdia. from the high water line and about 500 m. N of an old ìSpanish Fort. Station is the center of a 50 cal. cartridge set in ìthe center of a cylinder of concrete 6 in. in dia. and 3 ft. long ìprotruding about 6 in. above the ground. RM 2 is a 50 cal. ìcartridge cemented in drill holes in rocks protruding about 3 in. ìabove the ground.
LINGAYEN CHURCH BELFRY, 1902-05-51 Is the center of the belfry on the tower of the church in the ìtown of Lingayen.
LINGAYEN U.C.C. SPIRE, 1967 Is the apex of the spire of the United Church of Christ in ìLingayen.

LINGAYEN WEST BASE, 1905-07 Is on the S shore of Lingayen Gulf in the municipality of ìLingayen. It is 6.1 km., in azimuth 96° 34', from the belfry of ìthe church at Lingayen. Going along the beach toward San Isidro ìthe station is beyond all the fishing camps and houses except the ìlast one, which is in a small coconut grove just back from the ìbeach, and N of Bo. Balongabon. The station is about 200 m. E of ìthis house and back of the low sand hills at a distance of 206 m. ìfrom the high watermark. There are rice fields all around the ìstation except toward the beach. Station mark is circular granite ìpost, 46 cm. in dia. at the bottom and 30 cm. at the top and 1.37 ìm. long. It weighed about 600 kg. and was set in the ground 1.22 ìm., leaving 15 cm. projecting above the surface. The excavation ìwas 90 cm. in dia. and was entirely filled with concrete after ìthe post was set. In the top of the post a hole 7.5 cm. in dia. ìand 7.5 cm. deep was cut, and was filled with cement, in the ìcenter of which a small hole marked the station. Cross lines were ìalso cut on the top of the post with their intersection marking ìthe station.
LINGAYEN WEST RADIO TOWER, 1967 Is the top center of the W of the two prominent steel radio tower ìof Lingayen.

LOM, 1990 Is in the island of Luzon, Province of Pangasinan, City of ìDagupan, Barangay Lolomboy. Station can be reached by boat ìflying from Pantal going to Lolomboy. Then, from the waiting ìshed follow the path leading towards Lolomboy Elementary School. ìMark is located at the concrete stage situated within the school ìcompound. It is 18 cm. E from the inner face of the East side of ìthe NW parapet, about 5.8 meter SW of the flagpole. Mark is a ìconcrete nail embedded on the concrete slab surrounded by ìconcrete putty with inscription LOM, 1990.

LONE TREE, 1903 On the highest of the low foot hills between Luna and Darigayos, ìand between the Darigayos River and the shore line. It is about ì2.4 km. NE of Darigayos, about 400 m. W of the head of Darigayos ìRiver, and close to a small barrio of saltmakers. The hills is ìcultivated up to the top. There is a conspicuous lone tree in top ìof the hill 12 m. E of the station. Station mark is a drill hole ìin the fixed rock on the highest part of the hill, which is ìrounding but of small extent.

LUCAP, 1979 Is in Brgy. Lucap, Alaminos, Pangasinan. It is the center of the ìsuplementary light of the Lucap Lighthouse tower which is 0.68 m. ìfrom the main light. The station has a vertical distance of 1.53 ìm. from the face of the topmost concrete step wherein the ìobserver can occupy and the instrument can be set up for ìobservations. Station can be projected downward to the topmost ìconcrete step which is about 9.85 m. high from the base. Mark is ìthe center of the supplementary light with no inscription made.

LUCY, 1977 Is on the W coast of Luzon, Bolinao Harbor, province of ìPangasinan, municipality of Bolinao at Bo. Lucero in Santiago ìIsland NNE of Boliao Landing place. The shoreline is ìcomparatively straight at this point. The station is 40 m. NW of ìLucero waiting shed located at the end of the road runnig inland ìfrom the beach and normal to the shoreline. It is submereged at ìhigh tide. RM Nos.1, 2 and 3 are similar. It is the head of a 3 ìin. c.w. nail and cemented on a rock with an arrow pointing ìtowards the station and marked "RM 1" , "RM 2" and "RM 3", ìrespectively. RM No.1 is 10.8 m. from the station with azimuth ì228° 16.42'. RM No.2 is 13.97 m. from the station with azimuth ì290° 46.25'. RM No.3 is 16.46 m. from the station with azimuth ì330° 49.75'.

LUN-10 (JOCKO 1948) Is located on the concrete dome of a water district concrete tank/reservoir. To reach the station from San Fernando Town Hall, take the road leading to Zandueta St. and turn left until reaching the end of the road. Then hike uphill for about 200 m. passing by a transmitter of PHILTEL. From this point the concrete dome of the water reservoir is already visible. Follow the trail that leads to the station. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail embedded on a 0.1 m. x 0.1 m. cement putty, with inscription "LUN-10 1996 NAMRIA".

LUN-11 To reach the station, from San Fernando town proper travel toward Poro Pt. and turn right on a access road leading to Philex Pier. Ask permission on the main gate to have access of their private port, then continue travel and head towards the offshore end of the pier. Station is located on the offshore end of the pier, on a observation platform, W of the main pier and about 20 m. NE of San Fernando tide station and 100 m. NNE of Philex Mining Main Office. Station mark is the head of a 4.0 in. copper nail centered and embedded on a 0.1 m. x 0.1 m. cement putty with inscription "LUN-11 1996 NAMRIA".

LUN-12 To reach the station, travel N along the national road from San Fernando town proper to Brgy. Carlatan and turn left on a service road leading to the Philippine National Police Headquarters (CAMP DIEGO SILANG). Station is located within the PNP Headquarters, about 15.0 m. S of the Provincial Director's House and 13.0 m. SW of their cadet training center. Station mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail embedded and centered on a 0.1 m. x 0.1 m. cement putty with inscription "LUN-12 1996 NAMRIA".

LUN-13 From San Fernando town proper, head W until reaching Antieta St., continue travel seaward until reaching San Fernando Multipurpose gym, and Radio station DZYR. Turn left on end of Antieta St. and continue travel for about 100 m. until reaching the SW corner of the multipurpose gym. Station is located on flatform on a stairway of the concret seawall. It is 10 m. of the SW corner of the gym and 50.0 m. SW of the Radio Station DZYR. Station mark is the head of a 4.0 in. copper nail embedded and centered on a 0.1 m. x 0.1 m cement putty with inscription "LUN-13 1996 NAMRIA".

LUN-14 From San Fernando town proper, travel westward to Poro Pt. for about 5.0 kms. up to the Walace Air Station. Ask permission to enter the Military Air Station before entering the base. Then continue travelling for about 200m and turn right towards the shore (Walace Beach resort) then continue travel westward along the rocky shore until reaching the first very prominent rocky just behind two Hangars for Helicopters. Station mark is the head of 10mm steel bar embedded and centered on a 12" x 12" concrete monument with inscription "WALACE-1"

LUN-15 Is in the Island of Luzon, Province of La Union, Municipality of Sto. Tomas, Brgy. Palac. It is located at the NW corner of Palac Bridge about 500 m. S of the Municipal Hall of Sto. Tomas. Mark is the center of the head of 4" copper nail set flush with cement putty on the sidewalk of the bridge with inscription "LUN-15, 1996, NAMRIA. It is accessible by land transportation via the Rosario-Agoo National Road.

LUN-16 Is in the island of Luzon, province of La Union, municipality of Sto. Tomas, Brgy. Palac. It is located infront of the 3 columned waiting shed at the corner of National Road-Municipal Hall road junction. It is set at the SE edge of the concrete pavement about 10 m. away from the centerline of the national road and 15 m. from the center of Municipal Hall road. Mark is the center of the head of a 4" copper nail set flush with the cement putty with inscription "LUN-16, 1996 NAMRIA". It is accessible by land transportation via Agoo-Rosario National Road.

LUN-17 Is located at Bauang Power Plant Corp. compound, Bgy. Payocpoc, municipality of Bauang, province of La Union and is found near BPPC Pier measured about 12 m. NE of guard house no. 3 posting at jetty gate and 10 m. SE of guest house. Station is a putty cement centered by 3" copper nail on the road edge towards the pier and marked "LUN-17, 1997, NAMRIA".

LUN-176 (FNSP-DENR) From Candon City, Ilocos Sur, travel S to the province of La Union passing through Balaoan town proper until reaching Km. Post No. 292 on the left side of the highway. Travel more for about 300 m. until reaching a concrete waiting shed on the right side of the highway, before reaching a highway curve and the road leading to Magic Star Fireworks Factory. Beside the concrete shed is a trail, follow this trail until reaching a house with an artesian well beside a series of Coconut trees. It is located on a corner of a farm dike, about 15 m. SE of the well and about 20 m. SW of the nearest house. Mark is the head of a 3 in. concrete nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument protruding by about 5 cm., with inscriptions "LUN-176, 2004, PRS-92, FNSP-DENR-I".

LUN-179 (FNSP-DENR) From Candon City, Ilocos Sur, travel S to the province of La Union until reaching Km. Post No. 302 on the left side of the highway on the town of Balaoan. It is about 2 m. SE of Km. Post No. 302, after passing through a concrete culvert with the sign DPWH Km. 302 + 033 marker on the left side of the highway, near an irrigation canal. It is about 7 m. from the highway centerline. Mark is the head of a 3 in. CW nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument protruding by about 10 cm., with inscriptions "LUN-179, 2004, PRS-92, FNSP-DENR".

LUN-64 From San Juan Catholic Church, turn right on the next street going to San Gabriel. Travel 500 m. E until reaching San Juan Bridge. Station is located on the NW end of the said bridge. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. cement putty, with inscriptions "LUN-64 2007 NAMRIA".

LUN-189 (FNSP-DENR) From Candon City, Ilocos Sur, travel S passing through Bangar town proper until reaching a road going to Sinapangan Norte. This concrete farm road is on the left side of the highway with a ricemill and a Brgy. Police Force oupost on the corner. This road is next after passing through Km. 304 + 387 marker of the DPWH and a concrete waiting shed. Follow this road passing through Brgy. Sinapangan Norte welcome sign, until reaching an intersection with a barangay outpost on the left corner. Take the road to the left until reaching another intersection. Take the road on the right, making a U-turn. Follow this road until reaching a "T" intersection. It is located on the right corner of the intersection, near an irrigation dike. Mark is the head of a 3 in. concrete nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument protruding by about 5 cm., with inscriptions "LUN-189, 2005, PRS-92, FNSP-DENR".

LUN-19 Is in the island of Luzon, province of La Union, town of Aringay at Brgy. San Eugenio. It is located on a basketball court fronting Km. Post 240 which is about 300 m. S of the San Eugenio barangay hall. It is about 20 m. NNW of the NE corner of the stage, 7.0 m. SSE of the NE corner of the basketball court, and 0.40 m. from its E side. The mark is a copper nail set in a drilled hole and flushed with concrete putty bearing the inscription "LUN 19, 1997, NAMRIA".

LUN-195 (FNSP-DENR) Is in Brgy. Bangaoilan West, Bangar. Station is reached by taking the concrete farm road on the right side of the highway going to Candon City, Ilocos Sur, with the brgy. hall, basketball court and chapel on the corner, before reaching Bangaoilan East Elem. School on the left side. Then turn right and travel for about 100 m. Station is located on the right side of the road, beside an irrigation canal, near a concrete walk connecting the road and the irrigation dike. It is about 30 m. SW of a concrete walk bridge just before reaching a road curve. Mark is the head of a 3 in. roofing nail embbedded and centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument protruding by about 5 cm., with inscriptions "LUN-195 2005 PRS-92 FNSP-DENR".

LUN-196 (FNSP-DENR) Is in Brgy. Bangaoilan West, Bangar. Station is located on the right side of a concrete farm road, along a curve, about 150 m. SSW of the brgy. hall, basketball court and chapel. It also about 5 m. ESE of an electrical light post, near an irrigation canal. The concrete farm road leading to the station is on the right side of the highway going to Candon City, Ilocos Sur, with the brgy. hall, basketball court and chapel on the corner, before reaching Bangaoilan East Elem. School on the left side. Mark is the head of a 3 in. roofing nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument protruding by about 5 cm., with inscriptions "LUN-196 2005 PRS-92 FNSP-DENR".

LUN-197 (FNSP-DENR) Is in Brgy. Bangaoilan East, Bangar. Station is reached by taking the concrete farm road on the right side of the highway going to Candon City, Ilocos Sur. This road is on the opposite side of Bangaoilan East Elem. School compound, the next road after passing through the brgy. hall, church and basketball court. Travel this road until reaching an intersection. Take the road on the left then turn right on the road just before reaching a road curve. Continue traveling this road passing through a concrete culvert until reaching an artesian well on the right side of the road where the station is located. It is situated at the NE corner, about 2 m. from the artesian well. It is also located at about 20 m. S of a concrete culvert. Mark is the head of a 3 in. roofing nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument protruding by about 5 cm., with inscriptions "LUN-197 2005 PRS-92 FNSP-DENR".

LUN-2 Is on top of the highest hill of the pasturing land of Mr. Tabura, 500 m. E of the national highway and ESE of the Agoo Rice Mill and Trans-Manila Inc. Redrying Tobacco Plant. Station mark is the center of the hole on the center of a standard concrete monument with inscription "ANA, 1990, NAMRIA."

LUN-20 Is in the island of Luzon, province of La Union, municipality of Rosario at Brgy. Rabon. It is located 350 m. NNW of Rabon Bridge; 120 m. NW of main gate of Shell LPG Rabon Depot, 50 m. NNW of a waiting shed fronting said depot, 10 m. from the centerline of the road and 5.0 m ESE of a 1.0 m. public toilet. The mark is a concrete nail driven on top of an existing 0.22 m. x 0.22 m. concrete block which is inclined with the vertical by approx. 10 and protruding from the ground by about 0.19 m. it bears the inscription, "LUN-20 1997 NAMRIA".

LUN-200 (FNSP-DENR) Is in Brgy. Bangaoilan East, Bangar. Station is reached by taking the concrete farm road on the right side of the highway going to Candon City, Ilocos Sur. This road is on the opposite side of Bangaoilan East Elem. School compound, the next road after passing through the brgy. hall, church and basketball court. Travel this road until reaching an intersection. Station is located on the W side of the intersection, about 1 m. from an electrical light post, near an irrigation canal. Mark is the head of a 3 in. roofing nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. concrete monument protruding by about 5 cm., with inscriptions "LUN-200 2005 PRS-92 FNSP-DENR".

LUN-21 Is situated at Brgy. Rabon, municipality of Rosario, province of La Union. Mark is located at the SE end of Rabon Bridge. Station mark is a 3" copper nail centered on a cement putty on the shoulder bridge approach inscribed "LUN-21, 1997 NAMRIA."

LUN-22 Is in the province of La Union, municipality of San Fernando, Brgy. Apaleng. Station mark is the head of 2" copper nail, embedded and centered on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. x 1.0 m. concrete monument with inscription "LUN-22, NAMRIA".
Note: Intervisible to station LUN-23.

LUN-23 Is in the province of La Union, municipality of San Fernando, Brgy. Apaleng. Station mark is the head of 2" copper nail embedded on a 0.30 m. x 0.30 m. x 1.0 m. standard concrete monument with inscriptions "LUN-23 NAMRIA". Station is intervisible to station LUN-22.

LUN-24 Is in the province of La Union, municipality of Naguillan, Brgy. Masicong. Station mark is the head of 4" concrete nail drilled and centered on a 8" x 8" concrete monument set on a ground surface with inscription "NAMRIA, LUN-24.
Note: Station is intervisible to station LUN-25.

LUN-25 From San Fernando city, travel S direction up to Bauang Junction, then travel SE going to Naguillan, turn left after Luguit Bridge going to Masicong passing thru Brgy. Lablaban accessible only by 4 wheel drive vehicle. Station mark is the head of a 4" concrete nail drilled and centered on a 8" x 8" standard concrete monument set on the ground surface with inscription "NAMRIA, LUN-25"

LUN-26 Is located at the pasture land at the highest peak of the hill at Brgy. Namtutan, San Fernando City, province of La Union. Mark is a the head of a 10" x 10" standard concrete monument, 1 m. depth from the ground surface and with inscription "NAMRIA, LUN-26". Contact person Mr. Edgar Paringit, DENR, Region I.
Note: Intervisible to LUN-27

LUN-27 Is in the province of La Union, city of San Fernando, Brgy. Namtutan. Station mark is the head of 4" concrete nail drilled and centered on a 10" x 10" standard concrete monument set at the ground surface with inscription "NAMRIA, LUN-27". Station is intervisible to LUN-26.

LUN-28 Is in the province of La Union, town of San Juan, Brgy. Naguituban. Mark is a 2 mm. dia. brass rod drilled and centered on a 10" x 10" cement putty set on top in the W corner of the abandoned concrete railways foundation of the bridge. Station name was inscribed on top, thus; "NAMRIA, LUN-28". Station is intervisible to station LUN-29

LUN-29 Is located at the grassy area at the foot of the hill in Brgy. Naguituban, San Juan, La Union. Station mark is the head of a 4 in. concrete nail drilled at the center of a 10" x 10" standard concrete monument; 1 m. depth from the ground surface with inscription "NAMRIA, LUN-29". Station is intervisible to station LUN-28.

LUN-3 (NAR) Is on the ruins of Narvacan Elem. School. It is located on the NE edge of the stage. Mark is the head of a 4" copper nail. Inscriptions on the cement putty reads "NAR, 1990, NAMRIA". No reference marks established.

LUN-30 Is located at the Brgy. Eugenio, Aringay, La Union along the national highway at the top center of the concrete culvert, W side of the road. Mark is the head of a 3 in. steel bolt embedded and centered on a 0.12 m. x 0.12 m. cement putty with inscription "BM-30".

LUN-3001 Is located at the northern tip of island triangle going to the municipality of Pogo. Mark in the head of a 3 inches concrete nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm x 30 cm x 100 cm standard concrete monument protruding by about 2 cm with inscription LUN-3001 PRS-92 DENR FNSP R-1.

LUN-3001A
Travel along Rosario going to Pugo highway to reach San Luis Plaza, about 150 m NE of the brgy. hall. Station is located along the NE side of the basketball court, about 5 m SE of the N corner of the rectangular cement pavement, 8 m S of the gate of the house, and about 25 m NE of the road centerline. Mark is the head of a copper nail centered and embedded on a 30 cm x 30 cm concrete monument with inscriptions LUN-3001 2007 NAMRIA.

LUN-3002 Is located in front of Inabaan Elementary School 50 m away from Welcome arch and beside the gate of Barangay Captain F. Molina of Barangay Inabaan, Rosario, La Union. Mark in the head of a 3 inches concrete nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm x 30 cm x 100 cm standard concrete monument protruding by about 20 cm, with the inscription LUN-3002 PRS-92 DENR FNSP R-1.

LUN-3002A
From Tubao municipal hall travel along the road going to Brgy. Gonzales. Follow the road to reach South Masalip irrigation canal. The station is located on the cemented part of the said irrigation canal, about 1 m N of Masalip Magsaysay monument. Mark is the head of a 4" copper nail centered and embedded on a 20 cm x 20 cm cement putty with inscriptions LUN-3002 2007 NAMRIA.

LUN-3003 Is located at northeast port Amlang barangay basketball court beside the slanting gate to highway Amlang, Rosario, La Union. Mark in the head of a 3 inches concrete nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm x 30 cm x 100 cm standard concrete monument protruding by about 20 cm, with the inscription LUN-3003 PRS-92 DENR-FNSP R-1.

LUN-3003
Is situated on top of the 3 m high water tank located at the Burgos Public Market. Mark is the head of a 4" copper nail centered and embedded on a 20 cm x 20 cm cement putty with inscriptions LUN-3003 2007 NAMRIA.

LUN-3004 Is located at northern part of the island in front of the Lupa Transport, MPC gas station, Namunitan, Sto. Tomas, La Union. Mark in the head of a 3 inches concrete nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm x 30 cm x 100 cm standard concrete monument protruding by about 20 cm, with the inscription LUN-3004 PRS-92, DENR FNSP R-1.

LUN-3004A
From Bacnotan proper, travel along the highway going to Laoag, Ilocos Norte to reach barangay Bitalag. Turn left at the road crossing, passing Bitalag brgy. hall and reach Bitalag Elementary School. Station is located about 1 m SE of the center of the SE side of a volleyball court, about 50 m NE of the school gate and about 30 m SW of the flagpole. Mark is the head of a 4" copper nail centered and embedded on a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete monument, with inscriptions LUN-3004 2007 NAMRIA.

LUN-3005 Is located in frotnt of Iglesia ni Cristo beside the entrance gate at Bail Sto. Tomas La Union. Mark in the head of a 3 inches concrete nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm x 30 cm x 100 cm standard concrete monument protruding by about 20 cm, with the inscription LUN-3005 PRS-92 DENR-FNSP R-1.

LUN-3005
From Bacnotan municipal hall, travel along the highway going to Laoag, Ilocos Norte to reach Brgy. Bitalag. Turn left at the road crossing. Upon reaching the end of the road, turn right to reach the boundary bridge of Brgys. Paraoir and Almeida. Continue travelling for about 80 m then turn left at the road going to Almeida Elementary School. Station is located inside the flower box (where the Rizal monument is situated), about 1.3 m W of the said monument and 8 m S of the flagpole. Mark is the head of a 4" copper nail centered and emebedded on a 25 cm x 25 cm concrete monument with inscriptions LUN-3005 2007 NAMRIA.

LUN-3006 Is located at the southeastern part of the barangay basketball court of barangay Nambongan, Sto. Tomas, La Union. Mark in the head of a 3 inches concrete nail embedded and centered on a 30 cm x 30 cm x 100 cm standard concrete monument protruding by about 20 cm, with the inscription LUN-3006 PRS-92 DENR FNSP R-1.
