Station mark is a head of a 4" copper nail set on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. x 1.0 m. concrete monument with inscription on top with "LUN-50 NAMRIA 2000".

LUN-51 From San Fernando city travel south towards the municipality of Agoo. Turn to the Marcos Highway towards the barangay Macalva Sur for about 10 mins. ride. Station is located 3 m. leftside of the east end corner of Macalva Bridge. It is about 50 m. from km. post No.239. Station mark is a head of 4" copper nail set on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. x 1.0 m. concrete monument with inscription on top with "LUN-51 2000 NAMRIA".

LUN-52 From San Fernando city travel south towards the municipality of Agoo. Turn to the Marcos Highway towards the barangay Macalva sur for about 10 mins. ride. Station mark is located about 200 m. east of LUN-51. It is about 20 m. northeast of Marcos highway and is about 15 m. north of waiting shed. It is situated east of Little Baguio barangay road. Station mark is a head of 4" copper nail set on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. x 1.0 m. concrete monument with inscription on top with "LUN-52 2000 NAMRI".

LUN-53 From San Fernando city travel south towards the municipality of Agoo. Turn left at the junction at brgy Nambuongan and travel for about 5 km. on a dirt road towards brgy. Capas. Station is located on elevated hill and about 30 m. from the road. It is about 150 m. south of the waiting shed. Station mark is a head 4" copper nail set on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. x 1.0 m. concrete monument with inscription on top with "LUN-53 2000 NAMRIA".

LUN-54 From San Fernando city travel south towards the municipality of Agoo. Turn left at the junction at brgy Nambuongan and travel for about 5 km. on a dirt road towards brgy. Capas. Station is located east of the brgy. boundary monument of Capas. It is about 70 m. north of creek and is about 300 m. north of LUN-53. It is about 2 m. east of the brgy. monument. Station is a head of 4" copper nail set on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. x 1.0 m. concrete monument with inscription on top with "LUN-53 2000 NAMRIA".

LUN-55 From San Fernando city travel southeast towards the municipality of Naguillan. Then travel north towards the municipality of Bagulin. The station is located on the roof top of the municipal town hall of Bagulin situated on the southeast corner of the roof top. Station mark is a head of 4" copper nail set on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. x 1.0 m. concrete monument with inscription on top with "LUN-55 2000 NAMRIA".

LUN-56 From San Fernando city travel southeast towards the municipality of Naguillan. Then travel north towards the municipality of Bagulin. Station is located about 120 m. east of the town hall. It is located on a lot owned by a certain Fidel Estera Jr. and about 3 m. from the left side of the road towards brgy. Tambili. Station mark is a head of 4" copper nail set on a 30 cm. x 30 cm. x 1.0 m. concrete monument with inscription on top with "LUN-56 2000 NAMRIA".

LUN-57 From Urdaneta, travel toward Rosario Mun. Hall. Then travel NW for about 50 m. then turn left until reaching the auditorium backstage. Station is located on the town auditorium compound infront of the stage. Mark is a 30 cm. x 30 cm. x 1 m. concrete monument flushed on the concrete pavement, the same level with the basketball court adjacent to it.

LUN-58 From Urdaneta, travel towards Rosario. Upon reaching the Rosario junction road, turn right and proceed towards Pugo until reaching the "P1" Km. Post. Station is located 8.5 m. SW of the said km. post and is 2.5 m. N of the S end of the island. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. x 1 m. concrete monument, with inscriptions "LUN-58 2007 NAMRIA".

LUN-59 From San Fernando town proper, travel towards Naguilian town then proceed SE until reaching Brgy. Angin intersection. Then turn right and proceed towards Brgy. Alalinao junction, then turn left at the "Welcome to Brgy. Alalinao" sign arc and follow the rough road until reaching the ricemill site. Station is located at the top of the hill, which is about 30 m. SW of the ricemill of Sitio Sinapangan. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. x 1 m. concrete monument, with inscriptions "LUN-59 2007 NAMRIA".

LUN-6 (PCP-122) From Bauang municipal proper, turn W along the national road going to Baguio City. Upon reaching Brgy. Ribsuan, turn right to the barangay road leading to Brgy. Sili. The station was approx. 50 m. ahead. The station is located at the Province of La Union, Municipality of Naguilian, Brgy. Sili. It was established on the intersection of a rice paddy and the E side of the road. Mark is the head of a 4" copper nail set on top center of a 9" x 9" square concrete monument set flush to the ground, with inscription "LUN-6, 1994, NAMRIA".

LUN-60 From Agoo town proper, travel towards San Fernando until reaching Caba Mun. Hall. Station is located infront of Caba Farmer's Multi-Purpose and Trading Center and is SE from the mun. hall. It is also situated on Caba Mun. Plaza concrete flooring, 7 m. SW of the flagpole and SE of Diego Silang monument. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. cement putty, with inscriptions "LUN-60 2007 NAMRIA".

LUN-61 From Agoo town proper, travel towards Bauang until reaching the Brgy. Payocpoc Sur Police Station, then turn left and travel towards BPPC of about 40 m. from the intersection. Station is located at the right side of the road, situated near the BPPC Housing and is infront of the fourth street light. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. cement putty, with inscriptions "LUN-61 2007 NAMRIA".

LUN-62 From Naguilian Town Hall, travel N to Brgy. Baraoas Norte until reaching the rough road and the river control. Station is located 15 m. S from the first access ladder of the river control and about 100 m. N from the end. It is also situated 300 m. S of a hanging bridge. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. cement putty, with inscriptions "LUN-62 2007 NAMRIA".

LUN-63 From San Fernando town proper, travel E towards Brgy. Bacsil. Then proceed ahead until reaching Brgy. Puspus. Station is located near the W end of the riprap and is 0.4 m. SW from the end of the said riprap. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. cement putty set on the side of the concrete pavement, with inscriptions "LUN-63 2007 NAMRIA".

LUN-64 From San Juan Catholic Church, turn right on the next street going to San Gabriel. Travel 500 m. E until reaching San Juan Bridge. Station is located on the NW end of the said bridge. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. cement putty, with inscriptions "LUN-64 2007 NAMRIA".

LUN-65 From San Gabriel town proper, turn left before reaching Brgy. Bumbuneg Bridge. Travel N until reaching Brgy. Lipay Sur. Station is located about 500 m. from the Y-intersection adjacent to the brgy. waiting shed. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. cement putty on top of the riprap, with inscriptions "LUN-65 2007 NAMRIA".

LUN-66 From San Fernando, travel N towards San Juan. Travel along the NE road leading to San Gabriel town. Then continue traveling towards Brgy. Bayabas until reaching the junction rough road. Take the right road leading to Brgy. Balbalayang. Station is located inside Sisi Elem. School compound. It is situated on the top of the boulder, 10.7 m. from the NE corner of the school stage. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a cement putty on top of the boulder, with inscriptions "LUN-66 2007 NAMRIA".

LUN-67 From Bacnotan town proper, travel 5.5 km. NE until reaching Brgy. Quirino. Station is located on the SE end of Maragayap West Bridge, about 300 m. S of Union Cement Plant. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. cement putty, with inscriptions "LUN-67 2007 NAMRIA".

LUN-68 From Santol Town Hall, turn right to Brgy. Pobalcion East. Travel 0.5 km. until reaching the steel bridge. Station is located at the NE foot of the bridge after the last concrete barrier. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. x 1 m. monument protruding 0.2 m. from the ground, with inscriptions "LUN-68 2007 NAMRIA".

LUN-69 From Balaoan town proper, travel 2.3 km. N to Pantar Norte, then turn right and travel 3.3 km. E to Brgy. Caliat. Station is located on the foot of the bridge going to Brgy. Caliat proper. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. x 1 m. monument leveled with the road surface, with inscriptions "LUN-69 2007 NAMRIA".

LUN-7 (PCP-124) From the Municipality of San Fernando, travel W to Brgy. Poro for about 5 km. up to the Wallace Air Station. Ask for permission to enter the compound since it is a restricted area for civilians. The station is located at the Province of La Union, Municipality of San Fernando, Brgy. Poro, inside the Wallace Air Station compound. The station is on the SE corner of the intersection of V-shaped concrete canal and pathwalk, SW of the Medical/Infirmary building. Mark is the head of a 4" copper nail embedded on a drilled hole and flushed to a cement putty with inscription "LUN-7, 1994, NAMRIA".

LUN-70 From Luna town proper, travel 500 m. W to Brgy. Magallanes. Station is located at the NW edge of a proposed seaport, about 50 m. S of the brick tower (baluarte). Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. cement putty, with inscriptions "LUN-70 2007 NAMRIA".

LUN-71 From Bangar Town Hall, travel 2.5 km. NE to Brgy. Bangaoilan. Turn right at the brgy. welcome arc. Station is located about 100 m. from the said arc, situated beside the irrigation canal at the right intersection of the brgy. roads. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. x 1 m. monument protruding 0.2 m. from the ground, with inscriptions "LUN-71 2007 NAMRIA".

LUN-72 From Agoo Mun. Hall, travel towards San Fernando, about 1 km. after passing the first bridge. Travel for about 200 m. and turn left. Continue traveling for about 80 m. where the station is located. Station is situated in the right edge of the road and is about 20 m. SW of the San Agustin Norte Day Care Center. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 30 cm. x 30 cm. cement putty, with inscriptions "LUN-72 2007 NAMRIA".

LUN-73 From San Fabian, Pangasinan, travel towards Damortis until reaching Bani North Bridge. Station is located on the NE end of the said bridge. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a cement putty, with inscriptions "LUN-73 2007 NAMRIA."

LUN-74 Is located in Brgy. Old Central, between Brgys. Ilocano and Namaltugan. It is situated on the middle of a dike E of a steel bridge and an irrigation bridge and is 8 m. N of the S end of the dike. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail centered and embedded in a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. cement putty flushed on the ground, with inscriptions "LUN-74 2007 NAMRIA".

LUN-8 (TAM, 1974) Is in the Island of Luzon, Province of La Union, Municipality of Bacnotan, about 2 km. NW of the town's center, on a hill at Bo. Tamocalao, E of the municipal road running parallel to the shore. This road passes at the NW foot of the hill. The station is located on a slope about 64 m. SE of the SE peak of the hill. Mark is a cross cut on a 5/8" dia. brass rod set on top center of a 1" x 1" concrete monument set flush on the ground with inscriptions "TAM, 1974, NAMRIA". RM-1 is the head of a 3" C.W. nail set on a 6" x 6" concrete monument flush with the ground with inscription "RM-1" and an arrow pointing towards the station, distance 6.52 m., 137° 47' azimuth. RM-2 is a similar mark with inscription "RM-2" and an arrow pointing the station, distance 7.62 m. 246° 37' in azimuth. RM-3 with inscriptions "RM-3" and an arrow pointing to the station, distance 7.01 m. and 51° 14' in azimuth.

LUN-9 From Bauang town proper, turn right to Naguilian road and travel for about 7 km. up to Naguilian town plaza. The station is located at the right side of the national road going to Baguio City and is accessible by 2-wheel drive vehicles. The station was established in the province of La Union, municipality of Naguilian inside the town plaza. It is located at the concrete pavement of the children's playground, about 20 m. W of the basketball court and about 10 m. SW of the gate. Mark is the head of a 4" copper nail embedded on hole and cemented flush to the concrete pavement with inscription "LUN-9, 1994, NAMRIA".
LUNA BRICK TOWER, 1903 The center of a large circular tower on the beach infront of the ìtown of Luna.
LUNA CHURCH NORTH TOWER, 1903 The center of the N tower of the church in the town of Luna.

LUNA CHAPEL, 1903 An undescribed point in the town of Luna, presumably some ìconspicuous object on a small church which may best be identified ìby its difference in position from the other two points in Luna.

LUX, 1958 Is on the W of Luzon, in Pangasinan Province, in Cabarruyan ìIsland in the vicinity of Tambac Bay, about 0.75 mile NW of a ìdetached island on the second point NW of Toritori Pt. Mark is ìthe center of a crosscut on top of a 1/2 in. dia. brass rod ìembedded in sandstone with cement putty around and with a circle ìcircumscribed in it and with inscription "LUX 1958 PC&GS".

MAB, 1979 Is in Mt. Simimbahan in Brgy. Caranlaan, Mabini Pangasinan. It is ìsituated on top of a bare mountain top with cogon grasses about ì800 m. W of Caranlaan Elem. School and about 500 m. NW of the ìhighway curve. To reach the station from Mabini town proper, take ìthe national highway to Agno and stop about meters after passing ìthe Caranlaan Elem. School. Then take the trail W of the highway ìcurve going uphill, upon reaching the ridge proceed further N up ìto a bare mountain top and to the station. Mark is a 1.27 cm. ìdia. brass rod cemented on top of a 25 cm. x 25 cm. concrete ìmonument with inscriptions "MAB, BCGS, 1979".

MABINI WEST BASE, 1951 Is located 2 km. N of the municipality of Mabini, 12 ft. W of the ìcenterline of Highway No.7. Station mark is a bronze disc set in ìcement buried 12 in. below the ground surface. RM No.1 is a large ìmango tree, azimuth 90°, distant 54.1 ft. RM No.2 is a steel ìpole, in azimuth 190°, distant 18 ft. RM No.3 is a stump of a ìlarge tree, 221 m., azimuth 310° 2'.

MAESTRO, 1902 On the beach about 5 km. S of the mouth of the Aringay River near ìBo. Cantana which is NW of the town of Agoo. The station is 7 m. ìE of the high watermark on a dune on a sand ridge, which ìparallels the beach and is partly covered with grass. 3 m. E of ìthe station is a ditch 1 m. deep, also parallel to the beach. ìThe highest sand dune in this vicinity is slightly higher than ìthe station and is 11 m. farther N. E of the ditch at a distance ìof 70 m. S of the station is a group of three shacks, while at ì200 m. to the N is another group of five shacks. It is about 200 ìm. toward the SE are some coconut and other smaller trees, while ìtoward the E are many dykes and old rice fields. Subsurface mark ìis the center of a bottle buried at a depth of 35 cm.
MAGSINGAL CHURCH BELL TOWER, 1903-52 Is the center of the bell tower of Magsingal Church. This tower ìis a detached structure, 80 m. N of the church.
MAGSINGAL CHURCH TOWER, 1903-52 The center of the small turret on the front or W gable of ìMagsingal Church.

MAN, 1958 Is on the W coast of Luzon, in Pangasinan province, in Tambac Bay ìon the highest point of Gayaman Island. Mark is the center of a ìcrosscut on top of a 1/2 in. dia. brass rod embedded on top of a ì6 in. square concrete monument with a circle circumscribed on it ìand with inscription "MAN 1958 PC&GS".

MANAOAG, 1905 Is on the foundation of the church in the town of Manaoag. The ìwalls were about 6 m. high and 2 m. thick on the top. A nipa ìchurch was built within the wall, its top only reaching the level ìof the latter. The station was on top of the wall over the main ìentrance to the church. Station mark is a drill hole in the rock ìwith a triangle cut around it. Searched for by Bureau of Lands in ì1910 and reported not found.

MANAOAG CHURCH BELL TOWER, 1968 Is the apex of the dome-shaped roof of the bell tower of Manaoag ìRoman Catholic Church, located infront of the town plaza. The ìstructure is made of bricks and concrete and is approx. 19.817 m. ìhigh.

MANAOAG CHURCH DOME, 1968 Is the apex of the octagonal concrete dome of the Manaoag ìCatholic Church located infront of the town plaza and at the ìcenter of the town proper. The structure is made of concrete and ìabout 16.768 m. high.

MANGAS, 1901 Is on the highest point of Mangas Pt., which marks the S side of ìthe entrance to Sual Harbor. The top of the hill was cleared of ìbrush and the station was surrounded on the E, N and W sides by a ìsemicircular trench 1.5 m. wide and 0.9 m. deep. The station is ìin the center of the semi-circle 7.6 m. from it's inner edge. ìSubsurface mark is a bottle buried in the ground with its top 15 ìcm. beneath the surface.
MANGATAREM CBT, 1951 Is the center of the bell tower of the church in the town of ìMangatarem.

MANUNG, 1903-15-52 On the E side of Mairaira Pt., on the summit of the outermost of ìthe two cone-shaped islands known as "Dos Hermanos". These ìislands are about 2 km. SE of the point and are on a reef ìextending 500 m. offshore. Station mark is a 2 cm. drill hole, 2 ìcm. deep, at the center of the flat top of an irregularly shaped ìrock set flush with the ground surface.

MAPALYON, 1905-68 Is on the W coast of Luzon, Pangasinan province, about 12.2 km. W ìof the town of Camiling, Tarlac, 7.2 km. SW of the town of San ìClemente, Tarlac, 12.2 km. S of the town of Mangatarem, ìPangasinan, of Bo. Lawak Langka. A dirt logging road passes S ìthru Bo. Andangin 500 m. W of the station. During the dry season, ìthe station could be reached easily by use of logging trucks ìgoing beyond the Zambales-Pangasinan provincial boundary. A good ìcamping place is at Bo. Lawak Langka where water supply is ìavailable even during dry season, from the nearby creek. It is a ì1 hr. walk from this barrio. Station mark is a drill hole at the ìcenter of a triangle cut on a large fixed rock projecting 10 cm. ìabove the ground. Reference marks are drill holes cut in three ìlarge fixed rocks bearing arrows pointing to the station. RM No.1 ìdistant 17.023 m., in azimuth 233° 2'; RM No.2 distant 6.46 m., ìin azimuth 310° 2'; and RM No.3 distant 13.463 m., in azimuth ì138° 8'.

MARGAAY, 1903-15 On an isolated mountain, called Mt. Narvacan, on the SE side of ìSolvec Cove, 3 km. NE of Narvacan. The main road from Santa to ìSanta Maria runs around the N and E bases of the mountain. There ìis a ridge on top of the mountain running N and S for about 0.5 ìkm. and the station is on the S end of this ridge. From Margaay ìon the N side of the mountain a trail leads up to the ridge and ìalong it to the station. Station mark is a drill hole in the ìsolid ledge.

MAT, 1958 Is on the W coast of Luzon, in the province of Pangasinan, on an ìoffshore coral rock known as Garingan Rock, not on the highest ìpart but on a sort of a saddle. Mark is the center of a crosscut ìon top of a 1/2 in. dia. brass rod embedded in a drilled hole on ìtop of the rock, with cement putty around and with inscription ì"MAT 1958".

MID, 1901 Is on Panaen Island, a small island situated between Santiago ìIsland and the mainland at the mouth of the first wide opening in ìthe channel going SE from Bolinao. The station is on the highest ìpoint of the island, in the center of a barren mound a little W ìof the center. Station mark is a copper bolt in the center of a ìsmall rock, the top of which just shows above the top of the ìmound. The station is 40 cm. from the S edge of the rock and 60 ìcm. from the W edge. The nearest large tree was about 30 m. from ìthe station, in azimuth 332°.

MIGUEL, 1979 Is in Brgy. San Miguel, Bani, Pangasinan. It is situated on the ìinterection of rice paddy dikes. Said rice paddies are being ìattended by Mr. Orias. To reach the station from the national ìhighway, take the gravel road leading to Brgy. San Vicente and ìSan Miguel, about 1.8 km. from the highway turn left on a road ìand proceed further W up to the end of the road which terminates ìon the rice paddies. There is a step down grade just before the ìroad ends. The station is about 100 m. from the foot of the steep ìslope. Mark is a 1.27 cm. dia. brass rod cemented on top of a 25 ìcm. x 25 cm. concrete monument set almost flush with the dike ìwith inscriptions, "MIGUEL, BCGS, 1979".

MINE, 1902-48-63-67 It is 1.8 miles SSE of San Fernando, at Bo. Sevilla Sur, about ì700 m. E of the national highway No.3 to Bauang, about 300 m. E ìof the railroad, about 120 m. SE of a small cemetery, on the ìmiddle and highest of three peaks of a long ridge which runs ìparallel to the national highway and which forms the boundary ìbetween the barrios of Sevilla on the W and Bungro on the E, on a ìlot owned by Mr. Canuto Sanglay. To reach the station from San ìFernando, take the national highway leading to Bauang. Turn left ìon the gravel road about 200 m. N of Km.266. A trail SE of the ìcemetery leads to the station. Reference mark (RM) No.3 is a cast ìiron spike set in a concrete monument about 3 ft. deep and about ì6 in. in dia., distant 3.43 m., and in azimuth 251° 41' 44" of ìthe station. An arrow pointing to the station and "RM 3" are ìinscribed on top of the monument surrounding the mark. RM 4 is a ìcopper nail set in a drilled hole in a rock and surrounded by ìcement putty, distant 3.96 m., in azimuth 8° 49' 4" of the ìstation. An arrow pointing to the station and "RM 4" are ìinscribed on top of the putty surrounding the mark. RM 5 is a ìcopper nail set in a drilled hole on a rock surrounded by cement ìputty, distant 3.79 m., in azimuth 148° 26' 4" of the station. ìAn arrow pointing to the station and "RM 5" are inscribed on top ìof the putty surrounding mark.

MISS, 1901 Is on a sandy point on the NW end of Santiago Island. This is the ìfirst sandy point to the N on the E side of Bolinao Harbor and is ì1.6 km. S of the N extremity of the island. A large grove of ìcoconut trees extending to the beach at this point can be seen ìfrom a long distance and marks the immediate vicinity of the ìstation. The station is on the end of the point and is 35 m. ìoutside high watermark. Subsurface mark is a bottle buried 30 cm. ìin the ground. Witness mark No.1 is a triangle facing the station ìcut on the trunk of a tree between the station and high ìwatermark, distant 31.09 m., in azimuth 293° 24'. Witness mark ìNo.2 is a triangle facing the station cut on the trunk of a ìcoconut tree at the edge of the high watermark, distant 40.54 m., ìin azimuth 345°.

MON, 1958 Is on the W coast of Luzon, in the province of Pangasinan, on ìCabarruyan Island, on the highest part of Don Justo Hill, about ì600 m. SW of the SE edge of Boboruan Island. Mark is the center ìof a crosscut on top of a 1/2 in. dia. brass roed embedded on top ìcenter of a concrete monument about 25 cm. and with inscriptions ì"MON 1958".
MORLING II, 1901 No description available.

NAGPARTIAN, 1903-33 On a hill near the mountain trail from Pasuquin, to Bangui, and ì3.1 km. in azimuth 20° 16', from Nagpartian Church. This hill has ìa rock reef running along its top. Station mark is a drill hole ìin the rock, over which a cairn was built.

NALVO, 1903-15-52 It is about 3 km. W of Santa Maria and 250 m. from the beach on ìthe highest of several isolated hills which lies along the coast ìwith their bases close to the beach. This hill is 125 m. high and ìcovered with shrub and bushes and small trees. A well-worn trail ìleads from Bo. Nalvo to the top of the hill. Station mark is a ìdrill hole in the solid ledge. There is a pile of rocks 2.1 m. ìW of the station, said to mark an old Spanish survey station. A ìgood view of the coast can be had from the station.

PNG-5 = NAMBERSIAN To reach the station from the catholic church in Aguilar town ìproper to Brgy. Ninoy proper, approx. 2.8 km. SE, turn left at ìthe intersection of the national road and dirt road going to the ìbarrio proper of San Jose. Travel on the dirt road passing by ìseveral houses. For about 800 m. from the road intersection in ìBrgy. Ninoy, there is a foot trail near the last house at the ìfoot of the hill that leads to the station. The station is in the ìcenter top of the rock but not the highest part. Two ladders were ìused to scale the rock. Station mark is original drilled hole ìfound, 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rod set in drilled hole with ìcement patty and inscribed with station name. Reference mark (RM) ìis 4, RMs are 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rods set in drilled ìholes on top of a big rock, 4 m. x 5 m. x 12 m. dia. and ìinscribed with RM numbers. Original drilled holes of RM-1, RM-2 ìand RM-3 were recovered.
WGS84 COORDINATES: N 15 52 3.48331 E 120 15 13.27568
ELLIPSOIDAL HT. : 141.7439 m.

NAR, 1958 Is on the W of Luzon, in the province of Pangasinan, on the ìprominent point on the W part of Narra Island, about 0.5 m. from ìthe edge of the point. Mark is the center of a cross cut on top ìof a 1/2 in. dia. brass rod embedded in a drilled hole on a coral ìrock, with cement putty around and inscription "NAR 1958 PC&GS".

NARVACAN, 1982 Is in the island of Luzon, Province of La Union, town of Sto. ìTomas, Brgy. Narvacan about 1.6 km. SSE of barangay proper, about ì300 m. N of the tip of the tiny peninsular land, on the sandy ìshore about 40 m. W of the inner high water line. Station mark is ìa cross cut on a 5/8" dia. brass rod set flush on top of a ìstandard concrete monument which protrudes about 10.2 cm. above ìthe ground. Inscribed on the surface of the monument is a ìtriangle surrounding the mark and "NARVACAN 1982". No reference ìmark was established.

NARVACAN CHURCH, 1903-52 The center of the tower of Narvacan Church. The bell tower is ìdetached from the church and stands toward the SW. Two ìobservations were named "Narvacan Church tower" and on one ì"Narvacan bell tower", but the adjustment shows that all were on ìthe same point. It is most probable that there is no tower on the ìchurch, and that station is the bell tower.

NAVY, 1948 Is in Lingayen Gulf, the E shore, about 0.6 mile S of the back ìfrom the bluff and 70 m. W of the lighthouse. An elevated ìstructure about 100 ft. high, the tallest on the Peninsula, ìformerly the control tower for the base. The point observed upon ìwas the top of the mast at the NW corner of the structure. ìStation not marked or occupied.

NEAR, 1901 Is on the point of the mainland at a distance of 250 m. directly ìS of Panaen Island. It is 6 m. SE of the end of the point. The ìbank here is about 1.5 m. high and is composed of soft, ìslate-colored clay. The station is on a small coral rock, 52 cm. ìx 82 cm. This rock is awash at high tide and stand 1.7 m. outside ìof the bank. Station mark is a copper bolt. The nearest tree was ìat high watermark 30 m. SE of the station.

NEGRA, 1903-15-52 On Negra Pt., which forms the W side of Bangui Bay. This point is ìlow, but near the coast there are five isolated masses of rock. ìThe station is on the highest and most E of those and is about ìmidway between the N and S edges of the small flat top of the ìrock and about 1.3 m. from its W edge. There is no vegetation ìnear the station. It is about 50 m. offshore opposite the station ìis another isolated rock. The following azimuths will locate the ìstation, left tangent to rock offshore 191° 54', right tangent to ìthe rock offshore, 201° 48', tangent to Dialao Pt., 240° 23'. ìStation mark is a 2 cm. hole, 5 cm. deep, drilled in the rock. ìAnother hole was drilled 10 cm. further N than the station, but ìwas afterward abandoned and the S hole used instead. A cairn of ìrocks was built over the mark.

NINA, 1902 Is near the S end of the W side of Caquiputan Strait, about 125 ìm. S of the ferry landing at Bo. Lasip. The station is 75 m. from ìthe shore on a small circular mound 0.8 m. higher than the ìsurrounding ground. The ground is covered with grass and slopes a ìlittle towards the E. SW of the station are two wooded hills. ìSubsurface mark is a bottle buried in the ground 40 cm. below the ìsurface of the highest point of the mound. Witness mark is a ìtriangle facing the station cut on the trunk of a tree 0.09 m. ìfrom the ground, 14 m. W of the station. A trail leading from the ìshore ran 3.5 m. W of the station. There was a bamboo shack 50 m. ìN of the station.

NOC, 1958 Is on the W coast of Luzon, in Pangasinan province, in Tambac ìBay, on the top of Manoc Island. Mark is the center of a crosscut ìon top of a 1/2 in. dia. brass rod cemented in a concrete ìmonument flushed to the ground surface and with a circle ìcircumscribed on it and with inscriptions "NOC 1958 PC&GS".

NORTH, 1982 Is in the island of Luzon, province of La Union, town of Agoo, ìBrgy. Sta. Rita on the sandy shore about 1.2 km. NNW of the ìPresidential Resthouse and 75 m. from the high water line. ìStation mark is the head of a 10.2 cm. nail set flush on top of a ìstandard concrete monument which protrudes about 15.2 cm. above ìthe ground. A triangle surrounding the mark and "NORTH 1982" was ìinscribed on the surface of the monument. No reference mark was ìestablished.

NUBBLE, 1903 On the highest knoll of a narrow ridge which is the third from ìthe coast and which has its origin a short distance SE of Santa ìMaria. This ridge gradually rises until the station is reached at ìan elevation of 261 m., at a point 3.5 km. due E of Santiago. A ìwell-worn trail leading to Candon follows the top of the ridge ìand passes close to the station. This trail is reached by one out ìof San Esteban and also by one which branches off the main road ìbetween Santa Maria and Nueva Coveta and climbs the E side of the ìmountain. The whole ridge in this vicinity is covered with grass, ìgiving the peaks a bald appearance. The first trail passes 4 m. E ìof the stations. Station mark is a drill hole in the top of an ìirregularly shaped rock weighing about 100 kg., set in top about ì5 cm. above the ground. Subsurface mark is the center of a bottle ìburied at depth of 0.9 m.

NUT, 1958 Is on the W coast of Luzon, in Pangasinan province, in Cabarruyan ìIsland, about 1.4 mile NW of Toritori Pt. on top of a point 6 m. ìinshore from the steep side. Mark is the center of a crosscut of ìa 1/2 in. dia. brass rod embedded on top center of a 10 in. ìsquare concrete monument with a circle circumscribed in it and ìwith inscription "NUT 1958 PC&GS".

OLD, 1904 Is on a small grass covered hill to the W of the trail leading ìfrom Dasol to Balincaguin and to the S of the road from Burgos to ìBalincaguin. It is about 7 km. NE of Dasol and 4 km. SW of ìBalincaguin and is W of the valley of the Balincaguin River. On ìthe W edge of the cultivated river valley is a high bluff, W of ìwhich and about half way to the station is the trail leading from ìDasol to Calincaguin. Station is 50 m. to the NW of the trail. ìDirectly S of the station and beyond the trail is a small knoll, ìwhile NE of the station and beyond the trail is a knoll of about ìthe same elevation but somewhat large. Subsurface mark is a ìbottle buried vertically about 45 cm. below the surface of the ìground. It was witnessed by three bottles at the same depth in a ìhorizontal position with their necks pointing toward the station. ìStation was surrounded by a circular ditch, 1.2 m. in radius and ì15 cm. deep.
OLD FORT, 1903 The center of a large and very prominent brick tower on the beach ìjust S of the S end of Pinget Island.

OLE, 1904-06 Is in the extreme N part of Dasol Bay on the SW point of Nuli ìIsland, which is about 1.2 km. E of Bo. Uli and about 1.4 km. W ìof the mouth of the Dasol River. It is at an elevation of 9 m. ìSubsurface mark is a bottle buried vertically at 45 cm. below the ìsurface surrounded by three bottles placed horizontally and ìpointing towards the station. A circular ditch with a radius of ì1.2 m. and 15 cm. deep was dug around the station. Station mark ìis a wooden peg with a nail in the center. Witness mark No.1 is a ìrectangular mark cut on the stump of a tree on the edge of the ìbluff 7.75 m. SW of the station. Witness mark No.2 is a triangle ìcut on a tree 33.05 m. N of the station. Witness mark No.3 is a ìrectangle cut in a tree 24.25 m. NE. The subsurface mark was ìrecovered in 1906, but the surface mark was gone. The circular ìditch remained very plain.

OPEN, 1901 Is on Santiago Island at the SW corner of Tombac Pt., which is ìsituated just N of Panaen Island. The station is on an irregular, ìflat, coral rock projecting from the bottom of the bank in the ìshape of a ledge awash at high tide. The station is 4.1 m. ìoutside the bank which is of decomposed coral and 2.96 m. outside ìa tree, one of the branches of which was cut off 90 cm. from the ìstation. Station mark is a 12 cm. wire nail driven into the rock ì2.4 m. from its W end and 0.9 m. from its S edge. Witness mark is ìa triangle cut on the rock at a distance of 47 cm., in azimuth 9° ì30' from the station.

OUT, 1901-02 Is on a point on the mainland due W of the N edge of Narra Island ìand due S of Panaen Island. It is on the E side of the point ìabout 300 m. S of the end, on an irregular coral rock 1 m. long. ìThis rock and a larger rock 0.6 m. inside it are the only large ìrocks on this part of the shore. A large coral boulder rests ìagainst the bank at high water line and is 3.9 m. SW of the ìstation. Directly behind the station at a distance of 12.2 m., ìstood a large tree. There was heavy undergrowth between this tree ìand the station. Station mark is a copper bolt set in the rock.

PAN, 1951-77 Station was recovered as described, but in poor condition. The ìstation was reinforced with a 1/2 in. dia. brass rod. 3 reference ìmarks were established.
*Revised description follows:
On the W coast of Luzon, Bolinao Harbor, province of Pangasinan, ìMuniciplity of Bolinao. Station is on a small detached rock 7 m. ìN of Panen Island and SW of Tambac Pt. on Santiago Island. ìStation mark is the center of the crosscut on a 1/2 in. dia. ìbrass rod embedded on a cement putty on a 4.5 m. dia. coral rock ìinscribed 10 cm. equilateral triangle, "PAN 1951-PC&GS". RM ìNos.1, 2 and 3 are similar. It is the center of a 3 in. C.W. nail ìwith an arrow pointing towards the station named "RM 1", "RM 2" ìand "RM 3", respectively. RM No.1 is 6.07 m. from the station, ìwith azimuth 311° 31' 56.2". RM No.2 is 4.95 m. from the station, ìwith azimuth 348° 52' 56.2". RM No.3 is 17.12 m. from the ìstation, with azimuth 27° 51' 56.2".

PAN, 1990 Is in the island of Luzon, Province of Pangasinan, City of ìDagupan, Barangay Pantal. Marked can be reached by foot or by ìvehicle, from Quintos bridge along Nable Street, front of ìPantranco compound. It is set on a concrete walk on the south ìside of an old building wall, near the SW corner of the building. ìMark is a copper nail set on the concrete surrounded by cement ìputty with inscriptions PAN NAMRIA 1990.
PANELCO W. T., 1979 No description.

PANGA, 1979 Is in the island of Luzon on the S coast of Tombac Bay, Alaminos, ìPangasinan. It is on top of a hill which is bare on top and ìvegetated on it side with bamboos and fruit trees. The N most ìhill in Brgy. Pangapisan, it is S of the salt beds and W of fish ìponds. To reach the station from Alaminos, take the road to Brgy. ìMona passing Brgy. Magsaysay. At the end of the road on Coliat ìRiver, stop and cross the river by banca. The station can be ìreach by foot going N passing rice paddies and fish ponds distant ì1.1 km. from the river. Mark is a 1.27 dia. brass rod set on top ìof a 25 cm. x 25 cm. concrete monument with inscriptions on top, ì"PANGA, BCGS, 1979".

PANGIL, 1954-78 Is on the W coast of N Luzon, at the off shore of Ilocos Norte in ìBrgy. Pangil, municipality of Currimao. Station is on Bimanga Pt. ìon a rocky ledge, about 6 m. from the seaward edge. Station is ìthe center of a cross cut on top of a brass rod embedded in ìconcrete with the inscription "PANGIL, 1954". RM No.1 is the ìcenter of a porcelain plug embedded in concrete, about 25 m. ìsquare with the inscription RM-1 and an arrow mark pointing ìtowards station, distant 19.302 m. from the station, 152° 13' ì33.8" in azimuth. RM No.2 is similar RM-1, distant 19.396 m. from ìthe station, 256° 57' 15.3" in azimuth. RM No.3 is similar to ìRM-1, distant 29.181 m. from the station, 282° 33' 16.3" in ìazimuth.
PAOAY CHURCH BELL TOWER, 1903-54 The station is the center of the bell tower of the church of ìPaoay. It is a detached high structure, very close to the NW ìcorner of the church building.
PAOAY CHURCH TOWER, 1903-52 The station is at the center of a small turret on the front gable ìof the church at Paoay.

PARATONG BRIDGE PIER, 1903 The S side of the stone abutment at the W end of a long wooden ìbridge carrying the main road from Bangar to Luna over the ìBusilac estero, at Bo. Paratong, 2 km. SW of Bangar.

PASEAR, 1903-54 In the town of Currimao, on top of a bare hill called Lablabaga, ìabout 1 km. S of a group of houses on the hill side constituting ìBo. Cumcumloo-ong. This bare hill is the highest one in the ìvicinity. To reach the station, follow the gravel road leading to ìthe town of Pinili, to a point about halfway betwen Km. Posts ìNos. 455 and 456, just before a small wooden bridge in Bo. Badic. ìAt this point a cart road leads N. Follow the cart road N for ìabout 1 km. through a valley along the hills until the house of ìMr. Mauro Tabanda, beyond which a small plain begins. A little ìpast this house and to the left is a trail leading W along the ìslopes of the hill and NE to the station. Station is located on ìthe property of Mr. Anastacio Macabiog. Station is about 1.5 m. ìNE of the longitudinal axis of the top of the bare hill and is ìapprox. on the transverse axis. "BADOC 2 1954" and "CURRIMAO ìASTRONOMICAL STATION, 1961", are visible from the ground at the ìstation. A 14 ft. tower was constructed over the station to see ì"BATAC, 1903". Station mark is the hole in the center of the ìcross cut on a brass rod set in a concrete monument 10 in. square ìon top and protruding 5 cm. above the ground. Inscribed are a ìtriangle and the number "1954". Reference mark (RM) No.1 is a ìporcelain plug set in a concrete monument with the inscription ì"RM-1" and an arrow pointing towards the station, distant 7.405 ìm. from the station and 47° 13' in azimuth. RM No.2 is a similar ìmark with the inscription "RM 2" and an arrow pointing towards ìthe station, distant 4.727 m. from the station and 155° 10' 21" ìin azimuth.

PASUQUIN, 1903-13-52 On a mountain 405 m. high on the E side of the main road between ìBacarra and Pasuquin, at a point which forms a nearly ìequilateral triangle with sides of about 9 km. with these two ìtown. From the road the mountain appears grey and saddle-shaped, ìwith the station located on the N and higher peak. It may be ìreached by a road running to the E from Bacarra along the stream ìforming the built-up portion of that town. The top of the hill is ìrather flat and is covered with large rocks. The station is on ìthe highest point. Station mark is drill hole in a large rock.

PAULA, 1903-33 On a prominent hill 264 m. high, 2.3 km. from the beach, and 6 ìkm. N of Pasuquin. The hill has a few trees on the summit but is ìnearly bare, and is the first bare hill near the road N of ìPasuquin. The hill is the outer end of a narrow ridge jutting out ìfrom the higher, densely wooded ridge further inshore. It is ìreached by a trail leaving the main road a short distance S of ìthe station but the trail is hard to find without the aid of a ìnative guide. The top of the hill around the station is covered ìwith loose rocks. The station is on the highest point. Station ìmark is a 2 cm. hole in a large rock. Reference mark is a rough ìcross cut in another larger, and slightly higher, flat-topped ìrock. This cross is distant 2.99 m. from the station in azimuth ì233° 26'.

PAYONG, 1979 Is in the Province of Pangasinan, town of Mabini, in Brgy. Luna. ìIt is situated on a conical hill which is bare on top and is ìprominent in the vicinity. To reach the station from Alaminos, ìfollow the highway to Mabini town up to the Bituminous Concrete ìMixing Plant of the Ministry of Public Highways on Bo. Tagudin. ìJust after the plant turn right on a dirt road and proceed ahead ìfor about 2.8 km. to the foot of the hill, and to the station. ìMark is the center of steel bolt set on top of a 25 cm. x 25 cm. ìconcrete monument of the Bureau of Lands with inscriptions on top ì"PAYONG 1979, B. L.". No reference marks were establihed.

PCP-706-ZHA, 1978 Is in the province of Ilocos Norte, town of Currimao, Bo. Pias at ìthe Coral Beach Resort owned by Mayor Cirilio Quilala. It is ìsituated on top of the seawall at the corner which is 18.5 m. NW ìedge of the walkway of the cottage NW of the resort's "Pelota ìCourt". Mark is the center of the top of the 4" copper nail set ìflush on top of the seawall with inscriptions etched around thus: ì"BCGS PCP 706-ZH 1978".

PCP 767 YHV, 1978 Is in the province of Ilocos Norte, town of Currimao, Bo. Torre, ìalong the shoreline of Gaang Bay about 1.7 km. SE of the town ìproper of Currimao. Station is situated on the shoreline of the ìbay about 3 m. from the edge of the vegetation, 18 m. E of the ìcenterline of the trail which originates from the highway at the ìpoint about 280 m. SE of the Currimao Cemetery. Mark is the top ìof the head of a 4" copper nail embedded in a mass of concrete on ìtop of a rocky ledge.

PEAK, 1903-63 On the W coast of Luzon, in the province of La Union, on the ìhighest point of the range of hills which comes down to coast ìbetween San Juan and San Fernando. It is 118 m. high and is about ì3 km. from San Juan and about 0.5 km. from the beach. The top of ìthe hill is very sharp. The main road passes W of the foot of the ìhill and a trail branches off from Km. Post 273 to the top. ìStation mark is a copper nail cemented in the top surface of the ìsolid rock protruding 10 cm. above the ground, near the S edge ìwith inscription "PEAK, 1902-63". RM-1 is a copper nail set on a ìrock distant 9.02 m., in azimuth 176° 43' 46.9" of the station ìwith inscription "RM-1" and an arrow pointing towards the ìstation. RM-2 is a copper nail set on a rock distant 4.39 m., in ìazimuth 307° 32' 46.9" of the station with inscription. "RM 2" ìand an arrow pointing towards the station. RM-3 is a copper nail ìset on a rock distant 7.13 m., in azimuth 145° 12' 06.9" of the ìstation with inscription "RM 3" and an arrow pointing towards the ìstation.

PERDIDO, 1903-15-52 On the summit of a high bare hill 2.6 km. S of Mairaira Pt., 2 ìkm. W of Baugan Bay, and 1.4 km. SE of Caunayan Bay. This hill is ìthe only one in the vicinity with a bare top. The station is on ìthe highest one of three knobs on the summit. The ground has many ìscattered rocks embedded in its surface. Station mark is a drill ìhole in one of the smaller of these rocks on the highest part of ìthe knob. Four rocks cairn were built, one over the mark, and one ìto each of the three wire guys of the signal. Two witness were ìestablished, each consisting of a triangle blazed on a pine tree ìstanding on the hill slopes. One was distant 28.96 m., in azimuth ì20° 29', the other was 24.45 m., in azimuth 225° 50'.

PIAS, 1978 Is in the province of Ilocos Norte, town of Currimao, Bo. ìVictoria along the shoreline of Gaang Bay near the lot owned by ìAtty. Esteban Cabanos. It is situated on the E coast of the bay ì9 m. N of the extension of the centerline of the road which ìoriginates from the highway and about 200 m. N of the junction of ìhighway no.3 and the highway leading to Currimao. Station is ìabout 5.9 m. from the SW corner of the concrete fence of the ìabove lot, and 4 m. W of the W corner of the same lot. Mark is a ìthe top of the head of a 4" copper nail set flush on top of the ìstandard BCGS oncrete monument and etched on top of the monument ìis a triangle surrounding the mark and "BCGS PIAS 1978".

PICO, 1963-67 Is in the island of Luzon, province of La Union, town of San ìFernando, along the road to Baras, on a ridge locally known as ìBacsil Ridge, about 3 statute miles E of San Fernando, and on one ìof the highest peaks of the ridge. The peak is about 8 m. wide ìand about 30 m. long, running in a N to S direction, and is ìdevoid of trees. To reach the station from San Fernando, La ìUnion, take the highway leading E to the top of the ridge. It is ìabout 120 m. E of Km. Post No.277, and near a rest house and a ìconcrete marker indicating the last stand of the Japanese Forces ìin 1945, turn N on a good trail to a distance of about 700 m. ìStation is a brass rod embedded at the bottom of a 2 in. square ìhole on top of a concrete monument whose top formed into a square ì0.35 m. x 0.35 m., "C&GS, PICO, 1963" is inscribed on top of the ìmonument surrounding the mark. Subsurface mark is a bottle buried ìin an upright position about 90 cm. below the surface of the ìground. RM 1 is a brass nail embedded on a drilled hole on top of ìan irregularly shaped rock outcrop about 0.65 m. x 0.75 m. on ìtop, set 0.305 m. above the ground. "RM 1" and an arrow pointing ìto the station are inscribed on cement patty surrounding the ìmark. RM 2 is a brass nail embedded on a drilled hole on top of ìan irregularly shaped rock outcrop about 0.25 m. x 0.50 m. on top ìand 0.10 m. above the ground. "RM 2" and an arrow pointing to the ìstation are inscribed on cement putty surrounding the mark. RM 3 ìis a brass nail embedded on drilled hole on top of an irregularly ìshaped rock outcrop about 0.60 m. x 0.60 m. on top, 0.25 cm. ìabove the ground. "RM 3" and an arrow pointing to the station are ìinscribed on cement putty surrounding the mark.

PIE, 1958 Is on the W coast of Luzon, in Pangasinan province, in Cabarruyan ìIsland, about 0.4 mile NW of Toritori Pt. Station is on the ìoffshore side of a rice field about 5 m. from the edge of the ìcliff, and about 8 m. from the SW corner of a rice field dike. ìMark is the center of a crosscut of a 1/2 in. dia. brass rod ìembedded on top center of a 10 in. square concrete monument and ìwith a circle circumscribed in it and with inscription "PIE 1958 ìPC&GS".

PIEDRA. 1901 On the first point S of San Fernando Pt. Between these two points ìthere is a long stretch of sandy beach. The station is on the ìsecond rocky projection after the end of the beach. These ìprojections are flat, rough shelves of coral rock extending out ì10 m. to 35 m. from the high water line, awash at extreme high ìtide. Station mark is a copper bolt in the rock at the NE edge of ìthe projection where the rock joins the beach. At high water ìline, a little E of S, are three large boulders, the nearest one ìbeing 12.5 m. from the station. At high water line 8 m. E of the ìstation are two large boulders standing 1.5 m. above the sand.

PIER, 1901 Is on the rock pier in the SW part of Sual Harbor. The station is ìon a granite slab about 34 m. from the shore. This slab is 60 cm. ìwide, 1.04 m. long, and 15 cm. thick. Station mark is a copper ìbolt set in the rock. It is on the E corner of the slab, 7.6 cm. ìfrom the NE edge and 8.6 cm. from the SE edge.

PIER, 1978 Is in the town of Currimao, province of Ilocos Norte on the SE ìshore of Gaang Bay on a government pier which juts to seaward ìfrom Bo. Maglaoi. Station is about 6.75 m. from the SW offshore ìend, 0.7 m. from the NW edge of the concrete flloring and 6.39 m. ìNW of the centerline of the pier. Station mark is the top of the ìcenter of the 4" copper nail cemented in a drilled hole with ìtriangular cement putty around it and set flush with the concrete ìflooring of the pier. No reference mark were established.

PILA, 1903-05 On a prominent peak, the highest in a range of low hills, 2 km. ìNE of Santa Lucia. The hill was cleared, leaving a single large ìtree standing out conspicuosly. A road leading NE from Santa ìLucia on the E side of the river passes close to the foot of this ìhill. The station is on a small mound which rises from the center ìof the hill. Subsurface mark is a bottle buried 75 cm. below the ìground. Station mark is a rock with a drill hole in top.

PINILI, 1978 Is in the town of Pinil, province of Ilocos Norte on top of a ìbare and rocky hill overlooking Brgy. Sto. Tomas. To reach the ìstation, follow the National Highway No.300 from the junction at ìNational Highway No.3 going to the town of Pinili. Upon reaching ìthe town of Pinili town proper, proceed further E and stop about ì5.2 km. from Pinili Municipal Hall. Look for the house of a ìcertain Mr. Venacio Cadalzo which is situated on the left side of ìthe zigzag highway. From this point, follow the trail going N ìpassing a relatively flat land rice paddies. Proceed further NE ìpassing through the vegetation of trees and up to the station. ìStation mark is a the center of a drilled hole on a rock outcrop ìwhich is relatively levelled with the ground surface. The face of ìthe rock was cemented and inscribed "PINILI, 1978". RM No.1 is a ì3" C.W. nail set on concrete on a rock outcrop distant 7.68 m. ìfrom the station in azimuth 146° 26' 52.6" with an arrow pointing ìtowards the station. RM No.2 which is similarly marked, distant ì6.15 m. from the station in azimuth 239° 41' 54.8". RM No.3 which ìis similarly marked to RM No.1 is 10.31 m. from the station in ìazimuth 333° 14' 20".

PLDT TR., 1990 Is in the island of Luzon, Province of Pangasinan, City of ìDagupan City, Barangay of Pantal, along Nable st., within the ìcity proper. Mar is the center of a prominent radio tower of ìPLDT. The tower colored alternately red and white, holds an ìantenae that has horizontal angular fins and webs. The vertical ìbar that holds the webs marks the station.

PNG-2 Is approx. 900 m. W of Bolinao Port; about 1.3 km. W from the intersection of national road and A. Celina St. Station is located at the middle W end of concrete fishpond dike in the School of Fisheries compound. Station mark is 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. brass rod set on top of the middle W end of concrete fishpond dike with cement patty. Inscribed on top PNG-2 1989 NAMRIA. RMs 1, 2, 3 & 4 are 0.15 m. x 0.01 m. dia. brass rods with cement patties and arrows pointing to the station, set on top of concrete fishpond dike. RM 3 set on the NW corner of building with cement patty with arrow pointing to PNG-2 station.
ITRF Coordinates:
Latitude: 16° 23' 35.79904"N Longitude: 119° 52' 54.06683"E Ellipsoidal Height: 40.491 m

PNG-23 Is located inside the Sual Fishing Port complex. To reach the ìport, proceed directly to Sual Town Proper and upon reaching the ìcorner of gymnasium, turn right to reach the port gate which is ìinfront of the church. The station is about 300 m. from the gate ìleading to the pier. It is on the W end and S side of the pier ìand located about 2 m. S of the first lamp post of the pier. ìMark is a 4 in. copper nail set on a curb of pier landing with ìcement putty and with inscription "SUAL 1993 NAMRIA".
WGS84 COORDINATES : N 16 4 2.06658 E 120 5 53.38599
ELLIPSOIDAL HT. : 47.11720 m.

PNG-24 From Sual Municipal Town Hall, drive for about 8 km. or 5 min. ìalong the national highway going to Alaminos to reach Brgy. ìCaoayan then turn right, a 4-wheel drive can travel along the ìdirt road for about 14 km. or 20 min. to reach the Sual Power ìPlant then proceed to Bangayao Pt. The station is located on top ìof the hill and on its E edge. It is about 8 min. hike from the ìbase of the hill. On its SW side is the Cabalatian Island and on ìthe NE side the Bangar Pt. Mark is a 3 in. copper nail centered ìon a 0.3 m. x 0.3 m. x 0.07 m. concrete block protruding 0.1 m. ìfrom the groud surface with inscription "PNG-24 1995 NAMRIA".
WGS84 COORDINATES : N 16 7 21.73508 E 120 6 6.57863
ELLIPSOIDAL HT. : 92.1389 m.

PNG-25 From Sual Municipal Town Hall, drive for about 8 km. or 5 min. ìalong the national highway going to Alaminos to reach Bgy. ìCaoayan then turn right, a 4-wheel drive can travel along the ìdirt road for about 14 km. or 20 min. to reach the gate of Sual ìPower Plant. Then travel along the dirt road for about 2 min. to ìreach the communication building which is on top of the hill. On ìits E side is the Cabalatian Island and on its NE side is the ìBangar Pt. The station is located about 10 m. SE of ìCommunication Bldg. Mark is a 3 in. copper nail centered on a ì0.3 m. x 0.3 m. x 0.7 m. concrete block protruding 0.1 m. from ìthe ground surface with inscription "PNG-25 1995 NAMRIA".
WGS84 COORDINATES : N 16 7 38.59485 E 120 5 48.98209
ELLIPSOIDAL HT. : 91.2829 m.

PNG-26 To reach the station, travel NW from the municipal hall along the ìnational road leading to Brgy. Tondol. Then by motorized ìboat/banca head NW to Tondoyong Island. Station is located ìapprox. 10 m. from the S tip of the island and about 400 m. SSE ìof a ruin concrete house and about 15 m. S from the group of ìaroma trees.
WGS84 COORDINATES: N 16 18 58.42714 E 120 01 26.43412
ELLIPSOIDAL HT. : 43.80099 m.

PNG-27 To reach the station, travel N along the national road until you ìreach Brgy. Tondol, travel time is approx. 50 min. Then by ìmotorized banca head NW to Tondoyong Island. Station is located ìapprox. 100 m. SW from a lone ruin concrete house and about 350 ìm. NNE of the S tip of the island and is approx. 5 m. N of the ìS coconut tree. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail embedded ìand centered on a 0.25 m. x 0.25 m. x 0.7 m. concrete monument ìand protruding 0.1 m. above the grade line with inscription ì"PNG-27 1996, NAMRIA".
WGS84 COORDINATES: N 16 19 07.93302 E 120 01 29.60398
ELLIPSOIDAL HT. : 44.35931 m.

PNG-28 From the municipal hall of Anda, travel N along the national road ìleading to Brgy. Tondol. Then by a motorized banca head NNW to ìCory Island. Cory Island, a newly form islet is formed or ìcomposed by wash ashore dead coral reefs about 350 sq. m. Station ìis about 30 m. N from the S tip of the said islet and is on the ìhighest point of the island. Mark is the head of a 4" copper nail ìembedded and centered on a 0.25 m. x 0.25 m. x 1.0 m. concrete ìmonument and protruding about 0.2 m. above the ground with ìinscription "PNG-28, 1996, NAMRIA.
WGS84 COORDINATES: N 16 19 35.74532 E 120 01 51.03683
ELLIPSOIDAL HT. : 44.67723 m.

PNG-29 From Anda municipal hall, travel N along the national road until ìyou reach Tondol white sand beach. Station is located 3 m. W from ìthe W side of the jetty, 35 m. SSW from the NW corner of the ìjetty and 10 m. NW of the SW corner of jetty. Station is approx. ì25 m. from Tondol white sand beach cottages and 5 m. N of a lone ìtree. Mark is the head of a 4 in. copper nail embedded and ìcentered on a 0.25 m. x 0.25 m. x 0.7 m. concrete monument and ìprotruding about 0.1 m. above the ground surface with inscription ì"PNG-29 1996, NAMRIA".
WGS84 COORDINATES: N 16 18 50.52345 E 120 00 50.84946
ELLIPSOIDAL HT. : 43.61596 m.

PNG-3 Is on an open ground on the highest top of the hill, about 1.650 ìkm. S of town proper of Sual; 150 m. NE of the national highway ìand trail intersection. 4 m. NW of a deep hole, 70 cm. dia. on ìtop. Follow the straight side of the road after that face west. Station is mark by the head of 4” copper nail on 0.40 m x 0.40 m concrete monument with inscription “PNG-3196, PRS-92, 2008, DENR-LMS R-1”.

From Mangatarem town proper travel northward until you reach the barangay Ninoy west. Ninoy west is also known as river side, where the mark is located. The mark is located at Bargas Dam. From Cabugay bridge travel westward on a rocky road about 15 minutes until you reach Sitio Bargas. Facing South, start from left side of the concrete part of the dam measure about 60 meters, just follow the concrete retaining wall of the dam. Station is mark by the head of 4” copper nail on 0.40 m x 0.40 m concrete monument with inscription “PNG-3197, PRS-92, 2008, DENR-LMS R-1”.

From Mangatarem town proper travel northward until you reach the barangay Calsib. The mark is loacted at barangay Calsib (purok 2), in front of Vic Stabillo's House, facing north it is located on the right side concrete fence of their house, near the basketball court of barangay Calsib purok 2. Station is mark by the head of 4” copper nail on 0.40 m x 0.40 m concrete monument with inscription “PNG-3199, PRS-92, 2008, DENR-LMS R-1”.

PNG-32 Is located on top of a water tank within the Municipal Park about ì20 m. S of the Municipal Bldg. and 15 m. SW of the Municipal ìLibrary. Station mark is the head of a 2" copper nail embedded ìon a 6 x 6" cement putty with inscriptions "PNG-32, 1996, ìNAMRIA".

ELLIPSOIDAL HT. : 71.88200 m.

Station is mark by the head of 4” copper nail on 0.40 m x 0.40 m concrete monument with inscription “PNG-3200, PRS-92, 2008, DENR-LMS R-1”.

PNG-3384 From the municipal town plaza of Anda drive NE along the municipal road going to Brgy. Cabungan approximately 6-8 km. The station is located at the upper right shoulder of the box culvert. It is also 200 m NE of Cabungan Water tank. Station mark is the hed of a 4" copper nail on a 0.40 m x 0.40 m concrete monument with inscription PNG-3384, PRS-92, 2008, DENR-LMS R-1.

POINT, 1948-63-67 In San Fernando Harbor, on the W shore, on the most N point about ì420 m. E of San Fernando Pt. Station is on a prominent rocky ìpoint about 7 m. from the tip and about 3 ft. S of a natural ìdepression with a perfectly flat bottom. A large shell hole 17 m. ìSE of the station should help to identify the point. When viewed ìfrom the station, the mast of the wreck "LINE 1948" lying NW of ìPier 2 and "CHAS, 1948" are very nearly on range. Station is the ìcenter of a 50 cal. cartridge set in a cement putty in a ìdepression in the rock. No RMs were recovered.

W of centerline of the road leading to ìthe pier, and 3 m. seaward from the line of telephone poles ìparalleling the beach. Station is the center of a 0.50 cal. ìcartridge cemented in the center of a 6 in. cylinder of concrete, ì1.25 m. long and protruding about 0.08 m. above the ground.

PORO, 1951 Is located 150 m. E of the sandy cove on the S shore of Santiago ìIsland. Station mark is a triangle of nails in a concrete paddy ìset in a rock projecting approx. 1 m. above the water. RM No.1 is ìa concrete paddy on a large rock, 8.89 m., azimuth 110°. RM No.2 ìis a concrete paddy on a rock, 5.03 m., azimuth 340°. RM No.3 is ìa concrete paddy on a large rock, 9.04 m., azimuth 280°. Azimuths ìare from the station to the reference marks.

PUG, 1990 Is in the island of Luzon, Province of Pangasinan, City of ìDagupan, Barangay of Pugaro. Station mark can be reach by boat ìfrom Sabangan Bonuan Gueset Elementary School of from the city ìpropervia patal river, then by foot toward the eastern end of ìPugaro Peninsula. Mark is a 20.67 meter W of the high water line. Mark ìis a concrete nail set flushed on the concrete monument with ìinscription PUG 1990, NAMRIA.

QUIMZON, 1979 Is in the province of Pangasinan, town of Alaminos, Brgy. Quibar. ìIt is situated on top of a rocky hill overlooking Brgy. Quibar ìand Brgy. Alos. The hill is known locally as Quimzon hill which ìis about 2.5 km. SE of Alos Church. To reach the station, take ìthe highway from Alaminos leading to Mabini town. From Brgy. Alos ìCatholic Church proceed further S for about 600 m. and turn left ìto a gravel road leading to Brgy. Quibar crossing a concrete ìbridge spanning the Quitanquil River, about 1.8 km. from this ìbridge, stopped and follow the trail on the W side of the road ìpassing rice paddies. Cross the river and the trail leads to the ìtop of the highest hill in the vicinity and to the station. Mark ìis a 1/2 in. dia. brass rod cemented and set on top of coral ìrocks with inscriptions "QUIMZON, BCGS, 1979". Reference marks ìare marked by a 3 in. C.W. nail set on top of a cement putty on a ìrock outcrop with inscriptions "RM-1", "RM-2" and "RM-3" and ìarrows pointing toward the station.

RABON, 1903 On the E side of Lingayen Gulf about 1.5 km. S of Bo. Rabon and ìclose to the boundary between La Union and Pangasinan. It is on a ìlittle hill, about 30 m. high, just back of the wagon road which ìpasses along the foot of its W slope close to the beach. The top ìof the hill E of the station is cultivated with a patch of sugar ìcane. Near the S corner of this field is a tree marked with a ìtriangle, distant 90 m. ESE of the station. A line from the ìstation to the smokestack of an old sugar mill near the beach ìacross Santo Tomas Harbor and falls outside a tobacco warehouse ìby an angular interval equal to 2/3 that of between the warehouse ìand the Santo Tomas Convent. The sugar mill is near the prominent ìmonument marking the provincial boundary. Subsurface mark is the ìcenter of the rock of a bottle buried 0.9 m. below the surface.

RAG, 1951-73 Is located on a coral beach, 130 m. S of the sandy beached cove ìon the SE shore of Santiago Island. Station mark is a triangle of ìnails set in concrete putty. RM No.3 is a concrete putty, 10.5 m., azimuth 200°. ìAzimuths are taken from the station to the reference marks.

REAR, 1948-63 Is at San Fernando Harbor near the SE shore, atop the first hill ìSW of the town of San Fernando, about 100 m. W of the main ìhighway leading S from town, and about 500 m. SSW of the church ìof San Fernando. A 15 ft. triangular structure, the rear range ìmarker for the entrance range, stands over the station. REEF, 1977 Not recoverable.

RELAY, 1978 Is in the province of Ilocos Norte, town of Currimao, Brgy. Sta. ìCruz about 2.5 km. E of Currimao town of proper. To reach the station, follow the gravel ìroad from Currimao Town proper going E to Brgy. Sta. Cruz and up ìto the station. The Relay Station Compd. is situated along this ìgravel road. Mark is the top center of a 30 m. triangle guy wire ìtower of the Relay Station.

REN, 1958 Is on the W coast of Luzon, in the province of Pangasinan on ìCabarruyan Island, on the second point N of the ferry landing on ìthe Cabarruyan Island side, about 3 m. from the high water line. ìMark is the center of a crosscut on top of a 1/2 in. dia. brass ìrod embedded on top center of a concrete monument about 25 cm. in ìdia. and with inscriptions "REN 1958".

RENA, 1904-06 Is situated on the N side of the entrance to Agno Harbor, on the ìouter extremity of Rena Pt. The point is steep and rocky. As seen ìfrom the S, there is a sharp gap close behind the end of the ìpoint. Station is on the highest rock outside of this gap and is ìat an elevation of 21 m. Station mark is a drill hole in a ìvolcanic rock.

RIDGE, 1902 In the municipality of Santo Tomas near Bo. Cupan. It is on the ìsummit of the second small hill N of the S end of the ridge which ìis the S continuation of Mt. Agoo, with elevation of 55 m. It is ìabout 250 m. E from the rice fields and is reached by a trail ìleading up from two shacks in a cluster of large mango trees. The ìtop of the hill is nearly flat and is covered with grass and ìbush. In a hollow about 300 m. SE of the station are five shacks ìand some palms. There are two large shade trees about equidistant ìfrom the station, one at the S end of the ridge, and the other ì275 m. to the N and on range with Mt. Agoo. Subsurface mark is a ìbottle buried at a depth of 25 cm. Witness marks are three ìsimilar bottles placed horizontally at a depth of 20 cm., ìsymmetrically and closely arranged around the station with their ìnecks pointing thereto.

RIP, 1951-73 Is located on the coral beach on the N shore of Riripayan Pt. ìStation mark is a concrete form set 1 ft. in the beach and ìcontains a triangle constructed with 3 nails on the top of a ìconcrete. ROSARIO, 1963-67 Is in the island of Luzon, province of La Union, town of Rosario, ìBo. Ambangunan, about 4 km. NW of Rosario, on the highest peak ìwhich is at the N end of the ridge running in a N and S ìdirection. Station is at the center of the peak and is about 200 ìm. SE of a cluster of tamarind and santol trees. To reach the ìstation from San Fernando, La Union, proceed S along Highway No.3 ìup to the town of Rosario. At Rosario, turn N to a gravel road to ìBo. "RM 1" and an arrow ìpointing to the station are inscribed on cement putty surrounding ìthe mark. RM-2 is a copper nail cemented on top of a rock outcrop ìabout 1.5 ft. dia. and 2 ft. high. "RM 2" and an arrow pointing ìto station are inscribed on cement putty surrounding the mark. ìRM-3 is a coper nail embedded on top of a rock outcrop about 1 ìft. dia. and 1/2 ft. high. "RM 3" and an arrow pointing to ìstation are inscribed on cement putty surrounding the mark.
ROSARIO CHURCH TOWER, 1967 The top center of the church tower at Rosario.

ROSE, 1972 On the W coast of Luzon, province of Ilocos Sur, Fort Tagudin, ìinside the FILMAG Compd., about 3 m. from NE corner of the third ìhouse of the E row of the employee's residential buildings. ROUGH, 1901 Is in Balingasag Pt., 1 km. WNW of the town of Bolinao. The point ìis of rough coral rock and is covered with a heavy growth of ìshrubbery. The station is on the N extremity of the point. A line to ìstation "Isle" passes close to the E edge of this station. ìStation mark is a copper bolt in the center of an irregular ìdepression 2.26 m. from the N most projection of the point, 1.68 ìm. from the W edge and 1.8 m. from the E edge.

RUIN, 1903-15-52 On the E end of the small range of hills lying halfway between ìVigan and Pandan and 500 m. W of the road between those two ìplaces.
