SAGAT, 1903-72 In N Luzon, province of Ilocos Sur, municipality of Santa Cruz, ìBo. Sagat, on the summit of a 100 m. hill about 4.2 km. N of Bo. ìSevilla, the same distance S of Santa Cruz and 1.4 km. E of the ìbeach. A trail which passes through a tobacco plantation leads to ìwithin 3 m. S of the station. Station mark is a drilled hole at ìthe center of an irregular rock about 5 cm. above ground surface. ìSubsurface mark is a drilled hole on a stone 30 cm. x 35 cm. x 18 ìcm. buried 75 cm. below the surface.
SALASA CHURCH BELL TOWER, 1905 Is the center of the bell tower of the Church in the town of ìSalasa.
SALASA CHURCH CROSS, 1967 Is the center of the cross at the front gable of the church in ìthe town of Salasa.

SALOMAGUE TOWER, 1903-52 The center of a circular brick tower on the beach on the N side ìof Fort Salomague. It stands just W on the town and is about 30 ìm. from high water line. It was formerly used as a fort.
SAN CARLOS CHURCH SOUTH GABLE, 1905 Is the cross on the S gable of the church in the town of San ìCarlos.

SAN ESTEBAN POINT, 1903-52 On the W and highest part of a 93 m. hill on the broad point on ìthe S side of San Esteban Harbor. It is 1.3 km. NW of San ìEsteban, 350 m. from the beach toward the N and 700 m. from the ìpoint toward the W. Station mark is a drill hole in the top of a ìrock set in the ground with about 18 cm. projecting. There are ìtwo trees about 25 m. E of the station. Across was blazed on the ìnearer one on the side facing the station.

SAN FABIAN CHURCH BELFRY 2, 1967 Is the center of the belfry of the church in the town of San ìFabian. This belfry is at the S corner of the church buildings, ìincluding the convent. The ridge of the church proper runs NW and ìSE. The tower is on the front of the SE face of the church, and ìis at the SW side of this face.
SAM FABIAM CHURCH DOME, 1967 Is the top of the prominent dome of the Faith Healer's Church at ìSan Fabian.

SAN FERNANDO NORTH BASE, 1903 On the beach 1 km. NW of the seaward end of the E and W street ìpassing through San Fernando on the N side of the plaza. It is ìalso 220 m. SW of the outlet of a lagoon and just at the foot of ìthe sand hills, at a distance of 45 m. back of high water mark. ìIt is in the prolongation of the line through the smoked stack of ìa wreck on the beach and station peak. Station mark is a drill ìhole in top of a rock set with 8 cm. projecting above the ground. ìSubsurface is the center of a bottle buried at high depth of 0.9 ìm.
SAN JACINTO STANDPIPE, 1967 Is the top center of the prominent standpipe at San Jacinto.

SAN JUAN BELL TOWER, 1903 The center of the top of the bell tower of the church in the town ìof San Juan. This bell tower is about 3 m. lower than the church ìtower. These two towers are so close together that a direction ìmeasurement of the distance between them may show a small ìdiscrepancy. In this case the position of the church tower is ìentitled to preference as its adjustment corrections were ìsomewhat smaller.
SAN JUAN BRICK TOWER, 1903 A large circular tower on the beach infront of the town of San ìJuan. This tower was formerly used as a fort.

SAN MIGUEL 2, 1952 To reach the station from San Nicolas Church Bell Tower, proceed ìE following the road to Dingras as a far as Km. Post No.490; then ìproceed SW along a cart trail to Bo. Dies and continue up a foot ìtrail for about 650 m. SW up to ridge where two symmetrical cones ìof about the same height are located. the station is on top of ìthe most W of the two cones. Station is a spike set in a 12 in. ìsquare concrete monument projecting 1 m. above the ground ìsurface. Station is marked "MBM No. 1" on the surface of the ìmonument and San Nicolas and Sarrat, Municipal Boundary mark on ìits side.
SAN MIGUEL CBT, 1903-52 The center of the top of the bell tower of the church in the town ìof San Miguel.
SAN NICOLAS CBT, 1903-52 The center of the top of the bell tower of the church in the town ìof San Nicolas. This tower stands close to the NW corner of the ìchurch.

SAND, 1901 Is on Siapar Pt., the most S point of Santiago Island. The ìstation is on the extreme S end of the point which is that part ìof Santiago Island nearest to Narra Island. The point is low and ìsandy, the sand running well back of high watermark. Shoals ìsurround the point and fish traps extend between it and Narra ìIsland. Mud flats run along the shore in a pocket 25 m. N of the ìpoint. Subsurface mark is a bottle in a bamboo tube 60 cm. long, ìburied 30 cm. in the sand. Witness marks are two triangles cut on ìtrees, distant 18.78 m., in azimuth 132° 26'; and 17.1 m., in ìazimuth 237° 25', respectively.
SANTA MARIA, 1903-52 The center of the dome of the bell tower of Santa Maria Church. ìThe exact point determined was a 5 cm. iron rod which projects 2 ìm. from the center of the top of the dome.

SANTO CRISTO, 1902 It is about 2.5 km. SSE of the town of Aringay and 250 m. SE of ìBo. Santo Cristo, on a hill 85 m. high. The main road runs along ìthe W base of the hill. The top is covered with grass while the ìsides are covered with brush and undergrowth. A high, wooded peak ìstands about 1 km. to the N, and 275 m. in the same direction is ìa cluster of shacks and banana trees in a hollow near the small ìstream which crosses the main road at the S end of the barrio. ìBetween the road and the coast are rice fields and coconut trees. ìA large tree stands 7.3 m. W of the station, has a triangle cut ìon its trunk facing the station, 1.4 m. above the ground. A ìsimilar tree is a 9.1 m. SE and has a triangle 1.8 m. above the ìground facing the station. Subsurface mark is the center of a ìbottle at depth of a 35 cm. Witness marks are three similar ìbottles buried horizontally with their necks pointing toward the ìstation, closely and symmetrically arranged the latter. Searched ìfor by Bureau of Lands in June 1916, but not found.

SEARCHED, 1977 Is on the W coast of Luzon, Bolinao Harbor, province of ìPangasinan, municipality of Bolinao, on the S shore of Santiago ìIsland, N by NW of Riripayan Pt. and about 200 m. E of a small ìcove. The station is on a point of elevated at about 3 m. above ìthe surface and on a foot of a steep hill heavily covered with ìshrubs. The point has been undercut by the sea and the beach is ìpartly rocky. The station is the center of the crosscut on top of ìa 1/2 in. dia. brass rod embedded and set flushed on a cement ìputty 1 in. above the surface of the ground and 1 m. from the ìedge of the point. The station is marked "SEARCH 2, 1977 BCGS". ìRM Nos.1, 2 and 3 are similar and is the center of a 3 in. c.w. ìnail embedded on a cement putty with arrows pointing toward the ìstation. They are marked "RM 1", "RM 2" and "RM 3", respectively.ìRM No.1 is 3.479 m. from the station, with azimuth 233° 25.58'. ìRM No.2 is 5.537 m. from the station, with azimuth 173° 30.91'. ìRM No.3 is 4.572 m. from the station, with azimuth 120° 13.06'.

SIAPAR, 1951 Is located on the beach at the N tip of Siapar Island. Station ìmark is a triangle of nails in a concrete paddy set in a coral ìrock which is awash at high tide. RM No.1 is an "X" in a concrete ìpaddy on a coral rocks, 4.09 m., azimuth 360°. RM No.2 is a ìsquare in a concrete paddy on a coral rock, 4.63 m., azimuth 70°. ìRM No.3 is an arrow in a concrete paddy on a coral rock, 6.71 m., ìazimuth 140°. Azimuths are taken from the station to reference ìmarks the peak on SW edge. Station is located on the high point ìof the peak, 18 in. below the crest on the E side. Station mark ìis a bronze disc marked "ALOS", set in concrete, 10 in. below the ìground surface.

SIN, 1958 Is on the W coast of Luzon, in the province of Pangasinan, on the ìpoint on the mainland about 300 m. NW of the second point N of ìthe ferry landing on the Cabarruyan Island side, about 12 m. of ìthe high water line. Mark is the center of a drilled hole on a ìcoral rock, with cement putty around and inscriptions "SIN 1958".
SINAIT CHURCH NORTH TOWER The center of the N one of two similar towers on the front ìcorners of the church at Sinait. These towers are square with ìpyramidal tops.
SINAIT CHURCH SOUTH TOWER, 1903 The center of the S one of two towers on the church at Sinait.

SOL, 1904 Is on Mt. Mantoiltoil about 6 km. E of the town of Dasol which is ìthe nearest place where guides can be procured. There are 3 small ìknolls covered with trees at the base of the mountain E of the ìsignal. At the W base is a knoll covered with trees and N of it ìis a slightly higher knoll covered with grass. The mountain ìitself is bare except on the S slope where it is covered with ìtrees. The station is on the highest point. Subsurface mark is a ìbottle buried vertically at a depth of 45 cm., and witnessed by ìthree bottles placed horizontally around the center of a depth of ì15 cm. with their necks pointing towards the station. The station ìwas surrounded by a circular ditch 1.2 m. in radius and 15 cm. ìdeep. Witness marks are triangles cut on tree stumps, distant ì4.96 m. NE, and 8.71 m. SE.

SOUTH, 1982 Is in the island of Luzon, province of La Union, town of Agoo, ìBrgy. Sta. Rita on the sandy shore about 1.2 km. S of the ìPresidential Resthouse and 45 m. from the high water line. ìStation mark is the head of a 10.2 cm. C.W. nail set flush on top ìof a standard concrete monument which protrudes about 30.5 cm. ìabove the ground. Inscribed on the surface of the monument is a ìtriangle surrounding the mark and "SOUTH 1982". No reference mark ìwas established.

SPIT, 1902 On the W side of Santo Tomas Harbor near the outer end of the ìlong sand spit. Station is near the middle of the point on a ìsmall sand dune rising about 0.6 m. above the surrounding sand. ìIn 1901, it was 160 m. from the S point of the spit, 145 m. from ìthe E edge, and 115 m. from the W edge. Subsurface mark is a ìbottle buried 0.3 m. below the top of the dune.

SPRING, 1901-77 Is on the mainland shore opposite of Binabalian Pt. on Santiago ìIsland. It is 1.4 km. SE of the landing place at Bolinao and in ìthe S portion of the curve SW of the lighthouse. The only coconut ìgrove in this vicinity is just to the W of the station on a flat ìpiece of ground surrounded by wooded banks. In the center of the ìgrove is a large spring from which a small stream flows to the ìsea 10 m. W of the station, the bank. Station mark is a copper ìbolt set in the rock 1.34 m. from the E end. A triangle was cut ìon the trunk of a tree 8.81 m. back of the station.

STA. 225, 1952 Is located on the N side of the dirt road about 50 m. W of ìConcepcion and 106 m. W of "Permanent Sta. 226" which is located ìon a dirt road leading out of Concepcion toward Ongabi. It is a ìbronze disc embedded in a cement post in Concepcion, Ilocos Sur.

STA. 285, 1950 Is located in Bo. Butac, 11 km. from Suyo and 35 km. from ìCervantes, at the center line of Highway No.4, about 6 m. N of ìthe bridge on Butac River. Station is a standard bronze disk ìembedded in cylindrical concrete buried in the ground with top ìflush to surface.

STA. 585, 1952 Is a bronze disc embedded in a cement post located on the S end ìof a rice field on the E side of Abra River. Station is approx. 3 ìft. NW of a camachili tree. Station is buried 6 in. below the ìground surface in Angaki.

STA. 75 A, 1952 Is located E of the main road in line with the center of an ìintersecting road leading W in Bauguen. Station mark is a "US ìArmy Corps of Engr." bronze disc embedded in a cement post and is ì6 in. below ground surface.
SANTA CRUZ CHURCH TOWER, 1903 The center of the tower of Santa Cruz Church.
SANTA LUCIA CHURCH DOME, 1903 The center of the top of the large dome over the center of Santa ìLucia Church.
STO. DOMINGO CHURCH TOWER, 1952 Is located in the center of a small turret on the middle of the ìfront of Sto. Domingo Church.
STO. TOMAS CHURCH SPIRE, 1967 The apex of the church spire at Santo Tomas.

STOKER, 1902 On the beach 5.6 km. N of the extremity of the sand spit forming ìthe W side of Santo Tomas Harbor. It is near Bo. Baybay and on a ìsand dune 38 m. from high watermark. There are many sand dunes NE ìand S of the station but the one in question is the one nearest ìthe sea. 38 m. SE of the station are seven shacks, the most S one ìof which is in range between the station and the convent at Santo ìTomas. 34 m. NE of the station are three shacks, the NW corner of ìthe fence surrounding them is in range between the station and ìthe church at Agoo. E of the station the ground is level and ìcultivated mostly with rice and tobacco. Subsurface mark is a ìbottle buried 40 cm. below the surface.

SUAL ASTRONOMICAL STATION, 1901 Is on the beach about 500 m. SE of the church, 30 m. N of a stone ìbuilding used as an army hospital in 1901 and 8 m. back of the ìhigh water line. Station mark is a drill hole in a granite pier, ì50 cm. x 64 cm. in horizontal section, and standing 73 cm. above ìthe ground. The pier is built with mortar made of sand and native ìline, the capstone bearing the letters "U.S.". Subsurface mark is ìa drill hole in the granite slab forming the base of the pier. ìThis slab is 50 cm. x 64 cm., and its upper surface is placed 15 ìcm. below the ground. The NW corner of the hospital is distant ì32.49 m., in azimuth 359°.

SUAL AZIMUTH MARK, 1901 Is on the N shore of Sual Harbor near the E side of the bight to ìthe W of station "Beta". It is about 1.5 m. above high watermark ìand about 3.05 m. back of same. Station mark is a drill hole in a ìstone set in the ground with its upper surface flush. The letters ì"U.S." were cut in the upper surface of the stone. A mahogany ìtree with a triangular blaze on the side facing the station, ìbears S 32° E, distant 7.04 m. A small stump with a triangle ìblazed on the side facing the station bears S 10° W, distant 2.36 ìm.
SUNGO, 1903 It is about 1.5 km. SE of Cape Bojeador Lighthouse. It is on top ìof the highest of a group of rocks. Station mark is a drill hole ìover which a cairn of rocks was built.

SURBOC, 1903 On the range of hills 1.7 km. S of station "Tablac" and 2.5 km. ìNE of Candon. It is on a prominent spur jutting out from the ìrange but is not on the highest part, which is heavily wooded and ìwhich is a kilometer further E. A road leading from Candon and ìleaving the town just N of the church passes about 10 m. W of the ìstation and about 5 m. below it. Subsurface mark is a bottle ìburied 0.9 m. below the surface. Station mark is a drill hole in ìthe top of an irregularly shaped rock set into the ground with ìits top flush with the surface.

SUSO, 1903-52 On the N end of a low ridge which comes down to the coast at the ìfirst point 2.5 km. N of San Esteban. The road from the latter ìtown to Santa Maria passes around the W foot of the hill. The top ìof the hill is about 300 m. from the beach. It is covered with a ìdense growth of underbrush and small trees. The station is on the ìhighest part. Station mark is a drill hole in the rock.

SWIM, 1901 Is on the mainland on a large rock 200 m. S of the point ìadjoining the landing place for the town of Bolinao. Between this ìpoint and the station there is a short stretch of sandy beach at ìthe S end of which are three large coral boulders standing from ì1.5 m. to 3 m. out of the water. These boulders are 10 m. N of ìthe rock upon which the station is located. The latter is a ìlarge, soft, coral rock close in the bank, top of which slopes ìtoward the sea, its lowest edge being 60 cm. above high tide. The ìstation is 1.77 m. from the E edge, 3.41 m. from the W edge, 1.31 ìm. from the N edge and 1.62 m. from the S edge of the rock. A ìdescription of the station mark is not available.

TABLAC, 1903 In the barrio of the same name, on the highest part of a ìprominent peak, about 140 m. high, 3.5 km. NE of the town of ìCandon. There is a somewhat higher peak a short distance to the E ìand a range of hills to the S. The sides of the hills are covered ìwith small bushes. A road which branches off the main road a ìkilometer N of Candon runs to the foot of the hill and a trail ìfrom the native houses on the NW side leads directly to the ìstation. The top of the hill was cleared with bush and trees. ìStation mark is a drill hole in an irregularly shaped rock level ìwith the surface of the ground. Subsurface mark is a bottle ìburied at a depth of 0.9 m.
TAGUDIN CHURCH BELL TOWER, 1903-72 The center of the bell tower of the church at Tagudin, Ilocos ìSur.

TAGUDIN CHURCH BELL TOWER NORTH BASE, 1952 Is the intersection of the centerlines of San Anacleto St.-San ìAmbosio St. in Tagudin. It is approx. 7 m. SE of the municipal ìbuilding. Station mark is 7 in. nail driven into the asphalt ìsurface of the road.

TAGUDIN CHURCH BELL TOWER SOUTH BASE, 1952 Is in Tagudin located at the center of the intesection of San ìAnacleto St. and the road leading E to Bo. Lakong. It is 26 ft. E ìof the fence along the W side of San Anacleto St. Station mark is ìa nail driven with a bottle cap to the road surface.

TAKIG, 1954 Is on the W coast of Luzon, in the province of Ilocos Norte, ìmunicipality of Currimao, Brgy. Maglaoi on the S part of Gaang ìBay about 0.3 km. SW of the Maglaoi Community School. It is on ìthe top of the NW part of the ridge extending to the point at ìthe SW part of the bay and overlooking Bo. Maglaoi. Station mark ìis the center of a cross out on top of a brass rod set in ìconcrete on top of a limestone rock about 2 m. in dia. and ìinscribed "TAKIG 1954". Reference mark (RM) No.1 is a porcelain ìrod set in concrete on top of a limestone rock about 1 m. in dia. ìIt is 10 m. in azimuth 180° 52' and inscribed with "RM 1" and an ìarrow pointing towards the station. RM No.2 is a C.W. nail set in ìa concrete on top of rock outcrop. It is 9.5 m. from the ìstation, in azimuth 270° 51' inscribed with "RM 2" and an arrow ìpointing towards the station. RM No.3 is similar to RM 2 distant ì7.1 m. in azimuth 331° 22' and inscribed "RM 3" and an arrow ìpointing towards the station.

TALUN, 1915 On the smooth, bare hills SW of the town of Nagpartian. It is on ìthe first one of three prominent bare hills which sees to the E. ìThis hill is near the NW edge of the high ground, so that the ìbeach and the low ground from the hills near Cape Bojeador ìLighthouse to Nagpartian can be seen from it. Nagpartian Church ìbears N 42° 28' E. A trail leads from Nagpartian almost directly ìto the station. NW of the station is a deep valley with a small ìstream. The station is about 5 paces from the almost vertical ìside of this valley. Station mark is a drill hole in a rock ìburied flush with the surface.

TAM, 1951-73 Is located on a large coral rock at Tambac Pt. Station is a nail ìset in a rock which is 3 m. above sea level. RM No.1 is a ìconcrete paddy on a boulder, 3.67 m., N 50° E. RM No.2 is a ìcocrete paddy on a boulder, 3.105 m., S 40° W. RM No.3 is a ìconcrete paddy on a boulder, 2.99 m., N 80° W. Bearing and ìdistances to reference marks are taken from the station.

TAN, 1990 Is in the island of Luzon, Province of Pangasinan, City of ìDagupan, Barangay of Bonuan Gueset. Mark can be reached by ìservice vehicle from city proper by trailing along Bonuan road ìtoward Tanap bridge. Where mark is located at the NE end of the ìbridge. Mark is a copper nail embedded on a concrete curb of the ìbridge set flushed with concrete putty with inscription TAN 1990 ìNAMRIA. RMis BM TBM2 situated about 45 cm. NE of the station.

TANK, 1948-63 Is at San Fernando Harbor, the SE shore, about 350 m. SW from the ìfoot of Rizal St. in the yard of the Manila Railroad Co. An ìelevated steel tank serving as a water source for the railroad. ìThe center of the ball atop the tank was the point observed upon. ìStation was not marked or occupied.
TANK, 1972 The apex of a yellow water atop a steel structure about 35 ft. ìhigh located inside the FILMAG Compd., Fort Tagudin, Ilocos Sur.

TAR, 1952 Is located in Bo. Tangaoan, and is a drill hole in a rock approx. ì170 m. S of the top of the hill near the barrio. It is 5 m. S of ìthe largest tree of a group in that area, and 1.5 km. NW of the ìBureau of Forestry Bldg.

TETAS 2, 1952 To reach the station, leave the highway on the trail going E, ìnear Km. Post No.392 in Bo. Manueva. Station is located on the ìsummit of the N peak of the twin peaks of Mt. Tetas. Station mark ìis a brass cap set in center of a 6 in. square concrete monument, ìwith an "X" marking the point of reference.

TORRE, 1954 On the E shore of Port Currimao, in Bo. Torre, about 12 m. S of ìan old fort in this barrio and 12 m. back of the high water line. ìSubsurface mark is a coca-cola bottle buried 2.5 ft. below the ìground surface. Surface mark is the hole in the center of a cross ìout on top of a brass rod set in a concrete monument 19 cm. x 20 ìcm. and protruding 10 cm. above the ground. A triangle was etched ìon the monument around the brass rod. Reference mark (RM) No.1 is ìa porcelain plug set in a cement patty on the foundation of the ìold fort, 12 cm. W of its W face at the foot of the fort, with ìthe inscription "RM 1" and an arrow pointing towards the station, ìdistant 12.045 m. from the station, in azimuth 191° 45' 40". ìRM No.2 is a nail set in the center of a concrete monument 15 cm. ìsquare and protruding 5 cm. above the ground, distant 14.25 m. ìfrom the station, in azimuth 255° 19' 38". RM No.3 is a porcelain ìplug set in a concrete monument 18 cm. square and flush with the ìground surface, with the inscription "RM 3" and an arrow pointing ìtowards the station, distant 6.082 m. from the station, in ìazimuth 317° 43' 04".

TRI, 1958 Is on the W coast of Luzon, in the province of Pangasinan, on ìEbut Rock situated about 300 m. N of the NE edge of Boboruan ìIsland. Mark is the center of a crosscut on top of a 1/2 in. dia. ìbrass rod embedded in a drilled hole on top of the rock which is ìabout 3 m. in dia. with cement putty around and inscription ì"TRI".

UAYAG, 1954 Between Gabot Pt. and Lugot Pt. about 1.2 miles S of Gabot on a ìsmall grass covered sand dune between the high water line and the ìriver branching from Badoc River. The dune is N most and the ìlowest of a group. Station mark is a 3/8" brass rod with a cross ìmark on top set almost flush with the surface of a concrete ìmonument 1.2 ft. square at the top. Surbsurface mark is a ìcoca-cola bottle buried in an upright position about 25 cm. below ìthe ground. RM No.1 is the head of a 6 in. nail set flush with ìthe surface of a concrete monument 6 in. in dia. with the ìinscription "RM 1" and an arrow pointing to the station. The ìdistance from the station, 5.038 m., 290° 53' 21.4" in azimuth. ìRM No.2 is a porcelain plug set flush with the surface of a ìconcrete monument 1 ft. square at the top with the inscription ì"RM No.2" and an arrow pointing to the station. The distance from ìthe station, 7.39 m., 39° 4' 1.4" in azimuth.

UBBOG, 1903 On the S end of a prominent ridge, 0.7 km. E of the main road ìbetween Candon and Santiago, and 4 km. S of the latter town. It ìis 0.8 km. NE of Bo. Danao. Trails to both stations "Danar" and ì"Ubbog" branch off from the main road at the same place, one ìgoing E and the other W. The top of the hill is a short ridge ìrunning in a NW and SE direction. The station is on the NW end ìwhich is clear of all growth, the rest of the hill being covered ìwith bush and small trees. Station mark is a drill hole in top of ìan irregularly shaped rock weighing about 100 kg. The surface of ìthis rock was set flush with the surface of the ground. ìSubsurface mark is the center of a bottle buried at a depth of ì0.9 m.

UGSA, 1903-33 On top of a rocky hill on the range running S from Cape Bojeador ìLighthouse, at a distance of 2.2 km. from the latter. Between ìthis range and the coast is another range of much lower hills. ìThe summit on which the station stands is a little higher than ìany other near it, the only other higher ones being the smooth, ìround-topped hills to the E on which stations Talun and ìNagpartian are situated. The top of the hill is approx. circular, ìwith a nearly vertical cliff of about 5 m. in height. The top is ìalso flat and is covered with fine broken rock. Station is on the ìN side of the top on a rocky ledge about 0.6 m. higher than the ìgeneral gound level, about 20 m. E of a group of semi-detached ìrocks. Station mark is a drill hole in the solid rock over which ìa small cairn was built.

UNDER, 1901 Is on the NW corner of Narra Island on a small rocky point 600 m. ìW of a lagoon which runs into the N side of the island. The ìstation is on a coral rock, 0.6 m. x 0.9 m., situated 8.53 m. ìoutside of the high watermark at that point which station "Sand" ìon the S end of Santiago Island and station "High" on the S knoll ìof Poro Catipan can be seen by trimming the trees along the bank ìin either direction. Station mark is a copper bolt in the coral ìrock. Witness mark is a triangle cut on the trunk of a tree 14.17 ìm. behind the station.

VIGAN ASTRONOMICAL STATION, 1901-15 In the enclosure of the race track in the S outskirts of Vigan, ìabout 250 m. W of the road to Pandan. It is about 500 m. due S of ìthe chapel in the town cemetery, the true N line cutting the ìtower of the chapel near its center. Station mark is a stone, 78 ìcm. x 32 cm. x 9 cm., projecting 12 cm. above the ground. A 2 cm. ìhole was drilled 5 cm. deep in its top. On the N of the stone are ìcut the letters "U.S.C.G.S.". Subsurface mark is a stone, 32 cm. ìx 32 cm. x 6 cm., with a 2 cm. hole drilled in its center. ìWitness marks are two prominent masonry about 1.3 m. square at ìthe base and 3 m. high, built to mark the street intersections. ìThe nearest point pier is 55.46 m. from the station and the ìazimuth of its left tangent is 215° 1'. The nearest point of the ìE pier is 83.7 m. from the station and the azimuth of its left ìtangent is 249° 28'. Reported missing in 1915.
VIGAN CHURCH, 1952 Station is the center of the spire on the church at Vigan. This ìtower stands near the plaza, near the church and a separate ìstructure.

VILLARICA, 1903 On the N side of the Langlangca River at a distance of 3.5 km. NW ìof Candon, 1.6 km. from the beach and 0.5 km. NNE of a sharp bend ìin the river. This is the second sharp turn toward the right ìencountered is ascending the river from the sea. The station is ìon a wooded hill at the extremity of a low ridge extending SW ìfrom station "Balingaoan". The top of the hill was cleared of ìtimber. Station mark is a drill hole in the rock.
VINO BUILDING, STACK, 1903 The center of the smokestack of a wire factory on the W side of ìthe main road, 2 km. S of the town of Santa.

WRECK, 1948 Is in Lingayen Gulf, the E shore, immediately S of Bo. Poro. On ìthe SW shore of the small bay between San Fernando Peninsula and ìthe first point to the S. The top of the mast of the largest ìwrecked ship in the area. The center of the knob atop the mast ìwas the point observed upon. Station was not marked or occupied.

YOK, 1958 Is on the W coast of Luzon, in Pangasinan province, about 1.1 ìmile W of Alo Island and on the N side of So. Cayocay about 60 m. ìinland, at the base of a tree about 1 ft. in dia. Mark is the ìcenter of a crosscut on top of a 1/2 in. dia. brass rod embedded ìon top center of a 10 in. square concrete monument with its ìsurface flushed to the ground and with a circle circumscribed on ìthe mark and with the inscription "YOK 1958 PC&GS".

ZAPA NORTE, 1904 Is on top of the highest hill at the N end of the Mt. Sapa ridge, ìabout 4 km. WNW from the town of Burgos. It has an elevation of ì151 m. The barrio of Beleco lies to the NE of the station while ìthe barrio of Sapa lies to the SE. Subsurface mark is a bottle ìburied 45 cm. below the surface of the gorund in a vertical ìposition. Three bottles were buried around it horizontally with ìtheir necks pointing toward the station center. A ditch with a ìradius of 1.2 m. was dug around the station.

ZAPA SUD, 1904 Is on the S most hill of the Sapa range, about 3.5 km. N of Bo. ìUli in the N part of Dasol Bay. The hill is bare of trees but ìcovered with grass. The best starting point is from Uli. The Sapa ìRiver flows along the E base of the ridge and joins the Uli River ìimmediately S of the station. E of the stream is a bluff ìbordering the property of Fermin Naval and Esteban Abella. A ìtrial crosses the stream of this point and leads towards the top ìof the hill on which the station is located. Surbsurface mark is ìa bottle buried 45 cm. below the surface, neck up with three ìbottles buried around the center in a horizontal position, their ìnecks pointing towards the station. A ditch with a radius of 1.2 ìm. was dug around the station.

ZIG, 1958 Is on the W coast of Luzon, in the province of Pangasinan, on ìCaquiputan Strait, on the highest part of Dore Pt. Mark is the ìcenter of a cross cut on top of a 1/2 in. dia. brass rod embedded ìin a drilled hole on top of a rock, with cement putty around and ìinscriptions "PC&GS ZIG, 1958".

ZOO, 1958 Is on the W coast of Luzon, in the province of Pangasinan, on ìCaquiputan Strait, on a large coral rock on a point on the ìmainland and due W of the N edge of the broad point on Cabarruyan ìIsland situated immediately S of Narra Island. Mark is the center ìof a crosscut on top of a 1/2 in. dia. brass rod embedded in a ìdrilled hole on top of the highest part of a detached coral rock ìthat is about 2.7 m. in dia., with cement putty around and ìinscriptions "PC&GS ZOO, 1958".
